nHY814Q-WWp4WfQXkZqUvw.text: The salsa is my fav! Everything in this restaurant is handmade from scratch nothing canned! I asked!!!! I haven't had one thing on the menu I haven't loved.  Its a  must for authentic Mexican food!

wWLIqHfaIT7iEk7w8VFhRw.text: Atmosphere, Service and Food!  This place hits the marks on all three, from the moment that you enter the place you feel instantly relaxed, like your in an old mexican cantina, the service is top-notch! very team oriented, from the second that you take your seat a server is getting your drinks while another  is bringing you chips with two types of dips which are both awesome btw followed by yet another person with tomato soup! really well orientated. The food is delicious, I've had the fish tacos and camarones adelita there both great! bursting with flavor served in oversized portions, come hungry and be prepared to roll out of this place. My only gripe is the prices which can be a little on the high side, the camarones adelita is almost in the $20 range.  All in all, some of the best Mexican food I've ever had.

WP5-0LD12_Z8O2y9vmHvZw.text: What a surprise.  On the industrial North Side of town.    Guacamole made table side to taste.  Food was great, service was dialed in.  Price was reasonable.  Beats the heck out of those strip restaurants that shine up for tourists.

tfLok4pziE9X0RowFqtngQ.text: We were driving through on our way to Salt Lake City and stumbled across Viva Zapatas.  It was a wonderful find.  It seems to be a big favourite of locals, as it was almost full on a Sunday at 11:00 am.  Chips were brought to the table with salsa and bean dip.  The chips are so fresh, no mistaking them for store bought, and the dips truly tasty (salsa was a bit spicy).  We had Huevos Machaca with corn tortillas, so much meat that it was hard to find the eggs.  It was very tasty but I would have enjoyed a little more pico de gallo to add some texture.  Definitely worth the detour off the I-15

xDskYna1KQd1YyOq6NDjsA.text: I recently visited Zapatas on my latest visit to North Vegas. I went on a Friday night around 830 and YES this place had a very long wait. The parking area is pretty big which is a plus and its very good access for entering and exiting. My only complaint was there is hardly any place to sit when you are waiting for your food. There are two small benches on the inside and maybe two on the outside.  Most people sit in their car or on the little stoop outside the restaurant. Upon entering I was greeted by two lovely hostesses who gave me a menu since I wanted to take my food to go. I decided to sit at the bar and order my food. The bartender was amazing...................although they don't have a drink menu they have a FULLY STOCKED BAR......with some of the best tequila hands down. I had the Peach Margarita first and the alcohol was not scarce :-D. After less than 5 minutes of sitting at the bar we were given Chips, Salsa, and bean dip with cheese. It was so delicious and the chips were fresh and crunchy. The salsa had a little kick to it but I love things spicy...........  Around 20 minutes later I received my food.......I ordered Shrimp and Steak tacos with a side of Chicken tamales...........The steak tacos were pretty good the meat was flavorful and the tortillas were soft..........i did not care for the salsa that came with the tacos  but it wasn't bad........The Shrimp tacos were the highlight of my meal....the shrimp was plump and had just the right seasoning on them .......I immediately fell in love I wish I would have ordered more...... the onions and lettuce was fresh as well .....I don't think I have had shrimp tacos that were that good in a long time.......the tamales were good I wish it had more sauce on them but not too bad......they also came with olives on them which were pretty good. Overall I give this place a 4.......definitely worth coming back for a night out with the ladies for some good food and awesome drinks! If you are near Nellis AFB you surely have to try this place out!

FStAd0QvRnTNdiHAc4yuYw.text: Great restaurant, great food, great service.  The bartender, Jackie, makes a great Margarita!

BSKoRhK7eHua_00XCApa_Q.text: I have tried several Mexican food places in Las Vegas. This place is convenient and close to my house. The food is always good. Some times the servers can get a bit bogged down and can slow service. Parking here when the place is full is a pain. Over all a good place to grab some Mexican food if you live up North

nY-ZwPjGtI4h-_VARrhdpg.text: Top notch!! Everything on the menu is amazing and they make homemade tortillas like in Mexico in the corner of the restaurant. The design of the place is unique and very awesome to look at.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great place for family to eat

KqgD-caTalTrsftWg0V2YQ.text: I've been coming here for years, the service is always on point, the food here is always fantastic and the ambience is great with a live guitar player in the evening, their fresh baked flour tortillas remind me of my grandmas hot buttery delicious home made tortillas.., like I said, I've been coming here for many years, we love it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. oysters on a half shell, ..a little tapatio and lime.. freakin awesome!
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. a little &#34;preparada&#34;, (Bloody Mary mix with modelo especial) , always hits the spot!

0YZ9Oqhg4lKwDNP_Z5Hlqw.text: Never disappoints!  The fresh guacamole was on par.  The service was great.  My dad forgot to specify green sauce for his enchiladas and they remade his order without hesitation.  My chile relleno and chicken enchilada were just what I was craving.  The bean dip could've used some salt as it was bland.  My favorite Mexican food spot.  Will definitely return.

4GY8SxjbsMmXSNEuSptiKQ.text: Wow what an awesome meal. I had the chicken cognac and my husband had the rib eye with cognac. Very delicious!!! The meat was tender on the steak. The chips and salsa were accompanied by beans and fideo. The fideo was so good, very soup like, and very delicious. The main thing I would want to express is the attention to detail, especially the service was 10 stars. the staff all works together and they are on point. We never had to worry about our glasses being empty. The same thing with the chips and salsa and bean dip those never were empty. This place deserves all the stars asked then some. You will not be disappointed coming here to eat.

pb2YCVUN0go9bN4jJi8T4A.text: My Son and I were in the area volunteering at Three Square and decided to stop by here during our lunch break.  The parking lot was packed and we had to wait around 10 min for our table....this was at 12:10 pm, the worst time to be heading to lunch.  The wait was worth it though.  Once we were seated we browsed the menu and decided to order the Queso Fundido w/Chorizo appetizer ($6.95), Beef & Bean Chimichanga lunch special ($8.25), and Pollo Amador lunch special ($10.25).  I also asked the waiter if the cook could put together a really spicy Habanero Salsa for us....he said sure.    We were served complimentary Chips, Salsa, and Beans while we waited for our food....+1.  The Salsa reminded me of the Salsa at Lindo/Bonito Michoacan.  I read the menu that had the story of Zapata, but couldn't find any connection between the restaurants.....the Salsa was that close to one another.  Anyway, it was really good.....had a nice kick to it.  The Chips weren't as fresh as I like them to be....but they were good.  After a short wait our Queso Fundido came out....again, it reminded me of the one at Lindo/Bonito Michoacan.  It was very delicious.  On top of the dish is an extremely hot Pepper....I think it's a grilled Jalapeno or Poblano (see pics)....whatever it is, I like it.  I ordered the Beef & Bean Chimichanga and it came out a few minutes later....along with the Habanero Salsa.  The Beef was shredded and very delicious, not greasy.  Sometimes when you order a Beef Chimichanga it can be very greasy....not here.  It was a nice size too.....must be their lunch portion.  The Habanero Salsa was really spicy....just how I like it!  It added to the flavor.  My dish also came with Guacamole & Sour Cream and a side of Refried Beans & Rice.....all very good.  My Son enjoyed his Pollo Amador.  He gave me a bite to try it out.  It is Chicken marinated in Amador Sauce (whatever that is).  The Sauce had a slightly sweet tomatoey flavor to it.....it was very good.  Overall, it was a nice lunch.  Will we return?  If we're in the area and in the mood for some Mexican Food....you can count on it.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips &amp; Salsa
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

lNT7louIn6nzPoRlK8vTog.text: Affordable Mexican food with an authentic Mexican taste is hard to come by. Viva Zapata's is just that. A great atmosphere and even better food, Viva Zapata's has become my go-to restaurant for Lunch and Dinner. The customer service is head and shoulders above any other restaurant in the area. The front desk staff, the wait staff, and the bus staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. The food is prepared quickly and I am always able to get in and out for lunch in less than 45 minutes. When I have a big group the staff always accommodates us and we always leave satisfied. I will continue to support this wonderful business and I will always recommend it to my friends!

vUBaTd89i8VOnJ51VdU6Jg.text: Amazing mexican joint with homemade goodies. Had the fresh guacamole and the Menudo soup... wow just awesome great find near the LV office.

xhhO02I6G3BmGVTZmek_mA.text: I have always driven past this place, and wanted to give it a try. Last night I was finally able to try this place, and I can't say enough good things about this place!  The decorations and atmosphere of the restaurant seems very authentic. As we walked in, we were greeted by two beautiful smiles. We were seated within 10 minutes. It was quite crowded for a Sunday night.   I ordered the shrimp enchiladas and sangria. My husband had the beef tongue tacos. They give you as much chips and dips as you want, and our order also came with a delicious tomato noodle soup.   All of the food was delicious: Zapata's food is one of the best Mexican foods I have had. Whenever I get the munchies for Mexican food, I know where to come from now on.  Excellent service, and great food and drinks. Definitely would like to come back for my birthday celebration dinner!

QDVytxGGvtPxfXVvaJ58Hg.text: I love this place. The food is awesome, there is live music and micheladas are on point! I usually sit at the bar and the ladies are friendly and attentive. Two thumbs up!

PIYeZUO_w1fBEPt9EucpfQ.text: I'm always looking for a good mole. I decided to switch the standards enchilada sauce for the home made mole (extra $2.00 charge) but was disappointed. The vegetarian enchiladas were not something to write home about. Normally the sauce, tortilla and the filling (steamed vegetables) come together over all I would not order this dish again. I've had much better vegetarian enchiladas in other restaurant. This plate was not cheap I was disappointed. The beans had a good home made taste but the Spanish rice was not properly cooked hard texture. The staff was really kind in celebrating in singing at my daughters birthday dinner. Thank you.

xWeF_VNwl_m19cCdQMgo8A.text: First off, we are from San Diego and are absolute Mexican Food snobs, it must be authentic or we don't bother going. I can't stand the touristy mexican food on the strip so we were excited to try this small place off the beaten path in North Vegas. We went to Viva Zapatas based on positive Yelp reviews and recommendations from the locals and this place did not disappoint. If you are asking yourself if this place is worth the 20 minute drive from the strip, my answer is emphatically "HELL YES!" The tableside Guac is crazy awesome, fresh homemade hot tortillas and chips. Bean dip, salsa and soup are complementary too! I had the carne asada plate and it was on-par with the best I've had in San Diego. She had the Shrimp Fajitas and they were plump, grilled to perfection and plentiful. We will be visiting again soon.

Ub6kong-989p5dr_Nk-9GA.text: I've given this place three shots at different times.... they do a lot of business but the service and kitchen cannot keep up.  If you thinking of during work lunch... think twice.  30 minute wait to place and order and then another 20 to get your food...  might as well to get it to go...

uTPsZiwqth_7FAQ1YKpROw.text: One of my favorite Mexican food places!  The service varies, but the food is always delicious.  Very flavorful and prepared well.  My current favorite: the shrimp tacos.  The tortillas are made on site; I could just eat them plain, they are that good.    They offer a military discount for cardholders and there is a children's menu.

2dmIFs8LNxGNLZYPf0bZsQ.text: The food was just ok but I'm originally from Southern California so I'm used to really good Mexican food. However, the mango margaritas were amazing. I would go back many times for margaritas and the sopapillas (dessert).

GlC1q1UCQNA0ioWioGLHtw.text: I had the Carne Asada villa, hubby had three carne Asada tacos.  Everything was delicious!

t7aAWzMTx8KUtXEIpurEzQ.text: Best mexican restaurant ive been to in a long time. The service is always attentive & friendly. They always have a live musician and the atmosphere is kinda old style. The food, while a little on the pricey side is delicious. I always get the shrimp in garlic sauce. Freshly made tortillas. And the bottomless chips, beans and salsa are the best in town. The parking can be tough but its well worth it. Great place

jtSFA3hxJOoIU7BZLRilYQ.text: My daughter & I went for lunch and there was only 1 server with a large party of 12 people sitting next to us, it took over 40 minutes to get fish tacos & chimichanga, I had complained prior to getting food and came down with food poisoning the next day!! I would NOT eat there!!

boKOURe9kwdzWfBnMFMytA.text: An Ok Mexican Restaurant SLOW Service. Food not as authentic as hoped for.

D-gfOlI7yIRYsKGQmdbzBw.text: Finally got to eat here again after a couple years. I love the food here and some of the people remembered me and came up to say hi after a long absence (made me feel good, used to eat here a lot) My favorite is the Chlie Colorado & Chile Verde. For breakfast you cant beat the Machaca and also great Menudo. They have a lady making the best corn tortilla's (you would swear they're flour when you look at them)  The only drawback is the Parking. Hit lunch a little early or later if you dont want to circle the lot waiting for people to leave.

UIE5K7Fh1gyrLoH_UTAy_Q.text: The portions are pretty small for the price. I mean rice and beans are definitely filling your plate more than the actual meat. Overall though, it was yummy and service was great.

Q3CUuMfKGmPWeKE_h_c1dQ.text: Strong drinks, amazing food, revolutionary decor... What more could you ask for? So happy I came here!

AJai6Mlk567ku6lsfO141g.text: This restaurant is conveniently down the street from Nellis Air Force Base, and although I wouldn't call it perfect mexican, the food was delicious. I had the carne asada and highly recommend it. It was tender, juicy, and cooked just right. The staff was really friendly but it seemed like they were shorthanded and it was fairly busy. All in all I'd definitely go back for the carne asada, however I wouldnt call it one of my top 5.

x2t82YzzzNm-lXJ34nc2oQ.text: How lucky am I? After returning to Las Vegas from golfing at Wolf Creek I happened to stop for gas at a seven eleven and asked the lady behind the counter if she could recommend a good Mexican restaurant. Of course she directed me a mile up the road to Zapatas. There were no large tables available so they sat me across from the bar at a little two seater table. The chips salsa and beans practically followed me to the table....amazingly quick service. The wait staff offered service with a smile and the food was delectable! The offerings are so vast I had trouble deciding between a burrito or the pollo a cognac. The waiter steered me towards the chicken dish and I wasn't disappointed. The creamy sauce was out of this world and the chicken was tender and sauteed with onions and mushrooms. I was pleased to stumble upon this local gem and you better believe I will go out of my way to return on my next trip to sin city!

t8YF7AcQSU7Wf5HnfF31AA.text: Great place for the entire family. The menu, though only Mexican food, was broad enough to deliver satisfaction even to the picky eaters. I had a Carne Asada dish and  it was spectacular. The meat was tender and very well seasoned. the environment inside the restaurant was quite enjoyable. The decoration is very traditional and cultural. The service was impeccable as well. The food was delivered relatively promptly considering it is made to order. The dishes didn't seem rushed. Each dish was carefully and cleanly served. I highly recommend this place for anyone who wants an authentic Mexican taste.

IwyfdzL2-PHWJX1WH67txg.text: Whao!  This is authetic mexican food. The chips were fresh, beans were delicious, the salsa was perfect. Noy to mention the guacamole, it was made to perfection. The food was beyond delicious. I will be back.

YVSsbGauT74w1Eh1e-OM3w.text: order the coca-cola pork, you're welcome.

WigbDb4aii6kYO6lyRFc5g.text: Five star Guacamole!!!  They prepare it so awsome right next to your table, fresh as can be... My daughter loves avacado , so if the kids are into it, it's a  winner no matter what... Theres a guy who plays his guitar  & it makes for great atmo...

kkZSdQAKV1O1Ja4HS3nN2Q.text: My boyfriend and I went to Vegas and coming From a Mexican families down south of Texas.... as south as you can get, I was a little skeptical eating Mexican food here. We decided to take the risk and were impressed. The service was excellent and so fast! The food, although differently prepared, was delicious. I had never had enchiladas that were filled with shredded beef. My honey absolutely loved his food also. We were almost going to ask for someone to roll us out...that's how much we ate. I will admit that the sopapillas were a little thicker than what I'm used to but still very good. Definitely recommended!!

rbS7PS6rmoac-zxpCmZdWQ.text: I had the 7 mares caldo. Great taste. The caldo had a lot of sea food.  service was also great. Got seated right away. Hey also had this amazing salsa. I'll be back to try the camarones.

iuHGTP-LCGMj67Fczc70YA.text: Great food and wonderful service!  Nothing to complain about the Restaurant itself, the outside area unfortunately is not the most safest part of town. But if you venture out to North Las Vegas I recommend you stop by for some delicious authentic style Mexican food.

I0Q6CoFW1F7sm26O-97yPQ.text: Best Mexican restaurant in town and a local favorite. They have a full bar and a wide variety of lunch specials. Try the guacamole; they make it at your table. Great food and even better service. I'm a regular and am never disappointed.

evTjdFAtUq5xFS0Gx7zMFA.text: Been here twice and really enjoyed it both times, this time our server wasn't as attentive as we would have liked but it still wasn't bad.  All the food was great with the exception of the Monetary Jack queso 'dip'...there is NO dipping about this at all it was a pile of grease with some melted cheese in the middle.  I have had queso at many mexican restaurants and I love it this is something I would never eat again:(

Q10F3IpmSLLOfS8m8aDEzg.text: If I could give this place 10 stars I would. This place has the best wait staff and the food is awesome. Having moved from Texas we were looking for some authentic Mexican food, and we definitely found it here. The atmosphere is nice as well; it's very laid back plus they have a live singer. What more could you ask for? All around it was an great experience that I will be doing again and again. This place made me miss home.

8KEEU8yVNPbXdmCNtAOhSg.text: True to its theme, this restaurant offers great food and great service from the moment you walk in until you step out. The hostess was welcoming and prompt to seat us. Our server was friendly and efficient.

R1Os465tY4bykfud6uDkPQ.text: I have been to this place several times and have not been disappointed with the food. Service has always been good. The soup broth is a tad thin for me, but everything on the menu is very tasty. I am usually not a fan of Spanish rice, but I will eat the rice here. That's a big compliment!

4FrY0hetzcNKT_WMpSDA9Q.text: My hopes were very high with the rave reviews. I'm still on the hunt for the best carne asada burrito in Vegas.   Carne asada burrito Zapatas special- 3 stars. The special has sour cream, guacamole, and some other stuff inside. It was okay...I've had better.  Beef chimichanga- 5 star. It was my friend's dish and it was def better than mine. It was fried to perfection and the shredded beef was delicious!   Free chips and salsa- super super good. I almost want to say their chips are the best I've ever had. I keep saying that it seems, but I swear these are reaalllllllly good chips. The salsa was good, only because it has a major kick to it.   Service was excellent.   I'm giving 3.5 stars. I'll be back for the chips and the chimichanga someday.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn tortilla chips and spicy salsa- delicious!!!!
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef chimichanga- delicious!!!
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside of the carne asada burrito

9T8-15hthwWiO5kgVUjQKw.text: I loved this place. My spouse and I ate here tonight and the sopitas we're wonderful, the flautas we're crispy and fresh, and the enchiladas hit the spot. Chips, salsa, and beans without a word to start. Excellent margarita, so my better half attests. The service was impecable (we are both former servers). Laid back, low key, just right. We will be back.

WPRjKHhZk-sS2BhvrvFAPQ.text: Good service! Good food! Friendly environment! Bartender  " Grace " the best!  Highly recommend!

sMEFmvGSRZu80m_VQWjd_A.text: I love YELP for helping me find spots like this. I probably would have just drove by if I hadn't had read the reviews. I am not a local, but we visit Nellis AFB once a year and ALWAYS stop for a meal here.   Ordered a Cadillac margarita and Fajitas. Homemade flour tortillas with steak, chicken and shrimp? Sold! I love that they serve bean dip with the chips. Bar area is nice, but service was a little slow.   Overall the restaurant is pretty small, so it can be busy. Parking can also be an issue. We will continue to visit when in the area. Appreciate the Military Discount. Love when businesses recognize our men & women who serve.

WtNK2wn57aoKI5Grh0cRTg.text: Had lunch with a friend here and I have to say that the food was excellent.  The only reason I'm knocking it down was that the service was very slow.  It took some time to get our orders even though it wasn't very busy when we came in and several people who came in after we ordered got their orders first.  Thankfully neither of us had anywhere we needed to be so we rolled with it.  I would come back for the food, I just wouldn't try it when I had to be somewhere else in a certain time.

WzZL6Ptj1qB0AogW02Qrjg.text: We stumbled upon this hidden gem spending the night in NLV passing through town. The menu has a ton of offerings and made it difficult to narrow down what to order.  The chips with bean dip and salsa were a first and really good too! Drink specials including beer and cocktails made with their house tequila were great.  I ordered the Carne Asada "Villa" and have to say it was the best I've had. Keep in mind I've ordered this plate all over LA, OC and SD and none compare to Viva Zapatas. The steak was seasoned perfectly and cooked to perfection!   If you're in NLV, do yourself a favor and eat here!

S8mjgAAszaWOqGdeNXxT8Q.text: Authentic, flavorful and delicious. I love that they have items on their menu that you can't find in most Mexican restaurants. I also loved the handmade flour tortillas. I believe every entree comes with a side of soup, which I really enjoyed. My friend ordered one of the carne asada plates. The one broiled in lemon juice and spices... sooo good. I had the shrimp that was cooked with a mayonnaise-based sauce. It's good if you like mayo lol! Very different but definitely good. Oh and Did I mention fee chips, salsa, and bean dip? All of which tasted really good. Lastly, the ambience inside has a certain charm and warmth, which is inviting. I'll be coming back here time and time again.

DWaxYfxjVxSonKhP_2X6WA.text: FD dinner at Viva Zapata's in NLV... Service was horrid... supposed to have soup with entree, they said "You didn't get soup?"... Waited for butter for tortilla and water so food got cold...and topper was they could have cared less... $39 tab (no booze) and NO attempt to make things right... Sad part of the story was table side guac was GREAT... can't tell about the rest of my meal as it was ICE COLD when I finally got water and butter... Viva Zapata's gave me a ROTTEN Father's Day dinner... Ole!

bkXfR4QdxhQ4kjXSeQUSuw.text: Beautifully decorated with great service was great, the food fell short.  I was not impressed with the salsa, or chips.  There were more rocks than margarita and the soup they served was an extremely thin tomato.  The sopitas were pretty good, but not great.

kiO9lFd1yaEQd3oba7VPJg.text: Order the Prepriado! Micheladas are my favorite and they're delicious here!!  Foods always amazing!!  The lunch specials is a great deal about $10!  M-F 11-3. $4 tostada fills me up!!  Love love that they serve beans with fresh made chips and salsa!!  This is my toddlers lunch!!  The steak fajitas are a favorite!!  The seasoning is so flavorful and makes the onions and peppers super tasty!!  I've ordered them mixed but I prefer the steak!!  Service is always great and the food comes out in no time!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak fajitas
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fajitaa

ANzAFcAn6LWIOU6D8ydn5g.text: This place was delicious. Good food and great service. If you are looking for a good place to eat I highly suggest coming here.

wQNyHeODYiT-Plu_-5plBA.text: The best Mexican, hands down.   For starters, the homemade chips, salsa and beams are incredible. I don't even like retried beans, and I couldn't stop eating them. The salsa is thicker and slightly spicy - delish.   Margaritas are some of the best that you will let past your lips. Whether you prefer frozen or on the rocks, they are delightful and hard to refuse a refill.   Fideo soup. Fideo soup! This soup will keep you coming back for more, as they have truly ramped up the flavor. It is perfectly clear that they have poured love into the broth. It's delicious!  Do not get the tacos al pastor if you want to be able to eat them somewhere else. The flavor is knock-you-on-your-ass good. The meat bursts on your tastebuds just before the pineapple sweetness starts to tango. It's phenomenal. I will never be able to order this anywhere else.   The service was impeccable. The staff constantly checking and asking you how you are enjoying it, refilling beverages and truly interested in your visit. They will box your food for you, and everything is fine with a genuine smile. The live music on Friday nights brings together the circle of authenticity.   So where is the fifth star? In the non-existent parking lot. This is the only improvement that needs to be made. We parked at the gas station, and we're lucky to get the last spot on the whole block.   We're stoked that this place is right down the street from us, cuz we will be back - frequently!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Fideo soup is outstanding.
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Have to give this a try sometime.
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best margaritas around.

UwKWKMsEn-GKaDexcQ6YaA.text: Best authentic Mexican food and atmosphere anywhere in Vegas. Service was outstanding.

nDgHU_aKQjG7zCfNMZ3hBA.text: We read the mixed reviews and decided to try Zapatas and were glad we did. Hubby and I both had shrimp tacos. The shrimp was large and each taco contained 4 shrimp each. The salsa is very different from what we are used to but, we really enjoyed it. The side of refried beans to eat with your chips was a nice touch as was the soup. Service was excellent and the food was excellent. Prices were higher than most Mexican restaurants but the quality made up for it. We felt we got what we paid for.

JX9S38fpQNxww9RDG2vp1g.text: This was an excellent new find for me!  A complimentary cup of Fideo Soup was a nice prelude to a veritable Mexican feast after downing also complimentary warm homemade Tortilla Chips in a mellow Bean Dip and spicy hot Red Salsa.  A made to order Guacamole Dip prepared tableside by our wiatress was excellent with a freshly opened avocado and just the right amount of lime, cilantro, and other seasoning.  White Onions, Jalapeno Peppers, and pieces of tomato enhanced this yummy dish.  Next up for me was a 17 Tecala Combination Plate, consisting of a suitably soft Chile Relleno and a fine Green Chile Pork & Bean Burrito, along with a Shredded Beef Taco prepared with a requested crunchy hard shell that was ordered ala carte.  The beef was a little soggy; otherwise everything was tasty.  To help fill the gut were included Refritos and Mexican Rice.  Diane enjoyed a large Shrimp Quesadilla executed with a Flour Tortilla, melted Cheddar Cheese, and cut up pieces of shrimp.  Our meal was accompanied by fine guitar music and singing.  Service was friendly, quick, and excellent all around.  Water glasses were repeatedly refilled without request.  4-1/2 stars overall!  I will surely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. #17 Tecala (Chile Relleno &amp; Green Chile Pork &amp; Bean Burrito with Refried Beans &amp; Rice
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guac, Salsa, &amp; Tortilla Chips
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guacamole!

BkhwDCVBV75RT--ho-zcbg.text: I never knew this place existed and must have driven past here hundreds of times.  I love their chimichanga and beef lunch burrito. Jorge is our server most of the time. Everyone is very friendly and professional.  Food usually takes 15 minutes or so to come out.

23FGoxhXIa6rTpa_Le-stQ.text: Stopped by today to see what all the hype was from my friends and lemme tell you this place gots the sauce. Chips n dip were phenomenal! Best I've had in my life, the warm chips covered in the cool salsa gave it the right amount of zing sensation! I couldn't decide on what to eat but when I saw panchita making those freshly home made tortillas I knew it didn't matter ! Plus any place that serves hennesy is an automatic winner, will definitely be coming back in the near future.

zvN-WA6ytG8K479eENASeA.text: The food is great pero watch for the outrageous up sale on margaritas. Seriously, $25 for a margarita?  Talk about rip off!! When asked he chuckled, wow! This is one time that I was the tonto gringo. That part of this family business just sucks. I think that banner with "best in LV "dates back to 2012 for a reason. Guess that's why the banner is still up.

syV01k1jbBB1uvXfQsFuvw.text: We heard about this place and decided we had to try it out. Drove way the hell out Craig in N Vegas to find it. Place is dark inside and decorated with a cross between Mexican Revolutionary and Farmer. Staff was very friendly and actually very good. We ordered appetizer of the Quesadilla that was damn good. Also the chips, salsa and bean dip that was great as well. I had the Enchilada, Taco and Burrito combo. This was good, only drawback was kinda room temperature, not hot. The parts that I ate were very tasty. Scary when the meat is only room temperature, so doubtful that I will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

R9JVQVnPFWWIQMyuPD7zJQ.text: The food is excellent here. I love the beans and salsa they bring to the table. I've had several dishes and have never been unhappy worth any of them.  It's a little but pricey, but you get a lot for your money.   I loved the live music when we were there last.  I've always had great servers that offer suggestions and are accommodating.

UxsBT3RjW2V9xeU_0rZi1Q.text: Table side guac is great, distinctive mexican dishes prepared with care.  It looks as good as it tastes.  Lunch is a little less money, but the real deal happens with the full menu.  Also like the guitar man and it is busy, but a nice atmosphere.  Second time there and I'm bringing my mexican son-in-law back next time.   I vote yes.

Q7gfz_FAE_mBRuuOaOh3Ig.text: I had not been to this restaurant in over 6 years. I walked in today just to be treated by a rude hostess. She claimed there were no tables available but everyone that came in after me was seated promptly. I waited around but I was never offered a table. We ended up leaving. I don't think ill be returning any time soon.

2DVMeH2zzC8_Xyz_DSMqIg.text: They have some of the best guacamole in town!  This is an intimate little place, only about 20 tables or so plus a bar area.  The hostess stand is very disorganized and waiting space is limited, however the bar is a great place to kill time.  Bartender is awesome, super friendly, and she even brought out some chips and salsa for us to snack on while we had a beer and waited for our table.  Somehow the hostess got confused and forgot we were waiting at the bar and marked us off the list, but we got it all resolved.    The food, oh my goodness, the food is muy delicioso!  It took a little while to come out, but it was well worth the wait.  I had the sizzling fajitas de camarones with their yumazing handmade flour tortillas and he had the pollo estilo reforma agraria, which is a vinegar marinaded chicken dish.  We also loved that they have a lot of huevos dishes not limited to breakfast hours.  And like other yelpers have noted, the parking lot is tiny.  Knowing this ahead of time helped me mentally prepare to be patient and creative with my parking options.

sXWgWLN1p6tO-25EEWBTdA.text: Whenever my husband is craving Mexican food, we head over to Viva Zapatas!  They are just as good as Lindo (if not better), but without the super high price.  The food is always great and they keep the homemade chips and salsa/bean dip coming.  If you order guac, they make it right at the table.  They usually offer a complimentary cup of soup as well.  What I really love about Zapatas is that they always accommodate my picky food needs and never make me feel badly about it.  The service is top notch!  They also have one of the best margaritas in Vegas!  They have a great happy hour from 2p.m.-6:00 p.m. (I think) M-F with 2 for 1 drinks - you can't beat it!  I love the live music every night and since they are located so close to the Galaxy Theater in the Cannery, it's the perfect date night restaurant too!  The restaurant is a bit hard to find since they are in the same lot as a gas station (if you are coming off of the Craig Rd. exit on 95 - turn towards Pecos Road and you can't miss it) but I promise, it's worth it!  Zapatas is definitely an Eastside hidden gem!

z19q9NTWXLEdIOF_jZ1gdA.text: I've visited this place 3 times in the past year.  I'm from California...but whenever I'm in town i make a point to come here. It sometimes has a wait but that's because the corn tortillas are made fresh on site and the micheladas are outstanding! I've brought my toddlers here and they love the chips which are served with a bowl of warm refried beans along with salsa. They have a great kids coloring menu with several choices.  They also have a small bar,  if you're not dining with kids. This visit, the service was less than great and the hostess was pretty inept but in the past the service was wonderful. I will be back.

OzwFT8wWobffmWCOlXc98A.text: Me and my fiance come to eat here every other weekend. we love to sit at the bar since the service there is great. The food is delicious. I have probably tried every shrimp plate on their menu and they are all good but my fave is Shrimp Fajitas! you have got to try those if you go here. Their margaritas can be a bit strong but that's  not a problem with me... For sure they get a 10/10 from me. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. 7 Mares!

sb9BwJhqq8HDURG6qyZ-UQ.text: I come here every so often. It's never been impressive or exquisitely good. The service is always just ok and the food is always borderline ok. However today I went and ordered their chilaquiles with steak, the difference with steak and without is 8 dollars, so I expected a nice piece of meat. When the food arrived I was surprise with a piece of meat that was so small I was unable to classify the cut the server said it is a 4 ounce piece but I would hesitate to say it was more than 2 ounces. We spoke to the manager and they reiterated that it was the right size I refused to pay and just stuck with my chilaquiles. I never expect much but this time it was just outrageously bad servings and service.

YbxyheMFMjzcjTgaLi20YQ.text: Still the best!! Delicious food, bomb drinks, great service. What else can u ask for. Must try!!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Camarones tierra liberta. Muy ricos
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Ranchero muy rico

PCLs1sjcFgruERsmwEXO1A.text: Amazing food....! We had Jose as our server and he was amazing also!!! We are from California and we will be back next time to visit again

93Jo2nCuSqHAKycd5jYX3g.text: Excellent food, very nice staff and beautiful live music. Very clean with a warm, cozy atmosphere. If this place were closer to my house, it would be my destination every time we go out to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great chips, salsa and bean dip. Very good soup served before main course. 6 good sized, delicious floutas per serving.

JDe72yuBir36K6Nr8TIEeg.text: The after dinner mint on the front counter caught my attention more than the food we paid for. Bland, overpriced, tasteless are just a few of the adjectives I'd use to describe  'Viva's' food. I'm sorry, but refried beans and pre-cooked rice are not authentic Mexican. Unless you consider Del Taco authentic. If you do, I feel sorry for you.  They were busy, and we waited for half an hour. That is not a complaint. Just a fact.  Once seated the waiter appeared quickly to take our drink order. (Margaritas) Those were fine. Chips and salsa soon followed. Salsa was as bland as the refried beans that came at the same time.  The menu is extensive, but I'd venture a guess not much different than what we ordered. Bland.  I had a combo with beef, ( had a huge blob of fat in the middle) pork in a salsa verde (green salsa) and a very greasy chicken taco. With of course, red rice and beans.  My fiance had chicken enchiladas in a flavorless green sauce. To be fair, she enjoyed the rice.   Save some money, go to the Del Taco.

A5ViRTab-YsG4VKB87-oVQ.text: I've eaten here many times. It's proximity to home and work made it my go-to Mexican spot most of the time, but it's not my favorite spot, or favorite Mexican in Vegas. It's pretty good, a must try.  I'm not their biggest salsa fan, but it's spicy so I enjoy that. The table side guacamole is very good. The menu is large, items are  priced a bit higher than I prefer, but the portions are huge. I've enjoyed their quesadillas with shrimp, avocado shells stuffed with shrimp and pico, and most of all the fideo. Honestly, I always came for beer and fideo. I felt the fish and shrimp tacos were quite bland, and the burritos are packed with way too much meat and nothing else.  The service is always friendly. It gets very busy here, so beware of that. I have waited longer than I'd like to admit for food here. A decent spot, but not the best.

dGA0RcFVe4o6VAlmfNgVRw.text: I've been here two times so far this year. Both times I was not disappointed. I'll share my most recent experience. Came today about lunch time. Promptly seated. Chips, beans, and ridiculously good salsa shop up at the table right after being seated. drink order taken immediately. Their staff worked together to keep us happy. Our drinks never saw the bottom of the cup. I appreciated that because there's nothing more annoying than the wait staff letting your cup sit empty while your trying to wash down your meal.   I had the carnitas fajitas with corn tortilla. These were THE BEST carnitas I have had in my life this far. Incredible flavor! My bf had shredded beef tacos with the crunch shell. He really enjoyed it.   They also have a little station in the corner of the restaurant where they have a lady making fresh flour and corn tortillas. I haven't tried the flour so I can't comment on those. But the corn tortillas are amazing too. The best.   I look forward to visiting this place again.

Hx3cR0PJQyfslrhqD66Mbw.text: Fast and friendly service. My glass was never empty and chips and salsa never stopped. Highly recommend!!

gE9hGEpN1LB1iiKY0pGVBA.text: When I went, there was live music and I really loved the authentic feel to it. The food was amazing with generous portions and the customer service was quick and excellent. I never had an empty glass of water through the entire meal. The only thing I didn't like was the dirty sticky menus but I'll live.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. There&#39;s a bar. Their food and service is absolutely amazing

MSFdemRg82uuDu5kCnFiAg.text: What a great restaurant, fresh tortillas being made daily. This place has a good menu for seafood that makes it a great spot to visit. Prices for dinner are good, but you have to check out their lunch menu, incredible deal. Overall, the best part is the waiters in the restaurant, incredible service and you can bet on never having to wait for drink refills.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Snapper

WIJ-PL6Cb7IAbGZtBDL98w.text: The first time I went there I got enchiladas and they weren't that great so about a year went by and I decided to try them again and end up getting a different plate, it was the nachos on the appetizer and it was so good. The Margaritas are worth trying at least once if you ever go. I got a nice buzz off of just one so they don't skip out on the liquor.

-wKNjrpDKLCFmFVPEaKqCg.text: Excellent food! There was someone playing the guitar which really brought it home for me. Definitely my new favorite Mexican restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great chips and salsa! You can&#39;t ever go wrong with a corona!

rV7VRPfKDbSLbtCUufEkgg.text: The guacamole at Viva Zapatas is absolutely delicious, made form scratch, and made to order. It's a meal in itself!!!   You get bottomless chips so be careful and save room for the delicious pork, beef, chicken and seafood options Viva's menu offers.  NOTE: parking is limited especially during busy hours, additional parking can be found behind Zapatas.   Staff: courteous and friendly   Seating: only indoor, plenty of room for large parties. Bar area has stools and seating for approximately 20 people.   Full bar, lots of tequila brands.   Dress code: casual   Menu: lots of options! I've never had a bad meal here. I'm a big fan of the carne asada, and the chimichanga.    Service: the service is usually quick, but at peak hours (lunch) you may have a little bit of a wait.  Make sure you've got more than an hour to eat, if you're going to stop by at lunch time.   Bottom line, if you're looking for good Mexican food this should be one of your stops.

4bhbaln0MsVT5a1G3EdNtg.text: OMG! This place is hands down my new favorite place in town! a few of my girlfriends and I went and it was amazing! I LOVED all of my food and omg the soup! The soup is amazing! i didn't want to quit eating it! The guacamole was so amazing and they make it right in front of you so that was a really cool experience!! I can't wait to go back! I can't wait to take my husband!!

BjwzaqmNZkxE7Qi_pWm-uQ.text: This place was soo good! Little bit of a wait but honestly worth every minute. Cool antique look inside and the food was amazing, especially the soup they give with each meal. Will definitely be going back here!

esZZMYiz8c84d3mfQvLnog.text: I've celebrated 3 birthday and multiple events at this restaurant   Everything is absolutely delicious  The staff is not only very kind and respectful but they are also very upbeat and you can tell that they genuinely like working there   As far as the food goes I have to give all my praise to there Steak al Cognac. I huge New York steak seasoned with Cognac and drizzled with mushrooms and that buttery white cream sauce  That Paired with a Corona MeChilada. There is not any other restaurant in Las Vegas that could serve a better dinner plate

m_ca4JElw_XL3AgaxsmdLQ.text: Viva Zapatas is delicious. What other restaurant will literally make the guacamole in front of your face? I have yet to try anything on the menu that I did not enjoy. Everyone I bring here loves it!! Best Fideo in town. Thank you Viva Zapatas for the party in my tastebuds without the party on the toilet :)

NUcvDmf0desC0jA5hd9C0g.text: The food here was exquisite. I had their tacos. They were extremely delicious. They have really good lunch specials. Basically the lunch specials are the full course meals but in smaller orders which is really good. Most lunch specials come with beans and rice. They serve you chips and salsa in the beginning which is a really good appetizer. I would recommend coming here for lunch to all my friends and family.

aFhILtP9rhdI10GCXdoh6Q.text: The best Mexican restaurant north of the border. Excellent food, Excellent service, Excellent attitude.

g7MdEFmjmm4548KHHBglLA.text: My darling husband had the brilliant idea of going to get Mexican for breakfast on Saturday.  He had stopped here during the week one day while we were moving and was pretty impressed.  I couldn't wait to try it.   We arrived bright and early, since they open at 9:00am.   We were greeted right away, and shown to our seats.   Our server, Jesus, was fast, polite, and very friendly.  We liked him a lot.    They bring out chips, salsa, and refried beans, which were all awesome.  The salsa had this amazing smokiness to it, with a good heat, and nice, thick (but not chunky, if that makes sense) consistency.    I ordered the chicken and beef enchilada, served with beans and rice.   The enchilada was great.  Both meats were shredded, tender, and full of flavor.   Smothered in delicious cheese, too.   The beans were good too.  The rice wasn't anything to write home about.  Kind of bland, and they put lima beans in it, which is really weird.    Fella had a chili verde burrito and chile rellenos.  WOWZA.  Both of these were delicious.  The Chile relleno was a little too spicy for me, but he loved it.   We will most definitely be back, I need to try a margarita!!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile verde bean burrito,  chile rellenos, and a salad. Delicious!
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Echilada with shredded beef and chicken.   Awesome
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato noodle soup

0l7cX82BlBZ7hAqVZiv35Q.text: Literally the worst service I have ever experienced from start to finish. Spent over an hour and a half JUST WAITING, quac, took forever. Food, even longer and EVERYTHING was wrong. Even a simple bean and cheese burrito was messed up. Tried to explain to the manager that the food, and ESPECIALLY the service was absolutely not ok. Somehow no one seemed to care anyway? Was told they were "fixing" things and "talking to the cook" but that took 20+ minutes as well...still standing here practically begging for a check which is insane. DO NOT GO HERE. So disappointed it's unreal.

R0U6KHl5XW81WctplflyFg.text: My 1st time trying this restaurant when we moved to Vegas and I was really in love with the food and the customer service is excellent as well. Even tho now I don't live to close to the location any longer I still make it a point to come and eat here when I want great Mexican food. Highly recommended.

bXDw2YfwFCodmj9L1WZT4Q.text: Amazing vibe to this restaurant. Great food and great service. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a reasonably priced authentic Mexican food meal.

x9M9ornrTc43z7rk2pvlOQ.text: Absolutely terrible service. We were sat pretty quickly around 3:30 and it was very quiet. It took 15 minutes for them to take our drink order and then another 20 minutes to get them (all non alcoholic drinks). We ordered guacamole which took 25 minutes to come out. When we received our food after and hour and 20 minutes waiting they had messed up the order. We asked to speak to the manager who said she would help us but it took 20 minutes where we got to the point we demanded the check and paid the bill and walked about. The customer service was non existent. I could not be more disappointed. I would never go back and never recommend this place, if there was an option to give them a zero a would.

xIpJvjH1J9BTlrjGyPea5g.text: My partner and I love this place. Little hole in the wall... but the best Mexican food in Vegas! this is our go to place when family and friends are in town.

HvnWXe9RsKl5zBh30JwTPA.text: I don't know how this place has such good reviews we both ordered tacos and they were soggy maybe we just went on a bad day but not good mexican food unfortunately. Sad Bc we have yet to find good Mexican in Nevada but we are new so I'm sure we will in time. And it's not cheap we each got 3 taco meal and a soda and it was 45 dollars.

UJ2ekNK5i8DV9kLjS1aLlA.text: My wife and I love this restaurant. Outstanding service every time. And their beef fajita's are the best we've ever had outside of Pappasito's when we lived in TX. We visit Las Vegas and always take time to come here.

ksdoot00mX1uCYg7Gti9ZA.text: Love this place, every time am in Vegas have to stop by. Food is great. Service is great. You must try the shrimp cocktail. Great place to go with the family or with the fellas to have a few beers. Great selection at the bar as well. If you haven't given this place a try what are you waiting for. Go...

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

0FgKdPm8ZAmRYMI_XvCoew.text: This place is  the food is delicious and it's quality, they give u complimentary chips with beans and salsa that's soo delicious and a soup ! We sat by the bar and the bartender was soo friendly, the hospitality was def there, I felt like I was at my family's house

mFP4I8_aw6DmkHEDpO4Ldw.text: Our families favorite Mexican restaurant in the North part of the valley - by North I mean if you drew a line straight across the valley in the middle and included Summerlin and the NW.   Everything is always fresh.  The chimichangas are never greasy.  Chips always fresh and crispy.  Nothing is over seasoned - perfectly spiced.  Service is prompt and friendly.  The atmosphere is casual and clean.   Music is never too loud.  Your drink is never empty!  Parking lot can be tricky but worth the effort!

NC88ZqhGon6xVzbn88ti5Q.text: This place is fantastic. The atmosphere was pleasant and the food was top-notch. Prices weren't bad for a full sit-down restaurant. Salsa was excellent. Definitely going back here.

h9Z7YI8rgbC6zZYd7mjM_g.text: First time posting on Yelp. As a former waiter, I am generally very understanding. I went to this place because it looked good, seemed pretty authentic when I walked. Menu is fairly robust.  Ordered some Don Julio 1942 tequila. Typically $25 - $35 a glass. They sent me a glass of some cheap liquor. Perhaps they thought I wouldn't notice. No one who orders Don Julio 1942 would not be able to tell the difference. I had to have it exchanged.   Asked for some pico de gallo, never got any. Ordered ceviche, it took well over 10 minutes to get to me. This was pretty good, portion was large. Ordered cheese enchiladas in mole sauce and a side of guacamole. About 20 minutes later, the busser came by and started to remove the chips, etc. He asked me if I was done, I said, no, I haven't gotten my dinner yet. Another 10 - 15 minutes later they drop the plate and leave. Food is on the border of being burnt. And, I have no fork.  Eventually I am able to flag someone down for a fork, and start to eat. Cheese enchiladas are filled with chicken. I set it aside a wait again for my waiter.  Mind you, when I sat down, there were only two other tables, and at least two servers. Two 3 tops got seated after me plus a table of about 6-7 local police. Plenty of coverage that I shouldn't be ignored for 15 minutes at a clip.  Busser finally comes by, starts to take my plate, asking if I am done. I say no, I would like the meal I ordered. 5 minutes later, my waiter comes by to see what's wrong. I explain the food is wrong, he sets out to get it fixed.  At this point I've been there for an hour, and have been served the wrong thing twice. I go find my waiter, tell him to forget it, as I am concerned what the kitchen will send out. I tell him I will pay for what I ate/drank, but do not want wait to see what the kitchen sends out or how long it might take.  Go up and pay, waiter says he is going to get the manager. AFTER I pay. So I wait for a few minutes. I asked the hostess, "was he getting the manager"? I thought I might have misheard. She said yes, told me he'd be along in a few minutes. And then the topper - she said "why, do you have someplace you need to go"?  I said, yes, I need to go get some dinner. Jeez.  Some of the food I got was good. Service sucked. I will not go back.

0jE90Cx5072xO0KpsCn7wg.text: Viva Margaritas! I ventured to this spot for Happy Hour with some co-wokers one Friday afternoon. We chose this place specifically for their HH drink specials...2 for 1 margaritas! Ay yai yai!! Annnd, they were actually tasty...not too much sweet and sour, just the right amount! Unfortunately there are no HH food special (tear). : (   Coming from San Diego, it has been difficult to find authentic Mexican food, but Viva Zapatas was one of the better ones I've found so far in Vegas.  I ordered the taco plate with beans and rice. Unfortunately I can't recall the three different taco meats I ordered, but I remember all of them being tasty. The rice was prepared well, but my favorite were the refried beans and homemade chips they brought out when we sat down...yummy!!! Another traditional touch that I appreciated was the fideo soup that accompanied my meal. I could have slurped that soup all night....delicious!!   The ambiance was enjoyable as well. Traditional colors and decor with classic Mexican tunes in the background. I believe the server mentioned that they have occasional live musical performances, so if that peaks your interest I would call prior to confirm. The service was good, nothing above and beyond, but certainly friendly. The only downside of this place is that it is fairly pricey for traditional Mexican food. Thank goodness for their HH margarita specials!

xLbS2IndmzZ1I2KhUXaZdg.text: Best spot I've been too that has authentic Mexican food to their chips and salsa and a side of refried beans.. to their fideo soup to start before u get your meal.. I had the green chilaquiles with carne asada which was a fulfilling meal and great flavor. As for my boyfriend had the tostadas of ceviche and that was a hit too.. I truly recommend this spot.. we look forward to coming to this spot again..thank you for the great service..

ERuJIi1XKpFv8Q2dz-xpKQ.text: Amazing Mexican food (and I don't even like Mexican food all that much!). Affordable prices. LOTS of food. Well seasoned. Great place.

I9uhjZ17vCtADjnYKp7anw.text: It was pouring when we came here, but yet it was super busy. My two friends and I came on a Sunday night, around 6:30 or so and someone held the door for us and welcomed us in. It was really dark inside, which made it kind of difficult to read the menu (the words were small too) but the booths were comfy, it was warm and the music was good. We were given chips, salsa and beans while we waited for our server.   My friends ordered a large margarita which was surprisingly good and very strong. After our server took our drink orders and dropped off our waters, he disappeared for 10 minutes. I am not exaggerating, waiting 10 minutes to order is not acceptable. My friends were sure he forgot about us.   Finally, we were able to order our food but by then we had already filled up on chips and salsa (the busboy refilled it for us twice already). Instead of ordering the chicken enchilada, chicken taco and tamale combo I got the beef enchilada and tamale combo instead. My friends stuck with their steaks, one ordered the Cola steak and not sure what my other friend ordered.   We were all given a tomato based soup to start off with. My friend said that it usually tasted better, and was kind of bland today. I tried it, and it did taste a bit watered down, I added some salt and pepper to it but didn't care for it much.   My friends ordered guacamole, which was made table side. One guacamole was used along with probably half of a tomato... was it worth the $8? Not so sure, but it WAS good.  The steaks and my combo came with rice and beans, my friends' steaks were supposed to come with tortillas but they didn't and by the time the server checked up on us, they didn't want them anymore. The beef enchilada was filling, lots of shredded beef and it wasn't too salty! I was too full to try my tamale but did get a bite of my friends' steaks. Both were very soft, and well seasoned. I didn't like the cola steak because it reminded me of a cola flavored bbq sauce that was overly sweet.   Unfortunately since we filled up on chips, we only had a couple bites of our food and asked for the rest to be boxed up. Our server wasn't around much, but the busboy was amazing and very attentive. He boxed up our food, tableside and was the person refilling our chips and waters.   Our server came by, asked us if we wanted dessert and we said no, just the check. Then, he left somewhere, and a few minutes later came back to ask us if we wanted dessert again.   It was a 25 minute drive from my place, but I wanted to come here because my friends raved about it. After my initial experience, I don't think I'll be coming back here anytime soon and will just stick to someplace closer to me.

vQx2ZkfZiz5VK-EhIoPjPg.text: Excellent service & food! Went in on a Sunday around 1pm & we had a great experience. The atmosphere is warm & the waiters are dressed like mariachi men, our waiter was Jesus and he was amazing!! Some of the best service I have had in a while! The food was delicious real Mexican food! I would definitely return!!   We had the cilantro steak & shrimp ceviche that came with fresh homemade tostadas, delicious!!!!

ZLNTCNfQqlnVbuDtcEgEjA.text: Authentic Mexican food 100. Try the shrimp juice margarita to die for. Ate a mocateje bowl with friends and had to agree it was the best. Everything is fresh and tasty, not tasteless. Highly recommend and not pricey. The restaurant is not big inside and the later you go you might wait a bit. The wait is worth the great food.

xDAWsewrCBzmrBFjFZ4a6g.text: Camarones Sarandeados Estilo "Cuautla" oh what a dish! Although we have gone here several times this has to be my all time favorite! I tried this dish for the first time today and I was quite taken by surprise. When I saw the ingredients and it said, with a "touch of mayonnaise", I thought what could go wrong with mayonnaise? It was absolutely delicious!!! I love their sopa Fideo that they serve before your entree, it's like a little bowl of Mexican noodle soup, I cheat and crunch up some of my chips they give you with the bean dip, I love this place. The service is excellent, the food is delicious and I wish I lived closer. I rate this place 10 stars!!!!!!!

DxQvIejNa9Tf4Y_iSsBLZw.text: Such a great restaurant that is ALWAYS busy but very accommodating. Truly delicious and entertaining venue.  They have an extensive menu with some authentic Latin recipes. Staff is always very friendly and extremely kind. I love that my cup is never less than half full. It's appreciated, the minor details.

vLyhV0FGRm4oATfR54wEzA.text: Yelper's.........   Great spot right off the freeway. Large menu and chips to die for. They even make fresh tortillas on the spot. I had the most delicious soft shredded beef ever there. Also got the table side guacamole which was mixed perfectly (to your liking).   This will be my default restaurant while traveling the 15 fwy.  Large place, clean and plenty of parking. Huge tequila bar too. Oh and outstanding service, water and iced tea filled without asking.

kWal9lx43sdpWBR9jdXlBA.text: Great place for lunch. We ordered the guacamole and it was fabulous! Prepared at the table with all the fixings! Food was wonderful and staff was great! Jesus took good care of us!

h2S5GLDUGaIlFQ6Lpg8fyQ.text: Me Being Mexican. The Food was not great. Not 100% Authentic Flavor seems the rice and beans are can food not made from scratch.  2nd time igo give a try again. Not worth for the price. Fideo Soup was good. Finished my food and tortillas never arrived.

fXAZu0qJjeRKvBrfV7Hsfg.text: I could sit and eat the bean dip and table side guac all day. It's excellent. You could do it too, because the service is OUTSTANDING!   But we can't all survive on chips, so I order more food to satisfy my inner fat-kid. I haven't had anything that I haven't thoroughly enjoyed, but I am a huge fan of the fajitas...and those oh-so-good fresh tortillas.   Bring a wheel barrow. They may just roll you out for free.

DBlCYOQ03Vp4_jB3nCXNpw.text: Another surprise Yelp find for me! I had never heard of this place or even see it, even though I've driven by a billion times. It's kinda small but they seem to move pretty quickly so if you do wait, it shouldn't be long.  The food here is excellent! If you're a fan of guacamole, make sure you try the fresh guac here. A waiter will come out with fresh avocados, all the fixings and make it exactly how you want...so good! Their chips are homemade and they also have a really good fideo soup. I ordered shrimp ceviche for my dinner which was alright but definitely not the best I've had. My wife had chicken fajitas which was great and I would definitely recommend it.   Aside from the food, this restaurant has some of the best service I've ever gotten. The staff is friendly and ridiculously fast at getting what you need. My drink never came close to being empty. Their menu is also pretty big so there's something for everyone here. I'd come back, even if just for the great service and killer fresh guacamole!

uNhMuxYfHoFiGzrBCcW7Pg.text: Salsa waa funny tastinglike really acidic and menu was very hard to readhad to read description on every iten each nenu item was given a name thathad nothing to do with wat it is  , tacos wer ok but bland n salsa was horribleso couldnt put it on my tacos. Wifes carnitas had bones in it she didnt eat it

CDpag-mp_KU6oEElwz5gTw.text: Out of all of the Lindo Michoacan and whatever locations they have Viva Zapata is the best love this place been here many many times always will have my business and the consistency from the staff to customer service is off the charts I wish I can give you 10 stars but the best I could do with this v definition this place out if you were on Pecos and Craig

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

gt9EOBQFfF7Bl2m5HkUhLA.text: Best Mexican food in las vegas. Cool atmosphere, good prices, great food and cold beer. Chips, salsa and bean dip all you can eat. Tortillas are made fresh. Its a small place so always make sure to make a reservation.

EavbMyJE5xWDNfF_9p-o5w.text: Came at 330pm. It's now 355pm. There are 2 other tables that gave customers, still no waiter. Food is bomb though, I've been here when it was busy and had better service.

-Z6lpN1cqCd6k93vaXTzyw.text: Excellent excellent EXCELLENT food here..  The service is outstanding and I highly recommend people to come here for an amazing dinner.. The menu is indeed pricier than most places but when you try their food, it's very much worth it.. And the whole inside of this place is clean..  I'd give it 10 stars if that was possible

gXJwf-SaCLp6LTF46k44SA.text: Delicious, authentic Mexican food. Excellent service the music amazing. Love this place

YCjpwPUTODJKNfivEMrIfA.text: I've been here many times when they have their lunch specials. The prices are very decent, especially for the amount of food they give. The carne asada (#30) is soooo good. The servers are very friendly, too. Outside of the lunch specials, they offer military discount which is another plus! The only thing I don't like about it is they will only discount the food the military member gets even if that person is paying for the entire party's bill.

LeE4figWP00cDkuAUHwQWg.text: Came here after NASCAR for dinner with a group of 4. The restaurant is cozy and very well decorated with pictures of Zapata and the history that comes with that. The service was great, they give you chips beans and salsa while you wait. The sopa de Fideo reminds me of moms cooking. The waiter is nice and told us that they have a full bar but no drink menu. We ordered the mango margaritas. I appreciate the salt on the rim but they skipped the salt I guess. I ordered the chile colorado. It was impressive. We also ordered fried ice cream and it was devious. The place is very busy as it is popular. I also liked the dress of the workers and also the tortilla lady making fresh tortillas! Would love to return here but it's a bit far from my area.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. I couldn&#39;t help to post this picture of my chile Colorado ....
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango margarita, beans and salsa and tortillas

S63gyI3_jrBdkIM1N8lSKA.text: I didn't like the food here. The salsa literally smelled like farts and the main dishes were just average. The waitstaff took forever to get us drinks and then forgot about us after our food was dropped off. Super disappointed especially in the salsa the most. Yuck.

J1aj6v6n2NK7ndHRVgcp3g.text: Great food... Gets very busy after 11:30am for lunch, but worth the wait. I recommend the carnitas and pollo con rajas. Very authentic Mexican food.

57XHbGpTjnXZUteVGZ_jIw.text: This is our favorite Mexican restaurant in all of Vegas. The food is all made from scratch and the service is always great. Great Caritas and the rid eye is awesome.

gVzbk7rIcv0DNtvEvhYiyw.text: This place was great. I had the chicken enchilada lunch special and my daughter had the beef and bean burritos special. The value fit the cost and the atmosphere was comforting. We will definitely be going back, hopefully soon, with a larger party.

dG_hG3YwgsTXZVerAY_amA.text: Definitely our favorite Mexican restaurant. There's a lot of selection and options here for food and drinks. The freshly made tortillas are especially amazing with queso fundido con chorizo. We've had everything from fish to carne to pollo to salad and soups. You get really good portion sizes and the tomato soup appetizers are delightful. In addition, you get the tradition chips, bean, and salsa with your meal which they refill. The margaritas are tasty and never had an issue with the quantity of alcohol in my drinks. They have live music sometimes but it's not as loud of a restaurant so you can still hold a conversation comfortably with your party. I highly recommend!

0w6wYIt8enyZmIHSzsQMXw.text: Really good Mexican restaurant!  The Good: The service was impeccable, unlike any Mexican restaurant Ive seen in the valley. The drinks were always refilled, the food was tasty and the servers were professional and polite, and tentative. The decor is awesome I couldnt stop looking around at all the cool shit they have on the walls. but it didnt seem that tacky.   The Bad: Nothing was really bad here. the Hostess was a little bland but Ive come to accept that from the valley and the food wasnt that great and it def isnt that cheap. I still dont understand how they do their pricing.    The Ugly: I would say the only ugly thing is the location. This restaurant has very little parking and it is out of the way in North Las Vegas, but im glad it exists.

gmxGCGqERvwVgw8YMYtewQ.text: We read all the reviews so we had to try for ourselves! I was craving some legit Mexican. I ordered the Carne a La Tampiquena and my husband had the Pork Carnitas. It was good but maybe I expected way TOO much from all the reviews. I enjoyed my cheese enchilada (that was served on the side of my meal) and margarita the most! They have a great happy hour deal and beers on draft. I liked that their tortillas are freshly made (you can see the woman towards the back cooking them). However, I walked away feeling like I missed something. Great service, good food but maybe I ordered the wrong thing since everyone else is raving?!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne a La Tampiquena
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Carnitas

VhD-9ThXJ_gFTq2R_9DYjA.text: Been in Las Vegas since 09' and my wife's coworkers drove from the base to check it out. She was pleased so I decided we would try it out together. The chips were nice and hot also very fresh. Bean dip is superb. The salsa they use is.....different. I like chunky salsa and spicy. This salsa isn't. But there food is good and always good portions. Glad to know this place is here.  I'll go back again!

4YH2WMh3aknKiCBJIxE8QQ.text: I had the opportunity to come to this restaurant on a weekend trip in Vegas. While in North Vegas I searched for good Mexican food and saw the amount of reviews in the amount of stars at this restaurant had received. I can honestly tell you that it may have been low in regards to star quantity! This Mexican restaurant was absolutely amazing and the staff is great but I think the most impressive part of this restaurant is how clean it was. If you ever find yourself near this restaurant you owe it to yourself, considering the prices, to come in and experience it for yourself!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

MfPU8c1LjYKq03FQZRK3cA.text: This place is ok ... Not really worth it for the price though ..theres many mexican restaurants that are in vegas that are way better then this spot and about same price if not cheaper ... In that being said i dont think the food is horrible ...i just think it doesnt match up with the bill ... Personally i defently rather hit up another spot with more bang for its buck in taste .. Lil bit on the salty side ... But like i said food isnt bad its just ok ...

cPFxB13SwTQowDI5HP1IyQ.text: Consistently amazing service and food. Table side guacamole, delicious shrimp dishes and 5 star service. And the homemade tortillas to die for. Jesus was our excellent waiter.

df_Uv-XVDcCgNuocCGGVqQ.text: Great atmosphere, good food. Would give this place one or two more stars if the waiter would've bothered to come back to check on me after setting my plate on the table. My cup sat empty for 20 minutes. And it's not like he was busy, considering it was only me and another table behind me. Everyone else was great.

BsD2PLwEujxjeEEAzybK3Q.text: Amazing food! No parking. There are literally less than 20 spots. We parked at the gas station next door. The wait was fast for a holiday. Service was a bit slow, they forgot one of our drinks. But what they lack in service, they make up in food!! Fresh tortilla makers behind a glass wall. Nice music. Great chips and salsa. Small place but my goodness worth coming back again for.

nHVbwEQNWQSH5orvUs5lkw.text: Yum. Yum. Yum. Talk about delicious food. Even my mom who 1. Hates food 2. Likes chicken mole 3. Is a Texan so lives off Mexican food, fell in love with this place. She said she hasn't found Mole that tasted that good since the 70s. The food is always fresh and timely. The staff makes you feel important and the chips and dips are mind blowing. Fresh tortillas are bomb. Atmospheres and love music is fantastic and everything Ive tried more than suites my fancy. Will be coming back for years to come.

Kmmv-R_Ux9GZ049qVfvrxA.text: Had lunch here based on helpers. One of best chili rellanos I've had in a long time and the chicken taco salad was very good but the soup was lousy so pass on that... nice place to come too if your passing by

T-1XPI3SPVQGKhRlMmzoWQ.text: Enjoyed the bean dip, soup, and steak dish for dinner last evening. I think everything on this menu would be tasty. This is the second time I have dined here and will be back.  The service was very good and a little of live music in the background.  F

C3bB_vBpv4rd9KKCqEeBNQ.text: The food here is always great. The staff is always nice and attentive. Today I placed an order to go and was disappointed.  I ordered the flautas meal.  They gave me all the fixings to put my meal together. It was tasty however the gave me chicken when I ordered beef.  There's nothing worse than expecting something and biting into something else.
