zRMgv4nQEctjJFDp-TTuKA.text: I'm not sure where to start...the food is passable but not great. Fish tacos were slightly less flavorful than frozen in a box. Child Colorado was bland, meat was tough and dry, chips were stale, salsa had no kick. It's not clear how, with so many tables free, there were no tables. We sat at the bar. The service was good.

HMIfNPV8ROyu8nZa0Fwt7A.text: Went here on a Sunday. Not sure what to expect because of industrial area. Food and service was excellent. Love this place!

rYcxbMY3qBVXGIEdDrvuOA.text: Margaritas suck at $16 a piece.  They taste great with no alcohol whatsoever.  The food is good and the service is a little iffy... but the food is good with fresh tortillas etc.  would not hurt at all if you speak Spanish.

zfQxJmi0krWVckq9iiW2ow.text: This place is a must visit when in Vegas.  Get away from the Strip, get away from the buffet table and have some really really good food.  Mexican home cooking I have to say.  This is the way my grandmother would have cooked...if she wasn't Norwegian and from MN.  Service was great after a short wait for a table.  We sat by the tortilla station, pressed fresh and tossed on the flat top.  A fresh tortilla is the only way to really enjoy Mexican food.  The food came out quick, very authentic and very nice spice.  I had a pork dish with flour tortillas and they were so soft and fluffy I could have eaten them all day.  The pork was wonderful, perfectly cooked with a nice heat but not overpowering.  Bean were good as was the rice yet I left them alone do to the tortillas, didnt want to crowd them from the meal.  Well worth the visit and the wait and I will be back.

idDksiH_NdyXBEuCaH1D7w.text: The food was ok but the it took forever to come! It took so long that I had to ask for my food to go because  I had to leave earlier than everybody else. I asked for the portion of my check and instead of charging only my portion they charged me the whole bill. It was a mass!!! It took at least 5 days for the money to be credited back in my account.

IolwmO6Za-Fn9QzRTDkgCQ.text: This is amazing Mexican cuisine. My family and I have been coming here for years, way before Yelp, and since we live across town from this restaurant, we literally have to go out of our way to come here. But it's worth it! (usually)  They have an extensive lunch menu with 30+ items at reasonable lunch prices. The service is top notch usually and they use hand-made tortillas (that you can watch being made) which are worth the drive, I mean they are delicious!   The food and most service here is great. Just watch the portions and how much you are charged. For example, this time I got the chicken fajitas which, according to the menu, comes with tortillas, guacamole and sour cream. It's a sizzling skillet and a decent portion of meat and veggies, but I had less than a teaspoon of guacamole and a tablespoon of sour cream on my plate with the rice/beans. So I asked the first person who came back to our table to look at the tiny amount/portion and to bring me a little more guacamole. He brought me a small dish with guacamole and sour cream (which was then properly proportioned for the amount of fajitas). Unfortunately when the check came I had been charged $4.95 for the guac and $1.95 for the sour cream! I explained it to my server who apologized and said he didn't see the plate and couldn't do anything about it. Truthfully it wasn't his fault because he didn't bring it out, the runner did, and whoever I asked for a little bit more is the one that dropped the ball and charged me. I didn't get a chance to speak to the manager because I was in a hurry to get to an appointment. I really don't appreciate being charged for something that was supposedly included, but just wasn't properly apportioned for the meal.   I also saw that they have an attractive happy hour which I'm tempted to try with 2 for 1 margaritas and draft beers, but I'm apprehensive about going because of this experience. This would have been a 5 star review if it weren't for that. Honestly, I'm pleased with everything else.

o9nZLtAOqEIfC8XNXlGr9w.text: the service the " ambiance " the food was  Awesome :) been here 4 times the food consistent and delicious :) executive chef john lee

nosVSR2Yh2zZmHa9ZmVJBw.text: From the moment you walk in, the customer service is outstanding. They are so efficient and professional. The chips, salsa and bean dip is outstanding. My horchata was delicious and the refills were greatly appreciated..My burrito lunch special was spectacular. Alejandro was wonderful. His customer service is outstanding

ULnB5zUatJpulblpLftc6Q.text: Tired and old. Expect the same "Mexican food". Over priced. Disappointing night out trying a new place. We were a party for 3. The 3 of us agreed that the food needed seasoning.  The ambience is loud. There was a gentleman playing keyboards and singing. Fine. The lighting is really dim. To the point that it's hard to read the menu.  The most disappointing was the actual food. Same old "Mexican food" but bland.

bmV419LHaFq6ONzUNRGNtw.text: Very authentic, great service, great live music, and the best value in a restaurant I've had in a long time.  Highly recommend. I had the tacos. You can mix and match them up.

qqHfhapOzaeBBtXEmVrHyw.text: Wow amazing food!!! Great service!!! Gerardo one of the members of the waiting staff was wondering n point and did a great job taking care of us...

3YTQf6ZOU_1lRI4e1jHG7Q.text: Amazing food, very authentic food and very friendly staff. My New go to Mexican restaurant/bar. Was checking out some property in the area and found this little jewel, plan to go back many many times. Love the Decour inside. Hard to find a restaurant this authentic

PvaC1ja9pLuCUl2ooG3Vmg.text: Good place, good service. Good food. While we were eating the fan above us sparked and caught fire. It was really weird, and a bit scary. The waitresses came over and checked on us. Hopefully this doesn't happen again.

Q6TonKJwQWosL0EsrMHc6A.text: One of if not the best Mexican restaurant in town. The #1 combo is my favorite but you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Their Cadillac margarita is also pretty legit.

YxWpJEBUVqzYNPVe-jeUlw.text: Extremely upset.  Don't get me wrong, the food is delicious HOWEVER  ***HOW IS IT THAT MY MOTHER, WHOM DID 30+ YEARS IN THE MILITARY DOESN'T GET A DISCOUNT BUT ACTIVE DUTY DOES?!! PLEASE FIX THIS!!!***   Think about it : She sacrificed just as much IF NOT MORE time than those who are active duty. If you give a discount for military, it should be for ALL whom had served and sacrificed their time, family and well being so we can live as we please.

uE8zeZKetbt0p4Veu8fKnA.text: Worst customer service ever. We are from out of town and went there after work for a bite to eat. 1.5 hours later, a server who was extremely slow on a slow day and a manager who didn't fix anything for us.  I do not recommend that you go to this restaurant. We waited 20 minutes for our soft drinks, another 20 minutes for the server to place our order after the drinks were finally served, and another 45 minutes for our food to come to the table after it was ordered. Orders were wrong, so we didn't even stay to "enjoy" our meals. We immediately asked for to go boxes and our checks. I asked to speak to the manager and asked how she would rectify the situation. It took her 10 minutes to get over to us and she didn't even understand the English I was speaking. Very disappointing for this restaurant. I do not recommend coming here.   She said she was going to discount the meal but we ended up waiting 20 minutes for her to fix the check and the check never got fixed. Do not go here!

GNO0TsPZCIxyavIxCefydQ.text: We went to eat here the food is pretty good the best part are the tortillas since they are made fresh But the only thing that bothered us was that the sodas had no free refills?? I did not notice that on the menu none of us did  So without knowing we were getting charged full price for each damn soda pretty stupid and the server did not mention one word about the sodas not having refills

tF75DvXxRXhsU0WIuq6SSQ.text: A++++++ Service. No one comes close to the service they provide #1 for sure. The food is excellent and the drinks are bomb. A must try place definitely.

whSICGl1ZIS52RZ9LBI6IA.text: My husband and I went to this restaurant last night based on the yelp reviews, and boy, were we glad we did. Service was excellent! The servers were very attentive, and food was delicious. They start off by giving you salsa and bean dip to go with the chips, which they gladly refilled when we asked. We ordered guacamole, which they made table side and customized to our liking. We each ordered entrees- fish tacos for me, and hubby had chicken and shrimp enchiladas. We just nibbled at it and we had gotten full from the chips and dip, and soup, which came with our entree. The server even wrapped our food to go. Good food and good service. We will definitely come back!

u1Vsd8K7Q8eTdM-kuaBXFw.text: Have been waiting for over an hour and these cops come in and get sited right away. Apparently they are more important then any of us paying customers. And we are still waiting. Can't believe this shit.

_J4LsIC111gwr9WYWKW-7A.text: Food: great variety and lots of vegetarian options. We tried several different salsas on our foods, and all added distinct appealing flavors to the fresh hot food.  Atmosphere: truly committed to creating an old town cantina interior--it was a True departure from the busy intersection outside and you could refocus on the food and your company. You also get to learn a little history in the menu too--cool!  Service: prompt, friendly, and offered helpful suggestions where we needed them.

ZhgTOY5CEk_Dj0qEjveUGg.text: We usually always end up at Lindo Michoacan by Las Lomas in Henderson but we wanted to try somewhere else. I've always passed by Viva Zapatas and I told my husband we should try it out. Well...here it goes.  There was a 15-20 minute wait (which I don't mind because it was a Mother's day Weekend). I pictured the restaurant waaaay bigger but I was wrong. The entrance is so small that if you do have to wait just know that you're gonna be waiting outside in the heat.   The table that they gave us was near the entrance. I wanted to switch tables BUT I knew that was gonna be another 20 minute wait and we were already starving. Anyways, it was pretty dark inside. Felt like we were some dam vampires.  Now to the food....so....if I would of known that they pretty much did the exactly same thing as Lindo Michoacan, I would of just gone to Lindo Michoacan. The chips and dips are pretty much the same. Oh and let's not forget the fideo. Which by the way had no taste at all AND pretty much there was no fideos in my dam soup! Huh!? Felt like I was drinking colored water. But I will give them this...I ordered a combo of chile rellenos without the sauce. That was some good ass Chile rellenos. The beans were pretty good and the rice was ehh...but I wasn't super impressed.   The service was okay....  I wouldn't come back.  P.S. I was gonna give them two stars BUT the chile rellenos saved them.

hp74fb8Wke04rXD6sbbJvQ.text: This place is great! My husband & I love the enchilladas and margargaritas - they even make their own chips!

TXOutBf07JGvP0_tPm-ICw.text: Awesome food! LOVE the grilled fish tacos & margaritas!

EbJwHqIG4FLZov7FL1iUFg.text: Great food...great service!  If you don't know how to eat Mexican food with a flour tortilla you don't belong in this restaurant.  The complimentary chips, salsa, retried beans, are awesome.  I recommend the homemade guacamole.  It is made fresh right at your table.  I Ordered the mochacca breakfast and enjoyed it.  Next time I'm back in Vegas I will definitely try the dinner menu.

6nkpPFIIMMw-moc__7bRKw.text: I used to love this joint, and don't get me wrong but the food is not quite as good as it used to be.  This all started about 1 year ago.  For example, the sopa de fideos does not have the noodles it used to have, and the overall flavor is not like it once was.  The dishes used to have a lot more zest, now they are just a little bland.  Still great food, but just not as good as it once was unfortunately.    Still very clean and great service by the staff.

Xws-SOpBHb5owzPvSeqnxg.text: we have been coming here for years.  we bring our children and they love the live music.  the service is always good.  i will warn you, it is easy to fill up on chips, salsa, and beans before the food comes.

n_-vytxgvJrXovdJIcSzFg.text: Well we waited forever to be seated and then to be served...cognac chicken was divine...my daughter ordered that...so was the bean dip as other viewers have said...live music excellent as well...Stevie wonder in Spanish is a treat.  But my pork was off...not a little..a LOT...as in rancid spit it in the napkin felt like puking all night off.  So beware...

NoAb6R_zYQZsBeAoTr7XOA.text: Somewhat perplexed by the recent negative reviews I have read.. I have been dining there for over ten years and have been pleased with the service and the food quality.

R-8zVymMggPU9f8dEdyZGw.text: Went there on recommendation from yelp, was not disappointed. We went early evening so the place was not full yet, but had quite a few tables taken. We were seated quickly and the waiter appeared almost immediately. Drinks came out quickly and the waiter waited until we had decided on dinner before approaching us for our order, a refreshing change from the usual hovering around and rushed feeling. The meal was outstanding, just enough spice heat to enhance the flavor not overpower it. Some might want  more heat, but for me this was just right. The table was cleared AFTER we finished each course by very attentive wait assistants, nice touch to wait, not hover. Overall service was great and food was outstanding,  Only have one downside, the lighting is dim and makes reading the menu challenging. The print on some parts of the menu is the same color as the lighting, so there is no contrast. Those of us who have a little trouble seeing in dim light might want to bring a small light. I would still  highly recommend VIVA ZAPATAS.

3WbkmlF_0ODHxx4FCLagpw.text: Always great food and service whenever we go.  The fresh made tortillas are excellent.  The atmosphere has a more authentic feel than most regular/generic Mexican restaurants.  There is live music, a bar and interesting decor.  Viva Zapatas falls in the medium price range.

w3rZd60Y8mojRpHGUm2a3w.text: My sister had been wanting to come here for awhile. We finally went! I had the fish tacos(I wasn't a vegetarian yet and am not sure how friendly this place might be on that). I thought they were wonderful. A little different from what I was used to, but different isn't always bad. I loved the bean dip, salsa, and chips that was brought to our table while we waited as well. The service was fast and the place smells amazing. The atmosphere was great. There was a musician playing beautiful music, and the decorations covering the walls were interesting too.

7QZGDbGgCoCS9S5Ju_w2mA.text: Amazing Mexican restaurant!  The food here is all authentic and is some of the most delicious Mexican food I have ever had.  They serve unlimited chips and salsa with hot bean dip!  The tacos were outstanding and the prices on the lunch portions were very good.  We went again for dinner 2 days later and the food was just as outstanding as the first time around.  They also had live music when we went for dinner (Friday night).  Musician was very good and definitely contributed to the wonderful ambiance at this restaurant.

EmHdwoIqqdmQJeAUbsQYdg.text: Great food and very authentic atmosphere. We usually go on weekends, and they always have live music playing. Usually just a guy and his guitar, but he's very good.

3AuwunBkfjYIuBCyY_9Ofg.text: Don't let the exterior fool you - next to a gas station & truck stop in NLV - reveals a gem of  restaurant. We came around 1pm for late lunch and we were seated in no time at all. Menu is extensive so it took a while to decide on the Carne ala Coca Cola and Mole Poblano for our entrees. While waiting for our food, we nibbled on what seemed like endless tortilla chips, salsa, and bean dip. They had a musician play live music and that definitely lent to a more relaxed atmosphere. Food was very good and we were thankful that we didn't order an appetizer because the portions are fairly large although the table side guacamole was tempting (next time!).  We will definite be back!

Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mole Poblano

AY41Y4v7DMqYGJfugBXoPw.text: Food was excellent. A little pricey. This is where the hubby wanted to go for his birthday. It's a ways from our house in Centennial. We all liked our meals, but it's not somewhere I would drive so far to get. If you're near by check it out.

qUXIDp4DAvc_ti-WPDfOZg.text: This place I have been coming to for awhile.. Never have I experienced hair in my food. When the Manager Ramon came out and pertained to tell me that the hair couldn't of came from his employees it came from the outside when people open the door. I couldn't but look at this man and say that is the dumbest excuse I have ever heard of WOW!!! I will not be back to this place it's a joke. Not to add the portion today was four pieces of shrimp one spoon full of rice and beans take was ridiculous expensive if you enjoy blowing money for less food then go to this place. I'm so disappointed overall. I hope the owner Lorenzo reads this and gets back to me.

RpPKtXb47KygUiEURfNWoQ.text: Food is delicious and they definitely give you your money's worth. They had live music, great service, and my cup never went empty. I am a server and the staff gets "outstanding service" award in my book without a doubt!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. We got Queso Fundido (comes with tortillas) for appetizer, and rolled taquitos and shrimp cocktail for entrees.

ONaGutjRO8Z8Yjif4OZ8kw.text: Two adults and a one-year-old looking for somewhere new (to us), found Viva Zapata's. We were there for late breakfast/early lunch. Seated promptly! The hostess took the drink orders and the waitress brought the drinks and a busser brought chips, salsa, and bean dip. Awesome teamwork! Everyone's timing was on point.  Allow me to point out: if you're craving chips and salsa, you can go to pretty much any old Mexican restaurant and get your fix. Viva Zapata's offers chips, salsa, bean dip, AND a fabulous fideo soup (it's basically tomato soup with short noodles; VZ's take on it is among the best I've had). Speaking of the soup, the busser brought out a cup of it for the toddler before our orders were even taken, which kept her busy and gave us time to look over the menu.  He had huevos rancheros and I had camarones deseados(?). Huevos rancheros came with pork (a little dry, but great flavor). Shrimp was incredible. Something different about their rice--I can't quite put my finger on it, but it's definitely a good thing.

vV3yR52Xw5LvLSsd3O5sjA.text: The atmosphere inside was very nice and clean. The waiter was very attentive and pleasant but I didn't think the food was that great.

TonYl6zWjeSxyIQF-p4z3A.text: Great atmosphere and great service.  The food is really good.  I always order the "Doce" for lunch and I'm never disappointed.  Great for small and large griups.  One of my gotos off the strip.  If your also thirsty they have some of the best Margueritas in vegas.

Uo-ly-jLzlOTdrwwgidFiQ.text: Holy Frijole, is this place good.  Las Vegans usually place Lindo Michoacan at the top of the heap when it comes to Mexican dining, but my erudite palate says Zapata's is easily just as as good, and much more affordable.  I really cannot say enough good things about this cozy little joint.  It's as authentic as it gets, and the food here is so good I don't have a go-to plate.  I always spend a good deal of time browsing the generous menu to pick something new, and it has always been delicious.  The chips and salsa are homemade, and probably laced with something illegal because it's hard to put them down.  The complementary fideo soup with an entree is a really nice touch and quite delicious.  There's a lot of complex flavors going on in what usually is just noodles and broth.  As far as the entrees go, I've never had anything that wasn't just firing on all cylinders.  Most recently I had the Camarones Borrachos entree, which was shrimp cooked in tequila, and it was absolutely delicious.  Before that I had one of the carnitas dishes and it gave me a glorious food comma.  The margaritas are also some of the best around.  My only criticism of Zapata's is the parking situation.  It's a small, crowded lot and we often have to park at the gas station next to it, but it's a minor inconvenience compared to the quality of the food awaiting inside.  Highly, highly recommended.

qCeAlRvqMpHZP_dtPmSVgA.text: Dope spot,dranks r good,food is good...nice mellow place if ur not tryna go to las islitas or something.

pBADe4rkHnio000p4Q0YYA.text: This is hands down the best Mexican food restaurant in Vegas to me. Every time I come here the food is amazing, and all the employees are super nice. The food is at a pretty moderate rate, but the food comes in great quantity is and delicious so it's well worth it. I definitely would recommend this place to anyone that is looking for a good restaurant!

XI0C7wRSlVKJrk2LYPB8qQ.text: Some of the best Mexican food I ever had anywhere.  Great food, great drinks, great atmosphere. You can't go wrong here. Ate and drank here twice in two days and I will be back next time in Vegas.

xWkoaEpcOppeYHyfxogyUQ.text: Everytime I go to Viva Zapatas it feels like home they really know how to provide the best customer service. My favorite dish is pollo zarandeado and ceviche it is delicious you gotta to try it...

iGzQEU4dOJCIjsQTGU9SoA.text: Eat here with our counterparts. Great restaurant and food is excellent. Very busy at lunch time. Sometimes hard to find a parking spot.

Szi2_984XnTxkgaGvw55og.text: I have to be real and blunt I absolutely love this place but there are some big con's that forced me to dock some stars.  Atmosphere:5/5 It doesn't get more authentic than this. When you walk into this restaurant you feel like your in Mexico. It looks like an old Mexican tavern. Dim lighting with a guy in the corner with a guitar jamming away. Honestly the vibes of this place was awesome! The bar was more than fully stocked. With your "American vodka's" and a WIDE WIDE selection of Tequila's.   Service: 3/5 The service felt very homey, like I had a Mexican mother cooking me home made Mexican food. The food was very wholesome in HUGE portions. I literally had no Idea where to begin. So I started in the middle and ate my way out. LOL Service at the bar could've been a bit better. I went during peak dinner hours so I guess that's why they neglected us. I noticed my group didn't get any bar tables stands for our plates like other groups so we ate directly on the bar.  Also our complimentary salsa, chips, and pinto bean dip ran low. I wasn't sure If I could as for more because it was complimentary "well so I thought it was"   Food: 4/5 First the salsa, chips, and pinto bean dip. OMG was super delicious. The salsa was average but the bean dip was very tasty. but don't fill up on the chips. Next comes the pre dinner soup, not sure what it was but it was very bland. It looked spicy but it wasn't. Now the meal, it was very heavy, when I say heavy. I mean fatty, cheesy, and oily. I literally had to push around the cheese to get to anything. It was EVERYWHERE kind of an over load. The cheese enchilada lacked flavor, and on my 3 combo plate (1 tostada, 1 beef taco, 1 enchilada). The beef on the taco was shredded like pulled pork. It seemed more like a carnita. The tostada was very fresh because it was topped off with a big glob of guacamole. YUMMMM   Drinks: 4/5 The drinks were just right. Not too strong, not too weak. A perfect blend. I ordered a margarita because I felt.. I needed to indulge fully into Mexican culture. It was a perfect combo to my meal.   Pricing: 3/5 My order was $13.95 a bit pricy for the Area of town it's in. But It was understandable because the food was good. The atmosphere complimented the food well. Plus it came with complimentary salsa and chips, with also this intro dinner soup.  Suggestions/Advice:  - Don't go during peak dinner hours if you want impeccable service. - Don't fill up on a lot of chips,salsa, and pinto bean dip. - Portions are huge  - TRY THE PINTO BEAN DIP it was heaven!!! - Parking might be difficult its a very small limited area.

zewIficeQwwMXsEI1yChng.text: I absolutely love this place! The food and service is amazing. I live down the street and never even noticed this spot because it's a bit small on the outside and not too noticeable but when me and my boyfriend discovered this place we just loved it and keep coming back. Every time I come the service is incredible and I always order something different; I have yet to be disappointed. Favorite Mexican spot for dinner, most definitely.

O1ksmY2IoHuhzbKEjUmr5A.text: Amazing service, table side Guacamole, home made tortillas that they recommend you eat butter with and are amazing, live music, waitress was so accommodating and nice especially since we looked a little bedraggled coming directly from the water slides. WOW!

4d7Od2XFjkyTB-14c4j8gg.text: Such a wonderful restaurant. I had the steak de cognac and that was super bomb!! The sangria is really good as well.  I loved the love music during dinner. It was a great environment!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomb!!!

hg3J3W6EkK4fEpLg24f_fQ.text: Great little place with authentic food and a very large tequila selection. I have been there twice and will definitely be there again

BxJWMY53vYtXwQ-BEEoWvg.text: In the culinary wasteland known as East Craig Road, this is the sole exception.  It is in close proximity to Nellis AFB so if you get here right at 11, you can have a quick lunch with your significant other!  Complimentary chips, beans, and salsa, friendly bartenders, colorful Mexican decorations, and live Spanish guitar.    My wife enjoys the cheese enchiladas with chicken mole combo and I like the pollo correteado.  The sole drawback is the limited parking which I solve by parking on the otherwise of the adjacent gas station and Capriotti's.  One of the best Mexican Restaurants in Las Vegas, despite its location.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Colorful atmosphere!
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. A great selection of tequila at the bar, if somehow you survived college without a bad encounter with tequila!

slgyfTVDiMvi2VBspirSAA.text: Can I put no stars?? Goodness, I have been coming for over 16 years, never has the service been this horrible! I get it your busy it's a Sunday but passing by our table numerous times and barely acknowledging us is just rude.  We sat down and waited for our drinks over 5 minutes to get asked what we wanted, had to ask to get soup! Finally after order was taken we waited over 40 minutes. Two families, of 4 mind you,  sat down after us  and were done eating and paid their bill and yet we were still waiting on our food!  Finally when we decided to get up and leave that's when we were asked and told our food would be coming out shortly! Seriously that is what it takes for someone to show courtesy and tend to you!  Oh and get this I walk back to get managers card and name, I'm standing there hearing them talk and the man has the balls to state he had informed us our food was already coming, I CORRECTED HIM, YES YOU TOLD US OUR FOOD WAS COMING WHEN WE GOT UP TO LEAVE! BEFORE YOU LIE MAKE SURE THE PERSON ISN'T STANDING RIGHT IN FORNT OF YOU!

xfkM96yU90sIXWyA3w12TA.text: Ambiance:  The restaurant is in the east side of Vegas , on Craig. The decor reminds of old Mexico implying the food is authentic. Since its Halloween, the decor was based on their dia de muerte festival.   Service: Service was wonderful, the waiters knew the food well and gave me good recommendations based on the preferred protein that I wanted. The waiter was attentive to our needs.  Food: Food was great, the complimentary nachos with the salsa and refried beans were really good. Expect to keep on munching on the nachos while waiting for the entrees. The salsa had a good roasted tomato taste with spice that keeps you eating the nachos! The entree that I had was grilled chicken and it tasted great. Plus the freshly made flour tortillas made the dining experience better.  Overall: I would definitely come back to try the other entrees, dining experience is great and the quality of the food is very good , the nachos is a definite bonus. Next time I want to try this restaurant for dinner with the family this time.

gY1_KSD5pRvFXCtouBQ2xA.text: One of my favorite local restaurants. The service is always quick and the food is wonderful. Their variety of food is definitely a delight for the senses. The atmosphere is always clean and the staff is amazing.

aFVhYtxxSkE0N-WBSpPWig.text: Now this was legit Mexican food. And what a dining experience. Felt like a luxury restaurant and the food and menu was amazing. Servers are dressed up in white dress shirts and they wheel out the sizzling food.  I had a chicken lunch dish and don't regret it for a second. Have to come back here to explore the menu more. Great place to take someone for a date too I think. Five stars!  Yum Yum :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty nice bar with videopoker

X9yiYZzRZiYPGnX8NIw5og.text: Check your credit card after you go here, I got charged $30 for a $12 meal. Shady.  Food is good, service is pleasant but slooooooooow.

EHDsdm1l3XiCaqlMNYy72w.text: the only thing you need too know....this place is a must try! welcoming environment, friendly staff and delicious food!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful, authentic Mexican decorations. Good Vibes.

3O6tBCO-gLjYDVEupJpZEg.text: Zapatas a local favorite of many but didn't quite live up to my expectations. For what it was supposed to be or at least what I was assured it was from the masses, Very good authentic mexican food. I came with a party of three including I for a brunch breakfast meal, our server was a little tone deaf or hard at hearing maybe a combination of the two. When our orders were brought to the table we had items missing some that were requested and some that were supposed to be included with the meal or so the menu says but after my argument with my server he assured me I was wrong. The food itself was ok I did like it but my rice tasted a little dry how can something be wet and have a dry taste to it was it microwaved?

e4hJrfmSgU4jjSI6wlLhgg.text: I ended up in this place after a 6 hour flight between Ford Airport in Michigan and Chicago's O'Hare. By the time I got to Vegas I was tired, hungry and in need of a drink. I ended up walking into this place during Happy hour. Within minutes there were two huge margaritas on the rocks with extra salt in front of me and an encyclopedic menu of house specialties in my hands! So far so good!   The guacamole, house salsa and chips were great. The all inclusive sampler appetizer was more then three people could go through and the portion sizes were borderline gluttonous...everything was perfect. I had the Pollo Sarandeado Estilo "Rebelion". It was spicy enough to order another margarita but flavorful and not over the top with heat.   The service and ambiance was wonderful. The waitstaff was prompt and on their best game and the drinks and food kept coming throughout the night. There were also decommissioned rifles and other weapons all over the walls and seeing how I was there to attend a military course, I felt right at home. I'll definitely come here again!

O0MXry-YrwV6eWrdDjvnBA.text: We normally love this place. We've been going here for years. Went in today for lunch and the service was terrible! I could understand if it was busy but it was not. It felt as though our waiter along with the other staff didn't care about us or anyone else being there- new staff? We'll probably give it another try since it's always been good in the past. The food was good and the hostess was nice.

oabaRG1n30dXquHqEGoj6w.text: Great food with big portions definitely a good choice. They have plenty of food choices. Service was good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

Tld08M0_2CTRg-mggWYvhw.text: This is probably my favorite mexican restaurant in las vegas, the chili relleno is really good and i love that they give you chips, salsa and bean dip when you first get seated. Their strawberry margaritas are flavorful and strong! Its my go tondate nught spot.

8xjI0NEkM_-4GI8LqVWv4Q.text: I was recommended to go here since I've been a long time fan of Lindo. Moved to Aliante and drove down to check it out. I love the bacon wrapped shrimp even more than Lindo's. Food is tastier and a little cheaper but the only drawback is the waiting area is super small so you most likely will have to wait outside. Definitely try this place even just for the chips and dip.

YpNe8Sj8NXrFQSk2kxB1uA.text: Since I have to eat healthier, we've been careful of the places we've been picking (Especially when we're on the road). I have been coming here for years and I have to APOLOGIZE, I haven't mention this eatery until now. The staff here has always been friendly and bring you chips and two stone bowls with salsa as soon as you're seated.  One is a warm bean dip which is creamy and warm and the other is a finely ground tomato based salsa.  Viva Zapatas do have healthier dishes on their menu, but they are not "flagged" as such.  My favorite dish here is named after the owner's Grandmother, so you know it has to be good and it's on the healthy side.  It is called, Pollo Estilo "Abuelita Magdalena", which is two Grilled Chicken breast simmered in olive oil, fresh lime juice, garlic, oregano and yellow peppers.  The chicken is flavorful and kept moist from the cooking process.  The plate is also shared with rice, guacamole and beans.  Every time we have to go to Nellis Air Force base/North Las Vegas, we always stop by Zapatas for a meal (my wife says the Margarita's are good, too)!

KGHtAHKFpXwr9DUOaZXnTg.text: Because of the reviews we found here on Yelp we stopped in today for lunch. As it turns out the food was really only AVERAGE! The wait at 12:30pm was 30 minutes so we decided to eat in the bar as you can order from the FULL menu when seated there. We ordered a Taco Salad with Shredded Beef to share. I was surprised to find the meal lacking in flavor... the beef, though fairly moist, had almost no depth of flavor.  Also, I had expected there to be some beans included with the meat (hubby didn't) and there were none. Salad-wise the lettuce was fresh and crisp. There were NO other veggies - I would have liked some onions, radish, purple cabbage and substantially more Pico de Gallo than the SPRINKLING that was included. Though there was a small scoop each of guacamole and sour cream the salad needed either an option of dressing OR substantially MORE Pico, guac., and/or sour cream. Service at the bar was spot-on!   For these reasons we feel that the best rating we can give is 3 out of 5 stars. We hope that Viva Zapata's improves their food quality so that we can stop in the next time we travel to North Vegas to go to the VA Hospital and Clinics.

SvIq6ppdeuF2izGzEaNGQg.text: Love the food and the friendly staff.  The gentleman playing music was a definitely a plus!

8-6AlxMZjUjfuxPYNMM4Pg.text: I've been going to this restaurant for a while now. It's always great however went there the other night early dinner and it was absolutely outstanding in the north area of Vegas I would certainly recommend and this place to eat and drink for that matter they have great margaritas my partner had a chimichanga enchilada Style and I had three cheese enchiladas and it was outstanding

a2BoQChOAgKUAjdncn5m2g.text: Viva Zapata's has been our go-to Mexican restaurant since '09. Why haven't I reviewed them?  Because I'm selfish :)  You can't go wrong here. Anything and everything is good on their menu. Try not  to have too much of the complimentary chips, salsa and beans or you'll run out of space for your main dish. My little one prefers to have her birthday dinner here every year. She loves the attention and of course the birthday churros!  Service is always top notch. Ask for Jesus, he is awesome. Can't complain about anything, really. If you do go for dinner, I suggest making a reservation because it can get really crowded.

0IHsWKHK4_rybwSi1s5pvQ.text: Not a bad mexican restaurant... hard to find an amazing one but they have great homemade tortillas and amazing drink specials at happy hour. Their green sauce is delicious. I didn't care for the cheese enchiladas and I LOVE cheese. Kind of seemed to be cheap cheese because it was very chewy. But all in all it is a good place, just not the best we have been to.

N51y6-T4uGT_ld4qEDon8w.text: Just like the reviews, they have a live Mexican music here. Service at bar was quick. Good bean dip, good salsa and good chips. Maybe it's because I came on a week day, but it was not busy here today which was good for me and the rest of the customers. I ordered the fish tacos deep fried and they wee delicious. I will come back here again and try the other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

JGTEKR7prMPvDbpGRN344Q.text: Food was amazing. Even though people thought it was pricey I had bacon wrapped shrimp $18 but it came with 8 shrimp well worth the money. The only bad thing is they don't have elote or I would never need to go anywhere else

xdrcMXRD9Ze9ImwQVyv8_Q.text: Great food , and amazing margaritas . We had a discrepancy in our bill and the Manager Ramon was quick to rectify this situation . We will be back . * Happy Hour 2 for 1 prices.

E19cuff5FwMS7caymRDFgA.text: Other yelpers will disagree, but I think this is the best Mexican restaurant in town. The food, decor, and service are all top notch.  I love the little things about this restaurant. Guacamole is made table side, tortillas are crispy yet chewy, chicken breasts are butterflied, and the salsa is spicy without being overwhelming. Everything adds up to create an enjoyable dining experience.  Of particular note is the mole. It is smooth, rich, complex, and somewhat spicy. The mole is so layered that it is impossible to discern all of the ingredients. However, they blend and play with each other to create something that is close to magic.  For a nice low calorie treat that's sure to delight your Vegan friends, try the Quesa Fundido con Rajas. Ok, so it's not low calorie. But you really should try it at least once a year. The hot cheese wrapped in chewy tortillas is beyond words.  One of my favorite parts about Zapatas is that it is a community restaurant. I always see people in uniform here, whether they are from the police department or Nellis. People meet here after work, come here on dates, and bring their families. We always bring our out of town guests here.   I can't say enough good things about this restaurant.

nnYyLxOGm-ZpB4EtLmQE9A.text: Excellent food.  Pretty authentic.  Negra Modelo on tap.  Flour tortillas made by hand.  Service was fast

aU2sTvtCWr2PA5XD_9xXWw.text: Not bad for East Coast Mexican.  Mole is worth it. Don't let the outside appearance fool you.

STfmK25gCed_bzXB3S08_g.text: One of the best Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas! They have authentic cuisines. Just ask for their specialty for beef, chicken or pork. They will recommended what the popular menus are. Be aware that portions are big enough to share.

wH5GF9odSFAqaQLouIqnoQ.text: We enjoyed this Mexican Restaurant.  The food and the service was good.  We ordered a Mexican Shrimp DIsh, Glazed Chicken and Carne Asada Tacos and all was very good.  Live music played while we ate dinner which was very nice.  We all left very full and satisfied.  The price was right and I would suggest trying this restaurant some time.

VN5KZsShZPZj5xW2AVmjLQ.text: Fantastic atmosphere, great service and the food was delicious. I've finally found a good Mexican restaurant in Vegas!  3 years later...

jsPhCBnxm1KIcYjsA4dvZA.text: We love this place and always come for Enchiladas, the services is excellent and prices are just right. Live music and polite servers make this place our favorite Mexican restaurant.

FVPi_NzQ6p3359E2le10Yg.text: Yum! We went here for my boyfriends birthday! and the food was amazing. They even sang him happy birthday with live guitar and it really felt like a FIESTA!

K_Y-8BtxYJvJ8CKWSIIDSg.text: First impression was nice.  The hostess was very friendly and professional. She greeted us and offered us a carrier for our babies car seat so that was a plus.  She sat us down and not to long after we had our waiter take our drinks. They handed us chips and salsa right away. We placed our order and munched on the chips and salsa which was pretty yummy.  But the wait just to get our food was pretty lengthy. We ended up getting full off of the food because of the wait. So when our food finally came it was nice and hot.  I ordered the steak enchilada mole. One bite and it was so overly stuffed with cheese.  Almost to the point where it made me sick. I could bearly taste the mole.  I Know that I will never ordered this again. I also had the Carne asada salad. It was overpowered with lime. It had no flavor. Another thing I will not order again.  My son had the steak cognac.  I took a bite and it was good they cooked it med rare perfect. My husband had the shrimp and it was cooked just right also and there was good flavor.  If it was based off service alone I would put another star.  Maybe I'll come back and try a different item but so far I was not impressed with my food.

UOxXCOdoyasaijMlUacazw.text: First of all, I live in Henderson and come to this place when I am craving authentic Mexican food. In other words, I travel about 30 minutes and pass a lot of restaurants along the way. I have tried a few dishes that have been really good, but I think I have a favorite- the pork marinated in Coca-Cola. The pork is tender (not fatty), and is covered in a sauce that will make you slap your momma. Oh, did I mention there is a lady in the back making homemade tortillas? Please remember to tip this nice lady -- she is working hard back there. The staff is friendly and attentive , and there is a good chance you will catch live music while enjoying the best Mexican food in Las Vegas.

ku3l5t-KMm8psXDgZpZnLA.text: Good. Nice inside, guitar guy on point. But for some reason the ladies up front are always grumpy rude or idk.

mFf3QJeHO33SwoMBfbjHvw.text: Wow! Good food and very fast. I went in Tuesday at 1pm. Still a big lunch crowd but my chicken enchiladas were to my table within 5 minutes. I also took a carne asada burrito to go. Great chips, salsa and bean dip!

GJJWHfLaXYPtVnLfcKywqA.text: Absolutely the very best Mexican food restaurant I have ever been to, anywhere. Out of everything that has ever been ordered between myself, my husband, and any of our friends and family we have come here with, no one has ever had anything bad. This place is amazing from the food to the service. Customer for life, without a doubt. I even bought a few of their shirts! :P

3K18PZLKeGylmLTaffuh8w.text: Delicious food and great ambience!  We were on a road trip heading south looking for lunch close to the 15 freeway.  Thanks, Yelp, for bringing us here!  We were pleased right off the bat with the warm tortilla chips, hot bean dip, and salsa as soon as we sat down.  We're suckers for tableside guacamole, which was great as well.  The portions were huge - we only needed two entrees to feed me, my wife, and our two kids.  We got the fish tacos and the combination with a chili relleno and green chile pork burrito.  My only criticism of the food is that the peppers they used for the relleno were VERY mild and I like them to have a bit more punch.  The kids enjoyed the live mariachi and had fun watching them make the tortillas fresh behind a window in the corner of the restaurant.  All in all a pleasant meal and we were back on the freeway quickly.

1BfLx6RruIK5Dzpi9xVRuA.text: I'm still here waiting, 45 min now for 6 tacos, not even combo orders, simple orders but they lack the urgency to wait on customers,I will not be back

ZZ-2vF0kyPNggtSwT2eGrQ.text: Right off the Craig Rd. exit on the 15 North is a great little Mexican restaurant called Viva Zapatas. It's a relatively small spot that you would probably miss if you weren't looking for it. The food is excellent, but the parking is tight. Zapatas makes for a great lunch spot or a great dinner place to wow your out of town guests. The restaurant has a cozy atmosphere and features a cool bar in the center of the restaurant with a couple of over head tv screens so you won't miss the big game. You can find a picture or two of Emilliano Zapata hanging on the walls along with a few other eclectic Mexican artifacts. The food is excellent! They start you off with chips, salsa, and beans. This place reminds me of a great Mexican restaurant that is no more called Sal's Mexican Inn in Oxnard,Ca. Go with a combination plate, no need for an appetizer because the portions are good. I like the #4 combo which is a pork burrito, chicken enchilada, chicken taco, and rice and beans. I like to substitute the chicken taco for a chorizo taco. I'm not sure if the chorizo taco is even on the menu, but don't leave without one. They are excellent. The pork burrito is so tasty and the chicken enchilada pops off your plate and into your mouth. The enchilada is smothered in cheese just how I like it. Be sure to order the guacamole and watch them come over to your table and make it fresh in front of your eyes. The guacamole is first class. Zapatas also has a killer chile relleno. On the way out don't leave without what I call the best after dinner mints in town-undisputed. These little green babies aren't so minty, but more lemon limey. They will leave a refreshing taste in your mouth for the ride home. The bottom line is no matter what you order at Viva Zapatas you won't be disappointed, so if you're in Northtown you have to drop by.

iyHO-h4pVVyKvQLB2y1yvg.text: Expansive menu, food with a depth of flavors, and live mariachi music. This is my go to restaurant for Mexican food and features a surprisingly delicious steak menu. You can watch the tortillas being handmade. It's out of the way for most Las Vegans, but worth it.

IlqBHsjcNqpbgsfilD7Luw.text: We like Zapatas very much. I've eaten there about 50 times. It is good Mexican food for a reasonable price. All of the food is good and Dinners come with soup. Lunch menu is available until 5pm and save you a couple bucks but without soup. Happy hour goes til 6pm, and they have a few drink specials. Dinner is nice because they have live music. Good atmosphere. Actually would like to give it a 4.5 stars and think that it is one of the best mexican restaurants in Las Vegas and one of the best restaurants overall in the North East part of the City!

JwnJod93Qq3W_3Z6D7ta-w.text: The hubs and I were there for dinner last night and it was amazing! The service was impeccable, the were very attentive to us, even thought there were some large parties seated near us. The servers were not wandering aimlessly throughout the restaurant, they were on a mission to please the customers and make sure that they felt as though they were the only guest in the house! Jose, our waiter was excellent, his other server-bus was literally running throughout the tables cleaning up, serving chips, and checking on tables...Our food came out in a timely manner and was excellent! The homemade flour tortillas are outstanding and the manager inquired as to how our meal was @the end of dinner and was genuine about it! It is close to nellis afb which was perfect! We may have to go back for cinco de mayo!

A1-RGJBmovbuU8J3hOn1_Q.text: Prompt polite service, clean booths, pleasant live music, fresh and fast food. Just the ticket for anyone at Nellis AFB. Interior nicer than exterior.

s9-aRNeToLp7dBoSS0i8Kg.text: The service at this place is impeccable! The food and drinks are on point as well. Everything is very fresh. You can tell. They made our guacamole at the table. I ordered the Pollo al Cognac. It was very good and unlike anything I had ever tasted before. Glad we ended up here.

bFtcllSSmC0RnEUNXBlyMg.text: Best Mexican food hands down!!!! I have been searching for an authentic Mexican restaurant and I believe I've found it. We came for lunch & the food was awesome. They offer over 22 lunch specials that all come with rice, beans & tortillas. Let's not forget the complimentary chips, salsa, and bean dip. The salsa was LEGIT lol none of that generic watery salsa from a container. It was roasted from chilies and perfection to my mouth. Lol overall it's an awesome place with great food & service! Must try!!!

NXHeldICgR-KBl7YaZ-gyA.text: I'm conflicted about my review. I would give it a 2.5. The parking is terrible like everyone says. The salsa was really good. The live music was a nice touch. The food was just OK. I have had better Mexican food and I've had worse. I'm always suspicious of a Mexican restaurant when it is chock full of White people and no, or very few Mexican-Americans.   My husband liked his shrimp dish, but my pork dish was meh, unmemorable. I took home most of it and gave it to my husband. He will eat almost anything. I would not order a pork dish there again.   I don't know if we will be going back again, definitely not at a busy time when parking is difficult.

zsP_TFlXj97rsGbsDdhc9Q.text: Love this place. Use to live down the street now moved to the other side of Vegas and I still drive all the way up there. The food and SERVICE is excellent. You will never have to worry about being ignored, their customer service is what sticks out to me the most and the food is a + . Love their avocado tacos!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avacado tacos.  (without cabbage)

Y5yywtvnhGMqpjBFWdrg5A.text: Good, plentiful Mexican food. Hot, fresh chips with complimentary bean dip and salsa, although I prefer pico de gallo style rather than the tomato sauce-based offering here. (Pro tip: mix the salsa into the bean dip and add a little pinch of salt.) The service is great and everyone was friendly. The restaurant's super dark, though; we had to crack the blinds to see the menu (hey, our eyes aren't as young as they used to be).

4sqN-5Yw2LyMzieV3B0S7w.text: I would not recommend this place for a birthday celebration. I told the waiter several times it was my sister birthday and they were supposed to sing for her and they didnt. The food was good it just took a bit for the food to come out.

vc0fXUAthItK13w4oWO5fg.text: I was really excited to come here, especially because they have guac!!! I've heard many positive things about the restaurant so I decided to give it a try. We were greeted by a friendly host and sat in a booth as requested. It wasn't too busy so I expected things to go smoothly, but I was wrong. Server came to get our drink order and they came fast but from there on everything went down hill. We ordered guacamole and it took about 15 mins before the server came and made it table side. After that we put in our entree order and that took about 40 minutes. By the time our food came we were full from the chips, guac, salsa, and beans but we still managed to share my chicken sopitos (they were soooooo good). Unfortunately because the food took so long we weren't able to eat our torta. I asked for the manager because we were unhappy with how our experience had gone so far. He apologized but it didn't seem sincere, he was actually making excuses of why it took so long(a torta does NOT take 40 minutes to make). I mean, I've worked in the restaurant industry and if someone's food ever took long I would apologize and find a way to make it better(no we weren't fishing for free food, we paid for what we consumed). All in all the food was good but it took way too long, not sure I'll be back.

yaiCRIQ2ZKWoC6hR7dk4Bg.text: This is my family's favorite restaurant! The tacos are amazing and we love that they give you beans with your chips and salsa! The atmosphere is so fun and the people, service, and food are amazing!

o2Ge7ljejhxUvBuP1Qtabg.text: Love this place! Amazing service. Fast and friendly. It's nice and cozy in there and no matter what you order it'll be delicious!

L5cILvBsJrpAmlOZWFVz_w.text: We come here once a month or so and are never disappointed. Service is good and employees are friendly. Ordered the shrimp quesadilla for an appetizer and it was delicious. Cobb salad for dinner. Another delicious meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow!  Cobb salad. Delicious!

T3G3mdJhFkfxZp9pUPlp1w.text: Move-over, Lindo Michoacan! These guys are legit! Ask for the guac dip, AMAZING! Love the decor, the Tia Maria making the hand made tortillas in the back, the music, the staff is wonderful.   I love absolutely everything on their menu. I've tried almost everything. Green Chilaquiles, Carne Asada, Fideo Soup, yummmm....Everything is good.  I hate that to come here I have to drive 45 + minutes from Henderson. :-( If ever in the North side of town and in the mood for some good, authentic Mexican, try this place.  UPDATE REVIEW:   After coming back a few times after writing my last review, I can't help to notice how much the quality of the food has gone down.   As a faithful customer of this place, I can say it is NOT what it used to be. They are so busy, service is terrible. The food now lacks authenticity. Tastes like they cook everything on the same pan.   Sad to see this place slowly start to slack and lose something so good...because they had it for a while. Hope things improve. I will not come back soon and spend $17 on a mediocre dish.  Step it up, Viva. Lindo Michoacan is starting to sound better than your place. :-/

qYK3vxFDoioxwkOcCfFaWg.text: Great guacamole and fresh flour tortillas. Enchiladas and steak Chile Colorado was very good.

8-GmWRGxgK2uORsnRiVlHw.text: Being from a Puerto Rican and Mexican family, I enjoy authentic Mexican food. Food here is great. Large menu with many choices and combo plates. Servers are quick to bring refills on chips, salsa, or drinks. My first time here was at dinner time and aside from the lighting not being that great, everything else was perfect. I felt just like family and welcomed by everyone working there. Being from CA, I have had many different types of Mexican food from numerous places. This place is definitely a go to when I'm craving Mexican food.  Only downfall in my opinion, which is why I did not give them 5 stars, is because of their parking lot situation. Very few spots to park in. Luckily my first time here it wasn't too busy. But the second time I came here, there were no spots and nearly had to battle someone else for an open spot when someone left.  Definitely will be back again.

MSdERop9pzH6FkhMQSMxaQ.text: Was looking for a place to take my in-laws. After reading the reviews on Yelp, we decided to try it. Was a little apprehensive about the location,  but looks can be deceiving.  The place was amazing!!! Excellent service, food was delicious, and it was wrapped up in a very authentic atmosphere!  My husband and I rarely go out for dinner and we've already gone back.

04_BEVfi81yb0Rjk2pTBYA.text: The food was delish! The Atmosphere was great! The bar stools were horrendous, they killed our backs! Won't be sitting at the bar waiting for our table = Lost bar revenue! They need additional parking, circled their inadequate,  small parking lot for 20 minutes,  1 handicapped spot! Great food, but not worth the trouble.

6f6YBJSuhRLxe_KzTRCuRg.text: This was my first visit as I've heard great things about this being one of the few great places to eat Mexican food and I wasn't disappointed.  One thing I always find that's a hallmark of a great restaurant is great service from being greeted at the door to when you sit down and how you're attended during your meal and Viva Zapata was all those things and attentive to my drink, chips, salsa, and bean dip.  I just want to mention that bean dip with chips is something few places offer but always wins me over in a Mexican restaurant.   I ordered the Torta de Pierna which is a pork sandwich that came out with some time that shows it wasn't just heated up and made with care.  The bread was perfectly toasted and the meat was tender, juicy, and flavorful.   I didn't feel a hot plate nor was warned about one and that's something that always makes me feel great before a bite.    I'm looking forward to future visits and trying more plates from this place due to the food, service, and overall atmosphere.

pL1fqIOrlEePaJRW8S7UfA.text: We stopped in after going to the speedway and we were starved. This cute little restaurant was just perfect for our hungry tummies! We ordered the beef flautas and the shrimp fajitas and they were brought out sizzling and tasted great! Service was good and fast. Well worth it. Chips and salsa were yummy too!

JdOLsl36PcjGz0Fb2tcc1A.text: Food is good not the best , but OMG this place has the best margaritas!!! I tried one here and I've been hooked. Bad thing you don't get comp drinks while gambling.. ;p

r-bpLB77hfBclS2eEVFdjw.text: I absolutely love this place, the staff are wonderful and this is the best authentic Mexican food in Las Vegas hands down!!

KPIT4REqKD3pjsYc-i6OuQ.text: The food and wait staff were excellent. The food was authentic and plenty. Started off with great tasting chips (not the store bought ones), a smoky flavored salsa and bean dip. Then a small cup of delicious soup followed by my lunch.  The entree was very good. The staff was very attentive. I am very suspicious of Mexican food being good since I live in CA and Mexican food is a staple. I highly recommend this place for an off the strip experience with normal prices. Well worth it.

8mu8Znh1f6mzplM9cO8i9Q.text: This is the best Mexican food on this side of town.  The Pescado Eufimio Zapata has a wine based sauce, with Spanish olives, that is the best I've ever had.  They also have decent priced lunch specials on weekdays.

UVawHfrgLBgsWVYyl8-Zlg.text: Yes,  Viva! Zapata's is right.  I have been to this place 4 times so far.  I live in California otherwise I would be there every week.  The food is incredible.  Authentic mexican food, with tons of flavor!  The service is superb.  Chips and salsa are on point.  They also bring you bean dip and fideo as a starter. Order the guacamole, they make it table side from scratch.  Real avocados, jalapenos, lime, garlic, cilantro, etc.  It is soo tasty.  I have been for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  Everything I have eaten from seafood to machaca has been great.  I will go there everytime I visit Las Vegas. You should try this place as a good alternative away from the strip and alot more economical.  P.S.  Homemade tortillas!!  That's reason enough to visit this place!

W9pZJy7wjYj_hScUGjI2sg.text: We were looking for place to celebrate my moms birthday! My husband remembered this place he visited few months ago and i checked reviews on yelp and decided to give it a try. I couldn't be happier!!! Delicious Food! Live music! The most friendly customer service! We had sooo much fun!! Their guacamole is a must!! And Margaritas are the best!!! Highly recommended!!!

2hHxjwDAxa_VmaDfyG-Dvw.text: The atmosphere is fun and inviting but they use fake chicken or canned chicken it's not fresh. I personally think it is disgusting chicken even though the rest of the food is wonderful

7AjgyCEN10F5DkICR__kxg.text: Having lived in Southern CA and dining with my son's Mexican family for the past 7 years, I would rate Viva Zapatas as one of the best authentic Southwest Mexican restaurants in town.  I don't know what Texican food is like, but from Santa Fe west, this ranks top in my book.  And...they serve real micheladas!  If you haven't had one, try it!  I drive across town just for this food.

_W_vr2gYPQW3Ry0pkyprGw.text: Fideo soup is pretty good.  Their Carne Asada tacos are good along with their chips and salsa.  A bit over prices but it's worth it once in a while.  No fatty pieces of beef with the tacos.

2RWOYlmh3cGGcRu_-17EEA.text: Delicious, authentic food.   Cozy atmosphere.  Nice live music.  Service cannot be beat!  Highly recommend for lunch or dinner.  Only suggestion is come early, parking is tight  & seats fill fast!

QQfRjtyoUnV8BLQOZF5LVg.text: excellent food! visitors from out of town alway ask to go here!

zqOHJuEq7vxO2F4dUxenUA.text: Best Mexican sit down restaurant we have found in Vegas. It's a hidden gem in an industrial area of town, but it never disappoints. The waiters are always very friendly and remember us when we come in. Their portions are large enough you could share. Their drinks are delicious, but their homemade tortillas are why we frequent this restaurant so often!

9wx_vv4Fy1L_z1KQiMHiSA.text: Lighting was really poor, menu description really small, thank goodness for flashlight app. Filled up a little to much on chips and salsa. First brought out soup that was good but all it was is broth. Service slow but they did stop by our table to ask if everything was OK. Good was good, I had Chili Colorado and it was cooked perfectly. I would recommend it if you on that side of town.

PTk8PmsFcO5F_g7fpObcHg.text: Food was amazing and the service was better than amaZing. Can't go wrong with some live Mexican music!

MuUOwwyatoU7OaPRfnISSw.text: Great authentic Mexican food.  Staff is friendly and on point.  Good customer service.

vSRyaV6qVfXHJsToNi7lyw.text: Zapatas has decent food, but this review is about my To Go order.... $7.50+ for a "medium" salsa.... and No Chips!#! It was far short of a Medium. and No Chips?? Boo!!

yXKLAIhs5Y5bvFF-Emcm-w.text: This place is great. Have been there quite a few times and it is one of my favorites. The fideo soup that is given with every meal is great and I have even ordered a large bowl of it once.  The shrimp stuffed avocados, queso fundido, shrimp cocktails are awesome.  The service in the restaurant is pretty good but the bar is a little off. Every time I go they mess up the drink, never bring it, or bring the check when you ask. It isn't one bartender either, it has been a few different ones. Just order the drinks at the table and you will like it.

4nxcWFOrgUvBz9TvIAeCpg.text: As long as you are looking for traditional Mexican food rather than Tex-Mex this place is wonderful. The service is top notch, the food is great, and the live music gives it a flare of excitement and authenticity.  A friend of mine introduced me to this restaurant a while back and ever since then I have been huge fan. They serve things you do not get at chain restaurants like their own specialty noodle soup, which is especially good during the winter season, refried beans as a chip dip, and a array of dishes that are mouth watering.   The inside is very small and it is more of a locals restaurant than a tourist place which means that it is cheaper cost wise and you get better service. Granted you might get put in a odd spot to eat but I have found that every sitting area offers something different to look at. I love to bring my out of town guest and friends here to eat because it offers such a large variety of food items to chose from and because they always leave satisfied.

4pgWaAE8CjDhr2oa_dTsrg.text: I was really surprised at the quality and authenticity of the food!  I ordered the bacon wrapped shrimp and was extremely pleased.  Oh man, I want some right now!  The menudo was also good.

bzLx-XIr3Wdl9JPKsrJM1w.text: I like this place it's a wonderful place if you want to go with your family (with kids), friends, colleagues. This place is excellent and a great variety of menu items above and beyond the usual boring choices you would find anyplace else. Not to mention the amazing service.

qUrpPmO1XEFEnLezrXcUjg.text: The beans.... Oh the beans! And they're complimentary. Along with the Fideo soup. Oh, man! I would eat just that, it makes me so nostalgic for meals from my past.  With that said, everything we have tried has been very good. We have been here a few times and have not been disappointed. The parking lot is a hot mess and the seating area is small but once you sit down and they bring the complimentary beans, salsa, chips and soup I am already so happy that I end up ordering a small meal to share with someone! So if you want to get off the strip and have a good, more authentic Mexican meal head over to Viva Zapatas!

h22yr7Yjbe0YZ4jdbMS_qQ.text: First of all I love this place. Good food. I always come here and the Manager is very sweet. She was on it and took good care of us. Oh ya and fresh made tortillas. YUUUUM.

gUByH0ayFn-uNMl0MI6arA.text: Terrific service and great authentic food! Fresh guacamole made at your table.  Despite being super busy the waiter noticed I got a red smothered tamale and offered to replace it! Shows attention to customer and detail. When I come to Vegas I will always come here to eat! Yum!!!!

Lo-zHAmFRqzWFYR8LtofOA.text: There is no question as to why this was awarded Best of Las Vegas for 2 years. The wait staff was so professional, a joy to just watch. The extensive menu was creative and the Shrimp stuffed peppers were out of this world. Very authentic decor for a Mexican restaurant named Viva Zapata. We highly recommend this restaurant. We will come again when we are back in North Las Vegas.

6vvCamSwduiP9jRBYHwPGg.text: I don't know why this nasty place is so over rated. This place is disgusting and is not authentic. I had this place with my kids and was way dissatisfied. My wife heard of all the "good" reviews and wanted to go, I tried to warn her but I guess my word wasn't good enough. Well enough said since she's the wife we ended up going. I didn't even order anything at this place the second time around. She did she got some chicken plate ended up with diarrhea and ended up telling me she should have listened to me because her stomach was all bubbly and stuff. So if you do you come to this place eat at your own risk. YOU'VE BEEN WARNED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

2K-ktyc9uxHeYK2swg-cLw.text: This was my kind of place.  My family loved it.  I'll definitely be back because of the food, ambience, and wait staff.  I'm sorry to say that the only thing/person that sucked was the Hostess last night (04/21/2018) whom is the first person that is supposed to greet you and make you feel welcomed upon your arrival.    Not only was she not welcoming but she was straight out rude!  I don't know, maybe she was having a bad day because there's no way someone could be that rude in that position.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Something-something camarones
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &#34;a la mexicana&#34;

sH9DNbyu1qSO4oXtkvktZg.text: This place specializes in old, tired, uninspired dishes that maybe, were once relevant 25 years ago when Vegas was still a desert town with 10 Mexican restaurants to speak of and a chicken enchilada was a big deal.  But today, tasteless piles of slop that look like they were put together at an all-you-can-eat buffet is just not going to cut it. Fish and chicken that was previously frozen tastes like it. Dry, chewy and tasteless. These guys wrote the book on how to serve frozen blocks of flesh weeks later: "No worries,  just bury it under a ton of sauce and melted cheese. Those idiot gringos won't notice."  Another specialty of this place is the unbearably irritating wait staff that constantly interrupt every 2 minutes to refill our water glass after each sip, remove a plate the second I take my last bite, or asking us what we want to eat 30 seconds after sitting down and being handed a 5 page menu. GO AWAY goddamit!! and let your guests breathe!   The place looks old and shabby. The margarita mix is that sickly-sweet fake lime powder. Nothing good here. These guys need to shut down, retool and modernize.

ZXlAn5VDTx-C_V8JvmHbfw.text: Great authentic food. I wasn't super hungry at the time so I ordered a taco salad (something I wouldn't typically order), it was light on my tummy and very tasty.  My three coworkers ordered more traditional meals and there was a lady making fresh flour tortillas. The place was packed so we sat at the bar.  What a great place on the north end of Las Vegas. I would definitely go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. My half eaten taco salad, yum!

PHA-V-qTD1x56x_ZDYgr9w.text: Great food, environment and service.  Aye at the bar since the place was packed.  Regardless the service staff were attentive and quick.  Ordered carne asada tacos with beans and rice.  Loved the seasoning and flavor.

G13Y3ysEbKtaSd5eDBaVfQ.text: I usually have a good experience with this restaurant but the last few times they have dropped the ball. Tonight I ordered two simple dinners, chicken enchiladas and a shrimp tacos dinner. Both were not prepared properly. 1st, we placed a to go order by phone. To management- if you're going to have someone taking phone orders please make sure they can understand and speak English. We arrived at the restaurant, waited 20 mins and only received a half order of shrimp tacos. We had to wait for them to prepare our 2 shrimp tacos correctly. 2nd, we get home to find they only prepared 1 chicken enchilada...wow then to top it off the food was cold...damn Viva you suck lately. Maybe you can't handle success

AY4B66-Xr3M4D35_YajGuw.text: This is my first visit here and WILL BE COMING BACK from now on!!! The food here is DELICIOUS! Your welcomed right away at the door, when you get seated you get chips salsa and bean dip, super good! I ordered the #27 and it was SOOOO YUMMY! The staff is so warm and welcoming, the restaurant looks very clean and inviting. Love it here!

NKRyn1reO_dMa-hgEqaTtg.text: Well, I tried my very best to like this place the reviews were good with a few minor ones that were not so good, but nevertheless it had 4 stars....let's try it!! Man was I wrong, as the bad reviews stated the food was lacking in flavor minus the tableside guacamole that was yummy and their picante was on point!! Maybe they were having an off day, but first impressions counts in my book!! The service was awesome though... from the hostess, server, to manager and the busser I give them 4 stars. Thank you!!  Maybe this place would be good for drinks and apps...entrees not so much!! Oh the decor and ambiance 5 star right there!!

hOkjrr0U41xV1YIzwalU9w.text: I'm so sad. I ordered fideo soup and it was watery broth. I paid for watery broth :( The sad thing is that it was a delivery so I couldn't do anything about it. What makes me even more sad is that when I ordered my food it was already late and they had closed so I was just a sad soul with watery broth lol I'm so fuckinh sad over soup I cannot believe I'm this sad hahaha

Sg-XfeTHVmG4qNLiVs0jlQ.text: My mother, brother and I went here for diner today... the food was AMAZING. I ordered the guacamole and they came table side and made it in front of us. Soooo good! I also had the ceviche and carna Asada torta so yummy. Very authentic food.. left very pleased and full.. The customer service was perfect, I never had to ask or wait for a refill or anything. Alwayss came by to ask if we needed anything anytime they seen anything close to low! Very attentive . The atmosphere was relaxing and they had someone in there with live fun Hispanic music.. and singing not to loud but just enough to enjoy it.. I would definitely return. Had such a great experience. If you haven't tried it yet, please do. Definitely a diamond in a rough.

FZXCaVD03GXlprwosDO0vw.text: The best Mexican food ever! The ambiance is superb! Professional and courteous service!

hWfZaMmX0HQRifoHbjOkew.text: Ordered the Chile relleno a la carte, lengua pipian (green mole) and a pitcher of  margaritas on the rocks. The service was outstanding from the moment we walked in. We are from San Diego and I happen to find this place years ago while visiting the Nellis air force area. I never forgot about it and decided to pop in while driving back home from Utah. The menu is extensive but my go to has always been anything lengua. It is definitely worth the commute from the strip.

7sB9YuD9QBT6vd71hq4v8Q.text: The food here is excellent,  Cant go wrong with any dish here,  it's a upscale Hispanic restaurant with great atmosphere and hospitality. They make the guacamole in person at your table . Fresh tortillas. Be careful of the chips and salsa you will be full before your food arrives lol . The salsa is very blah in my opinion tastes funny. Most dishes here can be pricey within the $12.00 -$25.00 range. But they do have a lunch special menu with is worth catching.  Bar is located in the middle of the restaurant which you can also eat at. Parking lot is small and can be a pain to find parking if busy. The lighting is bad inside which is a missed opportunity for good pictures and food pictures.  Located near just off Craig and I-15 if your ever in the area and want some very good Hispanic food I do recommend. Go go go!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Well damn lol

d4WAeKvuKR9zaXiL331Ycw.text: Whenever it starts off great and starts slipping and slipping and soon you feel neglected, you can't help but to feel bum and disappointed especially when you genuinely liked your server.  We were immediately greeted and seated. The hostess was very welcoming and friendly.Good vibes. Annnnd...that's about it. Great personality when our server did appear, but even that was scarce. Food was just your average fare you would get in similar settings.  As we were nearing the end of our meal, it was really picking up in there. We left not disappointed nor did we drive off feeling thrilled. Couldve been an off night, but I am willing to try again. Just wouldn't go out my way just yet.  Definitely kid and stroller friendly.   Enjoy!

_Y9O77pgvtk_lEOsusHXhg.text: Wonderful Mexican restaurant. Full-bar with nightly music. Terrific full-service staff, where guacamole is prepared table-side. We wanted for nothing, including the house merlot, which was more than adequate for our meals.  I enjoyed the chili verde, which is my standard dish for a new Mexican restaurant. Save room for desserts.  Enjoy!

X6vDu4wejWk555O2YCOB2A.text: We went there for lunch.  It was not too busy, but service was a bit slow.   We were brought a red salsa that was probably the worst salsa I have had.   It was not just me.   Everyone in the group thought it tasted like an old cleaning rag.   We asked the waiter about the salsa, but he said the peppers are roasted and that's how it is.   Requested a green sauce instead, which never came.   Someone in the group ordered chilaquiles which were very tasty.   However the meat that she ordered with the chilaquiles looked and tasted more like jerky.    I had the fajitas which were good, not great.  Overall, was not impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taste horrible.  Nobody in the group liked the salsa.  We asked for green, but it never showed.
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

BofXBJ8rIvc_ncJ7XzmhLA.text: We came here for dinner as we were driving through and it's good, not great nor terrible. We made it for happy hour, so got the two for one margaritas/beer. The service is what is amazing here. We  got our drinks quickly, were giving our chips, salsa and beans right away and were checked on in several times. The atmosphere is warm with live music and football games on at the bar. If you're looking for good Mexican, go for it!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado salad was okay
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie fajitas
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two for one drinks!

EbqkIW8eibAyaY002kGqAQ.text: Service is good, food is and consistent. Not terribly remarkable but a good meal. Price are also reasonable. Well worth a try...

5QujV1fhy129JiLyfsRoTQ.text: We came here on a Sunday day morning. I was ecstatic to find that they open early and you can get lunch.  When we entered in we were we were greeted by the friendly staff and we were seated immediately. Again it was early so they weren't to busy.   Our waiter Jorge was awesome and very attentive. He kept our cups full and was had patience with our five year old.  We learned he had a young daughter and he certainly is great with kids.  They offer a soup for the table which is flavorful and delicious.  Our food arrived and both dishes we orders were really good.  No complaints  The establishment isn't in the greatest area, and there is a bus stop right outside and someone was digging through the garbage while we parked.    I think it's a must try if your looking for good Mexican food in a comfortable sit down restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrito, tamale with rice and beans. Also the yummy bean dipped served with the delicious chips!!
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Machaca and eggs, beans and rice served with your choice of tortillas

3IF-j1LcGlHnc0-7us_7JQ.text: 4 1/2 stars. I arrived during the late lunch hour which was a mistake. I parked in the back and was getting looks from the tennant so decided to move. I lucked out BC it was close to 1:00 and someone was leaving.   Once seated I received their signature warm bean dip, salsa and tortilla chips - so addicting. For my entree I selected the lengua with red sauce rice and beans. The portion was generous and the taste was delish. The home made corn tortillas hit the spot as I made my own lengua tacos.    The service here was spot on - friendly and refills without request. I can understand why Zapatas Mexican restaurant was voted best of Las Vegas and will certainly return.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lengua lunch w homemade corn tortillas
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm.salsa, beans with chips

QIG4Ndy7c1Zupuc8ohr9Bg.text: This is a great place for great Mexican foods. They serve wonderful queso fundido with peppers! The margaritas are not super sweet. Meals come with fresh soups. Every dish I've tried has been wonderful!
