photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp fajitas
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp L.... (Specialty dish) AMAZING!

uJlWABvNLhRQWZKjhFR_Xw.text: my girlfriend & i go to viva zapatas at least once a month. the chips/salsa/bean dip are reason enough to go. i've never disliked anything i've had there! the food is amazing and the service is always quick and very friendly! this is hands down my favorite mexican restaurant in las vegas and would 10/10 recommend to anyone visiting/staying in the north las vegas area.

xXIHnAyGckn16jmYpiQpDg.text: My husband and I went here for our date night! & oh my god, the service was beyond excellent! Our food was amazing! They made our guacamole in front of us which I thought was awesome! The staff was quick on getting our drinks and even refilling them along with our chips and salsa! We definitely will be going again. The restaurant is pretty small, but the service and food make up for it!

MoT4r7UNKImfjlfBGyFayw.text: I was very pleased with the whole thing.  The meal,  the atmosphere,  the decor,  and the staff.  Truly authentic.  I will return.

vw5tHyRXN74AhbNC5coy9w.text: My wife took me here for a date night & over all it was a very nice experience. The good things were the main courses & the service. The down side was the taste of the salsa that came complimentary with chips & some refried beans. The salsa had a very strange taste but since it was free we didn't see any reason to complain. My wife had the Shrimp enchiladas & they tasted great, I had the Lengua Revolution & it was friggin awesome. Lengua can either be really good or really bad. At Zappata it was wonderful, so tender you could have. Lien on it to cut it. Overall a wonderful dinner & atmosphere.

pj3keg-NO5KETnple4_NUw.text: Every time I dine at this restaurant the food is amazing and the service is spectacular! Probably the best Mexican restaurant in North Las Vegas! The lunch specials are great deals.

TGdQtIfdm-XEqb8FRdTwoQ.text: This place is great , has great food , music there is nice , Ive been coming to this place since I was little , it's my favorite restaurant and the food is amazing

TjkFL7R8IjJgPcRk2xEX9w.text: Beans and salsa are good but my husband is not a fan of them.  I got the chile rellenos and bean enchiladas they were good.   They had cheese on the beans that was too much cheese for me.  Chicken enchiladas were good  Cheviche de camaron was good

Oir5PmrtbG76FGt24CehAQ.text: Went to Viva Zapata's a couple weeks ago on the recommendation of a friend.  Every thing was tasty , we'll prepared , plentiful portions and our party of four all took some leftovers home in a doggy bag.  I tried the coca cola steak and really enjoyed it. I Also added a tostada it also was plentiful and the Pico de Gallo was the bomb.  The only reason that I'm not giving 5 stars is the service was a little bit slow even though we were doing dinner a little early and well outside their busy time.   I would recommend and return.

xz5yzPCOB-TGL4H6fqq4-g.text: This was definitely not a restaurant I would have tried had I not read the reviews on yelp first.  It's not in the best neighborhood and looks rundown from the outside.  I have now learned that appearances mean nothing.   The food was fantastic, and that's coming from someone who is not a big fan of Mexican food.   I had the tacos design Carne Asada and they were wonderful. The meat was so tender it melts in your mouth.  Add that to homemade tortillas and tortilla chips, and you can't go wrong.

tRYcDGDNt1n8XDxo_rxhzg.text: In town for work and found this gem on Yelp. Great atmosphere, cool AC, and delicious Mexican food.  I'm from Southern California which is known for Mexican, and I have to say, this was the best Mexican food I've had in a long time.  Been dip and salsa w chips to start, fideo soup with every meal, and I had a chicken enchilada (lots of white meat chicken), a hard shell shredded taco, and chile relleno.   Really good and I highly recommend !!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold Medelo Negro during happy hour .

ctUSvLfZ-v3FblsqrPlgrg.text: Wow. I have been here many times and can't i've never reviewed them. This is not your typical Mexican restaurant. The small innocuous restaurant serves up some incredible food with friendly fast and efficient service.  It seems like everything is made in house including the corn and flour tortillas. To start with you going to get chips with refried beans and a nice medium - hot salsa. The challenge is they are so good not to fill up on them prior to your meal arriving.  The meals come with a bowl of soup which consists of a nice consomme with micro noodles. Very flavorful and enjoyable. While they have the typical Mexican dishes on the menu, there are many things that I'm sure you've never tried before but need exploration. We had the fish  fillet stuffed with octopus and shrimp which was incredible. We also had the pork chili Verde pork was quite tender and flavorful and nice fresh chili verde sauce. The flavor quite complex and very enjoyable.  The servers are friendly, knowledgeable, and seem to really enjoy being there. They had live music consisting of a guitar player who also saying and it helped create a great atmosphere.  Don't be concerned about the number of stars on yelp as the reviews for real. This place is really that good.

mHjop4kVr9L4uwURs3Q6pg.text: Food and drinks were great. Server was very courteous. The only issue we has is that one of our left over plates was taken to be boxed up but it never was. The server took it and tossed it. He was very apologetic but it was not right. If it was any inexpensive food it would have been ok but it was shrimp!!

vbH2VbC8rUI54vn9jRBf5g.text: Viva Zapatas is Muy Bueno! YUM! (Hope I don't offend anyone with my limited Spanish...originally from Hawaii... so sorry) In Hawaii, we say "Ono!".  Anyways, off track, here we go with the review! The restaurant is located on the north side of town going towards the Speedway just off of I15 on East Craig located next to a gas station. It is 1 block off I15. For you folks in Las Vegas or Henderson, this Mexican restaurant is well worth the drive north.  I had lunch with some co-workers after volunteering at Three Square (I highly recommend if you like to volunteer and give back to the community). There was a bit of a wait since it was about lunchtime on a Tuesday. Plus, we had to park on the other side of the gas station. Parking spaces are very limited next to tis restaurant.  I love the ambience inside the restaurant. High ceilings and vintage decor. Cool and comfortable as well.  The food was great. I had one of the lunch specials. I had the cheese enchilada with a beef taco. It came with rice and beans. While we waited for the meals to come out, we enjoyed chips with salsa and bean dip. Good Stuff! Their regular size margarita was cool and refreshing. Glad I had the regular size, it was big as it was. I can't imagine the larger size.  So get your sombrero on and Vamonoso to Viva Zapatas soon!

NrKuoBwmjFW0dQOlDTlpUQ.text: Hidden gem! I was absolutely blown away by their service. From the outside, it just looks like a plain Mexican food joint next to a truck stop. Then inside decorations,music, and lighting transport you to festive Mexico.   The table side prepared guac was amazing. The staff are quick and friendly. Chips, drinks, sauces were refilled without havering to flag anyone down. Host was knowledgeable about the menu since there was a large selection of authentic food.   I've literally passed by this place hundreds of times on Craig. And now I think I've found my new local spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great atmosphere!

PSnckfZvBFps3a1Ssi0siA.text: Service is always on point the food is great!!! The atmosphere is accented by the Mariachi band or live music!!! I have been coming here for years & I will continue!!!

iAyRSzcX5H3DIyPVH818ZA.text: I felt like I was at my Nani's house... the food was authentic and delicious and they kept the chips and beans flowing...but, the Fidel soup! Omg I haven't had soup that good in years!! Will definitely be coming back!!

FTJ9X0YsZZacLlWns7vy0w.text: We had a wonderful lunch at Zapatas and a great waiter Jesus was terrific... Margaritas were wonderful I have the Carnitas and they were some of the best I've ever had

68Mo8Kzie5IgDCvJhTUQwQ.text: I love this restaurant and the authentic look and atmosphere. Definitely a nice place to take a date and enjoy great food!

PinGRpM4BKrCwKSyEOA9zw.text: Cognac Steak was missing the flavor of this steak dish and we were highly disappointed. The Cocktail Camarones was really good and you can't go wrong with their excellent chips and dip. Overall it was hit and miss tonight.

B8SskYesD07ssSp8I3WlsA.text: Great food! Chips were good but slightly greasy. Bean dip amazing!! My husband practically ate the whole thing!! Very generous serving. I ordered the Zapata Burrito and it was ginormous!! Honestly you could share it with another person or two. I only ate a quarter of it and was stuffed. Definitely would go back if I was in the area!!

ljaeNf150eKCGzCkPxqpsQ.text: What is the one thing everyone looks forward to when going to a Mexican-style restaurant?  Chips & Salsa!  And, of course, drinks!  Bottomless chips and salsa is the first thing served to you after you are seated.  The staff is efficient and nice, and are always happy to give you more chips & salsa!  A lot of places have become cheap with their chips, bread, whatever it may be that is usually free.  But not Viva Zapata's.    The Chile Relenos are excellent.  Definitely my go to place for Mexican food.    I dare you to eat your entire plate of food too.  It's enough food for today and tomorrow.  The location is awkward, as it's right across a gas station; but definitely worth, at the very least, checking out.

32L0gnwCnwUbetlKNSWt9Q.text: My favorite local restaurant in Vegas! I love this place. Their homemade flour tortillas are fantastic, and so is the salsa and bean dips that come complimentary with every meal.   Go at lunchtime Mon-Fri if you're looking to save a few bucks - their lunch menu starts at $8 or so.

BHALMgLcoNg08rBEoGqq4A.text: We've been coming here for years and something was just off this last visit. We arrived at 5pm on a Tuesday expecting a large dinner crowd and the place was empty and we were wondering why. The food was good like normal but it literally took 30 minutes for it to arrive at the table from the time we actually ordered. The place was empty but the service was horrible. And then to top it off the waiter hit my 3 year old son on the head with a water glass that he was refilling. Not a bump but an actual thump that we all heard.

fJM20NRN1TC639E223au8w.text: Great food great service always busy.  Tortilla lady is the cherry on top for a great Mexican restaurant

2GkiTWL5YIkPbOIq7Zc_eQ.text: We're visiting from San Diego and read the reviews from previous customers and knew we had to try it. THIS PLACE DID NOT DISAPPOINT. The service was top notch and never let my drink get below half. The servers were very attentive and polite. The food was excellent very generous portions and very tasty. The chips, beans, and salsa was really good and so was the complimentary soup. Next time we're in Vegas again we will definitely stop in.

PfHF3Q2AS7FuGQ5DJFFTuw.text: Looking for food poisoning while in Vegas? Well then this is your one stop shop! I went with a party of four and we all woke up vomiting the next day. The food is far from authentic, unless you consider tainted chicken authentic.

BAhIUIMRFgpEaG2lspmBeA.text: The tamale was amazing, as was the large house margarita. The best part was the excellent and kind service!

BHnMdFio_FJJw9eZ_U-A1A.text: What a great place! Even though it is far out in the North East Vegas areas well worth the drive.  I had the pollo con rajas!  Served with rice and beans and fresh home made tortillas! You just can't go wrong or get more authentic. When you are in the mood for some home cooking and you don't feel like taking the pans out this is a great place!

Ct2JfHZjchj6AOS6at0Y3Q.text: There is fast food Mexican food.  There is authentic Mexican food.  Then there is really good authentic Mexican food, and that is what you will get at Viva Zapatas.  The food here is superb.  I adore this place.  They should open a restaurant in SoCal, too!  I stopped here again today on my way home.  Awesome as always.

gOYMSjOpFhhLpiotkybI4g.text: EXCELLENT service. Everyone is so attentive and polite. The food was DELICIOUS. Chili relleno was great, the green chile pork was sooo tender. I highly recommend this place! We stopped here based on the location and the Yelp reviews, so glad we did!

Ca9lEz7iytpuVEaOpNOOAQ.text: Real good authentic Mexican food is not limited to tacos. There is such a wide variety, and it differs from east to west and north to south! Viva Zapatas has definitely hit that note straight on! The food is based off of traditional cuisine from the state of Morelos in Mexico. So it does tend to be heartier, earthier foods since Morelos is landlocked, and not as much of the seafood stuff. But they do offer a variety of shrimp dishes, and a couple of fish ones.  The ambiance is very unique. Tons of old "ranchero" artifacts adorn the wall. Colorful picados hang in the halls. And of course lets not forget the man himself Emiliano Zapata (for whom the restaurant is named) in a vintage frame!  Now - to the food. Before you plan your visit for dinner - starve yourself for most of the day! (or be prepared for lots of leftovers)!! :D Haven't been there for lunch service but just might have to one of these days.  Once you are seated, you immediately are brought tortilla chips, refried beans, and salsa (red). Now, I will warn you - don't finish the tortillas off! (they bring you more, it's the neverending pit of chips!) So unless you want to fill up on chips and dip, back off them! (I prefer to add a splash of lime to mine, so they definitely accommodate). You are also brought an appetizer soup - I don't know what it is. But the best way I can think of it - chicken noodle meets tortilla soup!  Last time I had eaten here, I had the mole served up with beans and rice - and it was superb! Portion was HUGE so everyone in the group had doggie bags heading home.  This time round I wanted to do something a little different - so I went for the 'Pollo con napoles" (Chicken with Prickly Pear Cactus). VERY deeeeeelicious! Had just the right touch of heat, and seasoned beautifully with the cilantro and other veggies. ($14 entree) Now here is the part that had me craving the "tortillarias" that I used to see on the streets of mexico - fresh, homemade, tortillas! And when I say fresh - I mean they have a gal working her tail end off mixing the dough up portioning it out, and cooking it all up on a traditional griddle. So if you have a small enough party and want to entertain your little one, ask for the table close to the tortilla zone so the little one can watch the tortilla making process! And yes they offer you the choice, corn or flour for your tortilla.  I can't remember what the other members had in our party, one had the combo 2, another had the fajitas i think. But all I can remember is hearing everyone going - "wow, this is REALLY good food!" And yes we brought home all the leftovers! Had them for our lunch today, and both hubby and I still have more leftovers for lunch tomorrow! So yeah $14 entree spllt into 3 meals! :)   I know this is a longwinded review - but have to just really lay it all out on the line for you! Almost done - just got the service to go over, and you'll be done.  Service: impeccable! Everyone from the entrance to the bus boys are extremely professional and EXTREMELY polite! They do everything they can to ensure you are satisfied with your meal, and are very quick to refill your glass (or ask about it) if they it is going on empty.  Still want more?   Well, stop reading and go drive there and discover this place! :)

HDDMNy_tZS49Bat1j_KDvQ.text: The food was good, the service was EXCELLENT! They were super busy tonight. We spent about 30 minutes at the bar before we were seated. The service was consistently amazing. Bartenders, servers, bussers and management : ) AMAZING SERVICE

heFhmi92vbPY0wwi9jm5AQ.text: Great food & service. Have driven by there for years and finally decided we needed to give it a try, glad we did.  Guacamole as a starter. Had the Chile Verde "Mauser", superb! Pork cooked to perfection, verde sauce tantalized my taste buds, some of the tastiest I have had anywhere.  Grandson's loved their meals and the fried ice cream.

iOhfkkjRT5q3vpkQfnKYaA.text: Horrible service. I didn't even get to eat the food because I was waiting so long. They guaranteed that if we sat at the bar we would get a table within 10 - 15mins. That didn't happen in fact it looked like they forgot about us. I even inquired about our placement and they ensured they didn't forget. Plus they said oh we will get you guys menus and they never did. of course I attempted to ask but couldn't get anyone's attention so we left. Do yourself a favor and go to some other Mexican restaurant if you want to eat and be served properly.

O8yXWPRa1lsimsZNcF45pA.text: Authentic great tasting food combined with amazing service makes this place worth a visit! I had the combination platter which included a crispy chicken taco, Green chille pork burrito, and a beef enchilada (including rice and beans). Every bite was savored and have absolutely no complaints about this place. My co-worker drank about 6 horchatas being that as soon as she was done with one, the server would immediately grab another (Now that's service)!

T4daksidBkDIfJcJ2BqEYw.text: Viva Zapatas is a great place to go for a quick lunch during work. They have lots of space for big groups, and the service is fast (but not to the point of feeling rushed). I had the tamales and enchiladas. They actually were pretty good! You are never low on salsa, bean dip, chips or drinks at Viva Zapatas. They also have a great soup...I am not sure what it was called, but it was a like a spicy Mexican version of chicken noodle soup!

oZqZHITDBhFcw5sbICGU-w.text: Good customer service, good atmosphere with music in the background and great foods! This place has a festive vibe that will make your experience really enjoyable.

7XHtvoqq65TVeqza0ILi7g.text: I am gonna be as honest as i can reviewing this restaurant. It appears that I am the only one in the party of 15 we had that didn't really like this place. We came here on the recommendation of my father in law, who figured we'd all need menudo to cure our hangovers this past Saturday morning. Maybe it was because I wanted a good ol' fashioned American breakfast or maybe because I have certain restaurants back home, but this place just didn't do it for me. With that being said, this is what I found:  LOCATION & DECOR  It was beautiful both inside and out. Bar area took up most of the restaurant. Major selection of tequilas. Seating for big parties wasn't the best and we must have taken up about 1/4 of the restaurant. Location is good for those visiting or stationed at Nellis Air Force Base, but bad for people staying on or near the strip, as it is a good 15 minutes from the Dowtown Las Vegas, 20 from the strip.  SERVICE:  Seating- We were seated right away, rare for such a big party, but we were there around breakfast time, so beat the rush.  Wating- Our server took the drink order right away, brought them out right away and the beers were ice cold, as well as the mugs we asked for, and the margarita drinkers in the party said that they were poured generously. This is where my low stars come into play. IT TOOK TWO HOURS FROM ARRIVAL TO DEPARTURE! We must have waited a good 45 minutes before all the dishes began to come out. We were brought out salsa, which was OUTSTANDING, refried beans w/ cheese, also pretty good exept for the big glop of cheese in the middle, and those kept coming out, but by the time the food had arrived, I was full!  FOOD:  I didn't like my machaca. I had the pork after being given the option of pork or beef. I should have went with my gut and gotten the beef. It was okay, but not a dish that said, "WOW". Although, I have to give credit to the waiter because when I asked him what was better between the machaca and the chilaquiles, he said go with the machaca, and even though it didn't wow me, he was able to recommend something to me, which alot of waiters can't or won't do. Now If I would have only asked him if the pork or beef were better, I might have enjoyed my meal more.  Some in my party ordered campechanas (seafood cocktails) and they were pretty much licking the sides afterwards, so they all seemed to enjoy it. My wife had a grilled chicken breast in a garlic sauce, and it was pretty tasty. A good friend ordered the Pipian, and she said it was some of the best she's ever tasted that isn't her mama's.  Overall, I think this place would be good for drinks and watching a game, as they had the Charger game on that day. It might even be good for a smaller group then ours, say 2-4 people, maybe no more than 6. Two hours is a long time to be in a restaurant, especially when most of that time is spent waiting on food to come out, and maybe it could have been because our group is so large, but I've had faster service in other restaurants with a group just as big. I might give it another shot one day, but not anytime soon!

g0nas3EENca8gH1tbX6vdw.text: Longest wait ever.... Won't be doing lunch there again I sure hope the food is good!!!

KoGGzX6FzZJ6r3T0WzasGg.text: Loved this place! Found this place through yelp! Service was great, super clean and friendly. Not to mention, their food was Delicious! We ordered the steak cilantro, chile verde quesadilla and chicken burrito (enchilada style). Portion sizes are huge so try not to get full on the chips salsa and beans. :)

rBdMJxUE1TpwY9GdUCoOjg.text: It was my first visit here, and I was solo, so naturally I took a seat at the bar so as not to take up an entire table or booth.  The bartender/waitress was super nice and the salad I ordered was amazing (chicken, avocado, something delicious in a ranch cesar type dressing)!  I was only drinking an Arnold Palmer since I had to drive but I was not rushed from the bar and that was much appreciated.  There was also a great singer with his guitar (not too loud and complementary to the atmosphere).  There seemed to be many happy hour specials on drinks and I hope to partake on my next visit into town.

bMuplVPAknECxwTAidPFqQ.text: Since Dora Maria's closed down just down the road, those of us on Nellis craving good Mexican food had to find a new place to go.  Well, Viva Zapatas does not dissappoint at all.  I have tried about 10 different dishes and they all have been outstanding.    My personal favorite has got to be the chicken chimichanga (enchilada style).  Everything they prepare is fresh, and awesome.  I highly recommend this place.

-5eM5UPQ5t1D_RaqHD72Zw.text: Sat at the bar because they were very busy at 330 pm. A good sign. Place was full of Mexicans, another good sign. Nice Mexican draft beer selection. Good chips and dip. The food was very good and service was very good. Had live music as well. Atmosphere is also good.

hZdwPeScRJnEDd025mor8Q.text: Me and my wife come here all the time for some good mexican food! They are like the fine dining of mexican food. The avocado appetizer is the best I've ever had at any mexican restaurant. Part of the reason its so good is the experience; they actually make the appetizer in front of you! Another good feature of this place is the live music. Theres an amazing guitar player/singer who sings a lot of classical mexican tunes. The reason I gave this a 4 out of 5 is due to the small and inconvenient parking lot, especially since they're usually always busy. Second, the last time we went there we were COMPLETELY ignored. We had to find the manager twice in order get our food ordered and delivered. 30 minute wait is unacceptable, especially when no one checks on you. That is what cost them a perfect score. Other than that, a very good meal awaits for you here.

fAenzCe3BGIKlk-K3gey-g.text: I don't really like Mexican food, but if that is what the day's food choice is, I'd pick Zapata's over any other Mexican restaurant in town!  The service here is always top notch, and since I work close by and have been here more times than I can count, it is a lot to say that the service has never let us down.  The food is top quality for Mexican food, from the shredded beef tacos to the enchiladas.  Nothing is ever served too salty or greasy, just perfect.  The lunch dishes come with a free drink, which is a great deal too!    My favorite dish has to be 16 on the lunch menu.  I can't remember the name, but it is basically a couple of slices of juicy chicken breasts topped with a creamy sauce, with beans and rice on the side.  with this special, you get your choice of homemade corn or flour tortillas (I prefer the flour, but they are both good).  And if you look at the southwest corner of the restaurant, you can see your fresh tortillas being prepared right on the spot!    Zapatas is a favorite in our community, and in Las Vegas in general.  I know people that come from across town to eat here.  It really is a top notch, affordable restaurant!

Y0MCGzfLBHz6weB7RuPTKA.text: I was very impressed with the items they had here. for lunch there are numorous specials. I had the table side guacamole and nachos. the guacamole was worth it. I will for sure be back. the service was gracious and the place was packed.

JK5coHVGR8hY5QswsDULWA.text: This is a great place for lunch. The lunch specials are well priced and the salads are great. We came in with a party of 6 at 12:15pm and had to wait about 5 minutes for a table. The service was very quick and professional. My iced tea was constantly refilled when the server noticed that my glass was half full.

co4U_sTZoj_fROc0p96N2Q.text: Got so excited when my husband said we could come again after church today! We ordered chile rellenos, gauc dip, chicken taco, enchilada, beef taco, tostada with guac, and some other stuff, but the main point is EVERYTHING IS GOOD! This was my second trip and we loved it;)

Sko74N1mNIR8XjtJwAAvvA.text: We love this place! :) The food is awesome. I had the ceviche and practically licked the plate. It is the perfect summer time food. Will definitely be back!

YZOKOB-AtkwOtuzwwhfnXg.text: We went here for the first time based on yelps reviews and all I can say is it was excellent. Yes, The parking is poor, and not very many tables inside, but they seated us quickly and parking issues won't keep me from a good meal. All of the employees were very polite and helpful. The guy playing the guitar and singing was great. The food was excellent and service was quick. Nothing bad to say at all. On second thought, it was horrible. All you people stay away so it doesn't get too busy and I can go more often.

fm-fQWk3jVEzV1IMZryLRw.text: Love Zapatas!!! They have live music and amazing food. My husband is Hispanic and he said it almost matches his mom's cooking. The wait staff was very professional, and the people who come between the waiters are great you never have an empty drink. Love the complimentary bean dip/salsa and chips. My daughter is one and loves the music!

EVNaFHsxh1roU0zptA0l7w.text: Carnitas are not carnitas. The coca cola ones were ribs in a sweet sauce like bbq and the regular ones were ribs with salty sauce. Beans were great so were the homemade flour tortillas. They need to learn to make carnitas estilo michuacan

b3L8_7dveOTSzAKv1-m61A.text: This place is soooo cute! The only reason I give it four stars is because our food took a little while to come out. People sat down waaaay after us and got their food before us. Not mad at all, but a little communication as to what was going on would have been nice. Our server JESUS was really sweet and had a great sense of humor! I'll be going back to try a different dish, as they have a HUGE menu!

fQgOVnAK4dCvGXwS4ob6uA.text: Woo Hoo! I finally found a mexican resturant that is good in this town after 8 years of searching. Too bad it is on the opposite side of town. I loved the atmosphere and music. The chips, salsa and bean dip was sooo good I could not stop myself.The chili verde was so tender and full of flavor and the margaritas were fresh and not made with crappy sweet & sour. I will be back hopefully soon!

T5cWPauiUZhq4BFS_F5aJg.text: What a great ambiance!  Came here for dinner on Saturday night.  They had the mariachis playing sappy songs.  You have a lady sitting behind a glass window, making fresh tortillas, patting them down back and forth between her hands.  It was a very interesting atmosphere.  I had ordered the mole (pronounced molli).  It was an interesting concoction of spices.  And to end the meal, I had their deep-fried ice cream.  I know...talk about calorie-city.    But love, love, love this place.

rTV59rEK6dpzuKShKrR1KQ.text: My family ( husband, 3 kids under 12) came here from yelp recommendation.  First of all the service was absolutely amazing!   We got the guacamole and they make it table side! Food was very good. I got the shrimp enchiladas and they were very tasty.  I was already so full from the yummy soup and chips and dip that I had to take most of it to go!

pI5VztJQU8n5hrAsp4rbbg.text: I have been there 5 times and great time. They are pretty fast a lunch. Food has been very good each time. Absolutely nothing negative to say about the place.

oTDd_q6uec2pQYR4EnYSSg.text: Amazing food, drinks, live music, and service! You will not be disappointed! Great atmosphere for a date or to watch the game at the bar. I would make a trip to Vegas just to come here again.

44MAJxvqBEdg2Vp4DYmQIw.text: So if you have 50 dollars to kill on yourself take it to this place, they have some awesome mexican food! like real mexican food, hey im not a novice to mexican food, but this was just fantastic.. actually it tasted better than the food i had down in cabo...  So If you like mexican food and you want a good well portioned mean go here! its pretty awesome!  Oh and the tortillas are had made right in front of you!! just like in OLD TOWN SD.. perty Legit.

W6F-gYM_C-RZwbTLlp8kEg.text: Husband and I were looking for a fiesta of flavors- this place was decent, however for the price it was a bit of a let down. The opening snacks of chips and salsa and refried beans were amazing and very addictive. Salsa had good flavor and spice. Then came the complimentary soup that comes with every entree. This was pretty good as well- at most places it has an overly tomato taste, but it was more subdued here which I like. But nothing to run home and rave about- at the end of the day it's just a little broth with some noodles. Now to the main course: Tacos de pescado- The fish was breaded and fried served in a flour tortilla. Just because something is fried doesn't mean it has to completely lack flavor. There was absolutely zero seasoning. I had to drench the tacos in the sauce that came on the side in order to get any flavor, and then all I ended up tasting in the end was the sauce. Beef Fajitas- again the meat completely lacked flavor. We were looking for spice or something and just got overdone chewy pieces of steak. For a $17 entree we were very disappointed. And the meat to pepper ratio was horrible. There was barely enough meat to make two tacos and the plate was piled high with so much filler- onions and bell peppers.  Overall- these two dishes weren't home runs, but I can see that this place has the potential to produce delicious dishes however I probably will not be returning to find out.

45ceS-J0pp3hG6JnR-PBjw.text: came here a couple weeks ago with my fiance, we got sat down right away (we beat the dinner rush) started us with happy hour - margaritas and the best bean dip and salsa. of course we killed right through those chips. he ordered the shrimp tacos and I ordered my favorite dish, chicken enchiladas with mole soooooo good! good ambience and great service, definitely will remember this place the next Time we go out for Mexican food.

_iXdusQsAnLLCywZ6dVFew.text: Their chile relleno was very good, the chips and salsa were good but the pork taco was dry and lacking flavor as was the tamale. One out of three on the main course is not good but the chile relleno was good enough I would go back for that alone. The service was great in the bar area and the beer was cold. I ate at three Mexican restaurants while in Vegas and this was the best. The other two had dry pork as well on their tacos so maybe that is the way they like it in Vegas?!?

wwAF8HEwsIAtKwtOXnnY9g.text: Good food, good prices!  Very similar to Lindo Michoacan.  Enjoyed the ambiance and the service was great.

fLlzYkKDh7J9bjOBI0oh_Q.text: I was there a while ago so I don't remember too much.  All I remember is that the atmosphere was amazing, I remember that the staff were equally amazing, and I remember that the food suggested by the staff was phenomenal.  Great authentic Mexican food, great bartenders/servers, and an awesome time.  What more can you ask for?

ghCTyuObI8tiMSwqbyqNJQ.text: The service here was amazing. They have Mexican beers on draft that most places don't. I loved their chips and salsa, they brought a cup of fideo before my entree, which was delicious. I had the shrimp tacos which were very good. They sometimes have live music, so it's a nice atmosphere. If it wasn't on the other side of town I would definitely come here more.

K0HdkUjUTpWIIiu9DBUcgg.text: Normally not a huge fan of Mexican fare but I'd come back to this place perhaps every few months. Arrived during a busy lunch hour on a Friday and were seated instantly. We got the chips and three dips which were more delicious than my own meal. Ordered and got the horchata and it was made perfectly. Very authentic feel but kind of dimly lit even at lunch time. I got the taco bowl and my sister ordered a burrito. Waited a little over 35 minutes for our two entrees to come out which was kind of a long wait but we had chips so we were ok. The food was good, but I'd still prefer Chipotle. There was a birthday celebration and they sang happy birthday and brought all the servers out complete with instruments, it was fun to watch. I noticed there were many Mexicans there for their lunch, even a few construction workers and a good amount of older folks at the bar. Sadly our food took so long we had no time for dessert but overall the service was great, food was good and the wait time not the best. I recommend going at a time when it isn't busy.

36ivtKJN2PliuBQwwsqsCw.text: Fanfreakingtastic food. The atmosphere is amazing, service is outstanding, prices are very reasonable.

Nq6B5NNcfBQowAI9d6s7LQ.text: Great service and great food! This was our first visit and Jose R. was our server. He gave very attentive service along with the manager (didn't catch his name).

DmEGx2Tm826wvCDO48Zq3Q.text: OMG I LOVE THIS PLACE!! I end up eating here at least 3 or 4 times a month...if not for lunch then for dinner. This is authentic Mexican (made by real Mexicans - I'm just sayin). They have homemade tortillas which are delicious!! They always bring out fresh chips with salsa and bean dip and I suggest getting the guacamole as an appetizer. They make it tableside and you can choose how hot you want it (amount of jalapenos) as you can choose the amount of onions, tomatoes, and cilantro.  For lunch they have your typical "Order by Number" chart. I generally order the numero siete (that would be 7). It's a cheese enchilada and beef taco, although I usually sub the taco for a bean tostada. For dinner I usually get the shrimp ceviche which is BOMB!! The shrimp is cooked with the citrus juice and there are tomatoes, jalapenos, and onions, served with a fried corn tortilla (essentially a shrimp tostada I suppose).  It is quite tasty - especially if you top it with that guacamole.  They also serve traditional Mexican fare like menudo (beef stomach anyone?) and nopales (cactus).  HIGHLY RECOMMEND. I promise you will go again.

U6nlupF3ized1Q2UHJKH1w.text: I came here for breakfast on my birthday and it was great! I had the chilaquiles rojos with the 2 eggs! Delicious! The chips and salsa with bean dip were excellent! The staff was prompt and friendly! The menu gives you the history of Emiliano Zapata which was entertaining to read about. Will definitely go back to try some dinner entrees!

dMqRcXPw2Xc6mEFlUx4j_w.text: This place was a complete surprise and really really good.  Service was excellent, the food to include the free chips, salsa, and bean dip was excellent.  I love that they make their own tortillas.  This is the type of place you'd find in San Diego.  I can't stop thinking about it since we went a few days ago, so we are ordering carry-out tonight for dinner.  Excellent!

0RZX3I29xI8rplS_23E1pw.text: Yummy!  Accidently came upon Zapatas.  What a great Vegas Find!  Food was delicious, service was top notch, and the margarita was yummy!  Some dishes were a little pricy, but you get what you pay for!!  Definiately a repeat visit next time Im in Vegas!!

2OD3-y2dv4YF9-UxqFiqHw.text: Excellent meal, delightful decor, soft Spanish music. A taste of San Antonio,  far from home.

wJSRpDhNMFKO9HXVG_1Z6w.text: The table side guacamole is amazing! The vegetable fajita was very good and the fresh tortillas that they make on site are delicious!

xjqBi2nRNQPmRe3EEhCmvg.text: Went to this place on a friday afternoon, Food was Defenitly authentic and the customer service was unbelievable. Will sure be coming back soon...

tNux0Rv-WHKfcxQuLLCEow.text: Hands down, best service I have ever gotten! Wow, very attentive and great food. Love the chips and salsa.

gvBn1MC4_c6MP05S0hCZMQ.text: Tip the guitar man he is awesome, along with everything else about this establishment.  Huge tequila selection, cute and friendly barkeeps and super cool staff.  AWSOME draft beer selection and reasonably priced menu.  I say stop in and try to prove me wrong.

ngeQQqvrnrKIZOc6Vgnorw.text: Great Mexican food! And the handmade corn and flour tortillas! Always a good choice! I've been going to this place for over 10 years and I always have a good time and leave stuff! Great staff and customer service! A definitely go to spot..

7wIyCf4OC296LE55Iy1Aeg.text: Let me keep this simple.....delicious authentic Mexican food! The guacamole is so freaking good! Just go eat and enjoy! You're welcome.

M9D0PmbFznRim8EzCp_6WA.text: Visited this place for the first time the other day. They have a great happy hour, it was buy one get on free drinks so my guest and i ordered a margarita and the waiter brought out 4. It was hard NOT to drink them since they were already on the table. Pretty thoughtful, since it started getting real busy after 6pm. I ordered the Cognac steak with the mushroom sauce, it was sooo good! Next time i want to try the Coca Cola steak, it sparked my curiosity.

8CV00vr1ATOOVIIW0_RNag.text: Found this place about 6 months ago,  and this has become the only place we go for Mexican food.   In a  time of  franchise dominance, this place gives a genuine local flavor.  I've had various stuff  there, and not a bad meal yet.  Tacos, fajitas,  enchiladas,  and even the Steak Ala Mexicana.. you can't go wrong  with any.

N6HNB48eme63bEim7dhJzA.text: Great lunch and dinner!  I love the ambiance!  Very friendly staff.  Every time I have been here the food tastes great!  Free chips with beans and salsa while you wait.

p2p467BzNZG7-fGZfcw7tw.text: Such a cute, quaint atmosphere! Great food! My boyfriend & I tend to over order in case we don't like something. Everything was terrific! We are oh so stuffed & will definitely recommend to friends.

oLQJGMYhswUFwbipaxexCA.text: Good food, a bit of a wait but was satisfied with the food and staff ,will recommend to anyone that asks "where should I go eat today"

14eWdH1BN4IQim8UQLAypw.text: Good food and very nice Servers.  Fresh hand made Tortilla's.  only one downfall...HUGE bar taking up most of the room.  Small dining area.  Other than that....GREAT

Tkpm36ICc4oqMH3Rv3E4Wg.text: Service and atmosphere are a definite 5, but the food kinda sucked. I have to believe that we ate there on a bad night with a new cook who I hope was promptly thrown out of the building by a torch wielding mob. The salsa was spicy, but had no other flavor. The chips were standard. We wanted to have some queso dip with jalapenos, but they don't serve that, but whatever, not a big deal. We got some sort of combo dinner which started with soup. The soup tasted like a can of condensed tomato soup with some noodles thrown in. my entree was incredibly bland. I had some sort of burrito and enchilada, neither of which had any flavor at all. My boyfriend's food was bland as well. The only thing that was any good, was the refried beans... and even that wasn't all that great, because, well.. They're refried beans. :P Will not be returning unless they get a new cook. Service however, was perfect.

0J9gn4fJ0fKCV3zr019GQw.text: Worst mexican food ever. Bad service, crappy margaritas, poor quality of food. Had to ask to order, ask for the check. Never coming back.

NECkj0yt_xVKX8qpezQdJg.text: Sorry guys- I can't be one to give this place 4 or 5 stars. The restaurant decor is very cute and the service was great. The food was too heavy for me. I got a carne asada burrito and my boyfriend had the seafood cocktail campechana along with some tacos. He said the campechana was good. I thought my burrito had too much stuff in it and that was without the pico de gallo and beans. I am sticking to mi familia for quick and easy Mexican food.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada burrito

hFSuLyRLn929Fh4UbN4x5A.text: Pretty darn good! I had the carne asada burrito a la carte smothered in red sauce and I really enjoyed it. It wasn't the best I've ever had but definitely one of the better alternatives here in Las Vegas. Rarely do I make it this far north but I would definitely go again if in the neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada burrito. Yum!
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips, salsa &amp; bean dip

6vH6NxxzFy45X3aiBJEBtA.text: I think it's too expensive for the type of food served. I've been there a couple of time and food is ok. Service is good and I guess it takes the usual time time prepare food as any other Mexican restaurant. Not bad for the family.

fAKbsAiuvTMSLxKDgUaXdQ.text: Lucky for me the two women that I had a meeting with on the north side of town have eaten here..On the industrial side of Craig & I-15, chances of finding this on my own are slim.  I'm also very picky when it comes to Mexican food, not disappointed, this was a great find.   Then again, that was obvious when we had to wait a few minutes for a table. The place was packed and the aroma filling the air was mouth watering.   After being seated we were served chips with a bowl of salsa and a bowl of beans.  The salsa was very flavorful and this is the first time I have ever had bean dip that was seasoned (very tasty)   For lunch my client and I both ordered the Ensalad Marinara - large salad for less than $10, a great price for shrimp, avocado and pico de gallo. My business partner ordered the ceviche which she also said was very flavorful.   Food was good, service was great and everyone was very friendly.  Will definitely be back when on the north side of town!

wEIMODJvUTCqJDYvNe8nbg.text: Called in to go order of 4 quesadillas it took 45 minutes from time of order to walking out of the Resturant... Good food but their take out process needs some work.

EYi_NHxVfu1UsAnbnUDnpw.text: Finally getting around to reviewing this godsend of a restaurant.  I've had Mexican food in Tijuana, Texas, California, and Florida.  This place is simply amazing!  Starting off with the chips, salsa, and bean dip the food here is excellent.  Their salsa has a unique flavor...very distinct and tasty!  Everything is served fresh!  The staff works very well together and will gladly assist even if you are not their table.  Whoever is running this place is doing a great job.  We came here at least 5 times during our visit and always left satisfied.  Everything we tried was good.  We only visited for dinner so I can't comment on the lunch.  My personal favorite was the tacos al pastor.  I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos al pastor...will change your life.

9UhmwgL5hHz2B9GZVSRDGA.text: Diamond in the rough!!  I've tried many of their dishes and they are all authentic and leave me so full I can hardly move! I love that they have a fresh tortilla making station right there in the dining room as well as the live music, However as much as these things are fantastic in my view, my favorite part is their margaritas. They have many flavors and everyone of them are delish!

HhPh07XUML_E7sdksvySFg.text: Not much parking and I hear there's always a wait. Never had a wait for a Mexican spot before. That's a by product of a small place and solid foot. Had the chicken and cactus. Definitely would get it again. Salsa and beans weren't bad. The chips werent my fav. Live music and traditional atmosphere. May come again if I'm in the area.

VhEAmYj6WVydybbezsrDaw.text: I asked my local friends to pick a place that locals like.  This is where they chose to take us.    We are used to the Nashville Mexican Food, and this place certainly was so much better than I am used to.  The ambiance was fabulous, with authentic live Mexican music.  Service was prompt and friendly, with generous portions of Nachos.  As an exciting addition to what I'm used to, they include Beans as well as Salsa!  For my entree I had the Tierra Libertad, which was delicious.  They also give you Tortilla, but they are quite large, and I was not really sure HOW you were supposed to eat the meal with the Tortilla.  I would absolutely return!

84faI_br07xa--9T4_ekRg.text: Party of 8, sat right down, salsa dip and bean dip are addicting and the chips came out just made fresh. Service is excellent and the atmosphere is cozy. Loved it. 20 years in Vegas and still my favorite.

Gqk42PWHmvUS1c99SCJEQg.text: I've eaten authentic quality Mexican food in Mexico, and tonight's meal is a flash in the past to the level of freshness, spice, flavor, and authenticity of my favorite local dishes.

4AqPyg-9F-S8RVch2WyBMQ.text: This was probably the worst Mexican food restaurant i have ever been to in Las Vegas, the waiting time was over an hour but that wasn't the issue , the problem was after we ordered our food they took exactly one hour and 30minutes to bring our food "the worst by the way" really small portions of food for the price, to refill our drinks we had to tell them 2 the 3times for them to remember. They were only fast when it was time for the check and to charge the credit card (Usain Bolt fast). Overall it was the worst experience ever i do not recommend to any one.

nrebQWDjWvtLHLCK49mEvA.text: I saw the reviews and they were good.   So, I thought I would give it a try. Very slow service and when the food finally came out it was  lukewarm.   Nothing special here.

msVNMX_P2DuuFrNX4VPjXw.text: So super tasty!! We came here based on the reviews and very glad we did.  Everyone was happy with his/her dish, service was great.  Will return here next time we visit Vegas!

VIY5ebrhQC8jK8TXXgmtnw.text: Zapatas has great food. Awesome apps and drink menu too. But what really sets them apart for me is the service. Beyond friendly! Favorite Mexican restaurant in town.

oFOtXeRGyhds7tNGbjxQLg.text: One of the best dine in Mexican restaurants where the food is actually good. I've been here plenty of times and ordered different dishes. This time I had the steak cilantro which is bomb!!! The green salsa is really good! I ordered it medium rare and it was perfect! Super soft and flavorful. The tortillas are hand made on the spot! Also I'd recommend the "gordito de camaron" from the appetizers. Pretty much a burrito cut in 3 with shrimp and tons of melted cheese. Other dishes I've had are filete relleno and the bacon wrapped shrimp. All good! The service is on point. Only thing would be the parking. Limited very crammed space. Other than that, no complaints!!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium rare. Soft and delicious!
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak cilantro and gordito camaron appetizer.

jvyvU9YJcxHECaaiyf7COA.text: Not great lighting inside.  Great live music, awesome staff, & delicious food.  Save your appetite for fried ice cream.

IuCPIRnZYHg6EaC8tVLQ1w.text: I've been here a few times and their margaritas are the best. They have two for one margarita happy hours and most of the time, the food is fantastic.

hYcRrqbWfzRMFyZVaa_GBw.text: I came in for lunch and just barely beat the rush. It was just after 11 am and the parking lot filled up quickly. Inside the dining area there is an okay amount of room with options for a booth or table, but sometimes there is still a small wait to be seated since it gets so busy. There was a good amount of staff on hand to take care of the customers and during my visit our server checked on us often. We started with complimentary chips, salsa and bean dip. The salsa had a fresh taste, but I didn't care for it and it was think instead of thick which I personally prefer. Chips and bean dip were great. The beans really had a nice flavor.   The menu has a lot of options. On the back of the menu there were over 30 different combinations for lunch specials. The specials run from 10 am - 5 pm Monday thru Friday with prices ranging from $8.95 - $11.95 and meals include rice, beans and drink. Priced at $9.95 I chose a beef taco and cheese enchilada. The taco was filled with a nice portion of shredded beef and had tons of freshly grated cheese. I loved the taste of the taco shell and all of the cheese, but the beef lacked flavor for me. The cheese enchilada was really good and they didn't skimp with cheese inside or out. The beans like the dip didn't disappoint however there could have been more cheese on the beans. The rice was a bit dry, so I'll just get all beans next time. I was stuffed at the end of my meal and satisfied. Solid spot for lunch or dinner and great for the whole family.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Beef Taco, Cheese Enchilada, Rice and Beans&#34; @ Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant &amp; Cantina - 7/2/15
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Beans, Chips and Salsa&#34; @ Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant &amp; Cantina - 7/2/15

QbSh6yGMgfUuFcnRdR6TOg.text: My friend and I are both chefs and just got off work and my friend who WAS a loyal customer for 6 years recommend we go here for dinner. I was early and the service was great I got a drink and my chips very fast. Once my friends got there we ordered margaritas with an extra shot and they tasted like lime-ade not 1 drop of tequila so we sent it back. Once we received our margaritas again nothing changed it we couldn't taste any tequila. We ordered our dinner and it took forever to come out literally about 30 to 40 minutes we went through atleast 5 bowls of chips and dip. The buster Oscar was the ONLY reason we didn't get up and leave and he is the only reason this place is getting 1 star. Oscar was very engaging and entertaining he made us laugh and made our whole night! Once our food came I got the tacos de carne asada and it literally had no flavor or seasoning it tasted like I was chewing rubber I had to put guac and ton of salt I even dug in my margarita to get my lime to give it some taste. We were highly disappointed and to top it off my friend who is retired military and has been getting a military discount for the last 6 years they refused to give it to her because she wasn't currently active duty! We complained to the manager and he wasn't the most friendly or considerate of all managers wasn't much help at all he did reluctantly give us a military discount. The food was mediocre the service was decent the management was horrible I'd rather spend my money on taco bell... but Oscar is amazing that's the only good thing about this place... I will not be coming back and I doubt my friends will either

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

m1450T_SYpJgWGvTrrAxVw.text: First time at this establishment, I was very pleased with the service and the food. I came into town for work and met up with some old friends who brought me here for dinner on Sunday night. The place was very busy but we were seated promptly upon arrival. Chips and salsa were brought to the table immediately after we were seated and the waiter came very soon after to take our drink order. The drinks came out quickly and were very cold. I ordered the Carne la Tampiquena and the New York strip was absolutely delicious! Cooked to perfection and as good or better than most steak houses I've ever been to. We also had fresh guacamole made tableside for us and it was very fresh and delicious. Three dinners and four beers for only 82 bucks? almost unbelievable. We were thank graciously by our host upon our departure. Keep up the good work! I will come here again when I visit Vegas next time.

Ml9rA5r74N9X0AkXz0LvWA.text: Fantastic and authentic food.  Great atmosphere and margaritas.  The wait staff is super friendly and helpful.

MipWB2JkU75Bn5QJ0tWL0A.text: Nice place to go for "antojitos mexicanos". Real Mexican Food. When no time for grilling I usually stop here for carne asada patron. Delish. Not to mention their margaritas!  One of the best places to go for frozen margaritas.  Only down side is the wait time. This place is always crowded but the wait is well worth it.  Customer service not quite the best but good food.

zlJ_ITGd3-NSbcELvxVmSA.text: Muchas Gracias Viva Zapatas for the Military Discount! Emiliano would be proud!  This restaurant is located near Nellis AFB and I've passed by it a million times.  From the outside it looks like a small bar type restaurant but surprisingly it's a nice little decorated place that serves up some great meals!  Chips and salsa were very good and you also get a side of hot dipping beans.  The service was so wonderful.  Speedy and friendly and between the waiter and the bus boy they were always checking in on us and refilling our iced teas.  We ordered off the lunch menu and everything was under $10.  I had the enchiladas and they were tasty and full of flavor. The Tortas here are wonderful (Mexican sandwich-mmm delicious).  I'm so glad we finally stopped in and I can take it off my bookmarks list and put it on my "Regular's" list because I will be back!  Viva Zapata!  What a great name!  Military discount (for Active Duty member only) w/ valid ID.

pZ2JRDzHJJu8VtaYGARpKA.text: Dried out, no flavor. Got carne asada tacos for lunch on a Monday around noon. The free chips and salsa are great, but the carne asada tacos I ordered were just chunks on meat in a warm tortilla. There was no seasoning and the meat was tough. There was supposed to be Pico de gallo  on top which turnout out to be 2 small flakes of tomato. No good.

JW0tyxFSpjX1LgY1MiBytA.text: I've been coming here for 9 years and it's truly one of a kind. If anyone says it's horrible cause the wait for their food that's a good thing cause this place is packed and it's definitely worth the wait. Everything here is made with love. I drive 23 miles across town to come here and I will do it happily every time.

zyAbsjZO4qoHwSoN3LluVA.text: The carne asada dish. OMG!  We showed up at 4pm and lunch menu was still in effect and so was happy hour (2 x 1 margaritas).  They bring out salsa and refried beans with chips, which is a nice change.  Like I mentioned before, I ordered the carne asada plate off of the lunch menu and the steak was a slice of New York steak.  I ordered it medium and it was so tender, juicy and flavorful.  And with freshly made tortillas.  The margaritas were ok, nothing out of the ordinary but the steak is what made this place so memorable.

MOukCYlLC1-wPFfRKVe69g.text: This is good mexican food in Vegas!  I love the chips, salsa and bean dip.  The enchiladas and tacos were very flavorful and the staff is friendly and attentive.

SMGUoX1kftLy0ik2kodhZQ.text: Such great food here!!! We have been coming for years and they never disappoint. The margaritas are wonderful and I love their fish tacos! Salsa comes with beans on the side too! The live music is a plus!!

hpu5AntDju6rlPM1IgkJcw.text: Our favorite Mexican place !!! The steak al conac is just delicious staff is really friendly and polite all the time !! Before Jesus use to be our waiter all the time and the las a couple time we dint have a good experience but tonight we are so glad that we got Alejandro he is over attentive and his guacamole is just on point  this is real Mexican food !!! Im Mexican and i love  the touch of the Zapata's vibes

A1fCo71PC1FeK1jNSdlx9Q.text: I just love this place! The beans are to die for & the flavors NEVER disappoint me. no one is ever unpolite! Just freaking love it!

fXr7In3HBHjZS7vj7iuGHg.text: Had Jorge as our server again... he's the best. Great food and great service. Thanks guys.

_yPZXfx2OlKvO9A3076qlg.text: Terrific Mexican cuisine with hand made tortillas.  I had steak fajitas and they were perfect.  Tender beef seasoned perfectly.  Was recommended by a local and lived up to expectations.

Today we had a wonderful waiter his name was Gerardo so his name tag read. Our food was brought to us very quickly and it was delicious. They even made me a custom dish because I was craving something a little different, and Gerardo made it happen !! He was always very attentive of what we needed very very great service !!!!

vDbu3yHvxWNBGNlgnfNkWw.text: So delish best shrimp cocktail I've ever had staff exceptionally nice and helpful. Stopped here before never sad I did!!

rAVy1-DAUxG-XMQN7Hf9VA.text: The bean dip you get with your chips and salsa is absolutely amazing. The texture is smooth and very very good. They carnitas burrito was soooooo delicious but it's huge so plan on having leftovers or sharing.

5xix8MDrxRto4IRkqg52ow.text: Was recommended this restaurant by a friend that has been living in Vegas for the past seven years.  The atmosphere is authentic and classic Mexican.  They have three Mexican beers on tap (I think three there might be more).  The staff was attentive and quick.  We ordered the Nachos Zapatas, Burritos de Verduras and stuffed poblano pepper (I am not sure if this was on the menu).  Everything tasted wonderful.  We were staying the Vegas strip so this is a bit of a drive.

2aqMh1KrBBf5naY_YPuKxg.text: Never heard of this place until my boyfriend mentioned that he wanted tacos for his birthday lunch/dinner and I was pleasantly surprised. Have lived out here in North Las Vegas for several years and have driven up and down Craig and never knew it was there... Very good food and even better is their lunch specials are from 10 AM to 5 PM !!! They are reasonably priced and they include the beverage.. I had the number seven which is a cheese enchilada & a beef taco and my boyfriend had the three taco combo plate.. my only gripe would be that I don't like shredded beef I am more of a ground beef taco person but it tasted so good it didn't matter, but I will inquire about it on the next visit. Another nice touch is the complementary yummy chips/salsa and bean dip... I will definitely tell others about this place

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. #7 on the lunch menu beef taco and cheese enchilada but I substituted with beef.. $9.95

41mwaIRFCRli0-8J08bckQ.text: I was happy to move to an area south west that has Mexican food again. This place is not bad but is not the beat I've ever had. I'm used to enchiladas and chimichangas being an entree and big not a la carte. I wish there was green Chile.

Vv36c2OaFE-U2UQ9Ics6zA.text: Very good authentic Mexican food. Chips and salsa are very good. Ate the lunch special shredded beef hard taco and cheese enchilada. Very cheap lunch special

A0GRDF_tuYCuHFNJEvJNAA.text: The place was very pleasant and the food was good but the reason I'm rating this place 2 stars would be because they took too long on bringing my order to the table. Two families arrived 10 minutes after us and they got their food before us. I was very upset that I had to wait so long for my food to arrive, I at least waited 40 to 50 minutes..

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice place!

XqOJkFUwbelg7I_G7VW2Kw.text: Well overdue update ...my third party experience did this place no justice! AT ALL!! I recently have been ordering shrimp dishes off their lunch special menu and let me tell you they are all awesome! You receive a fideo soup and a drink on the side! Most dishes come with rice and beans, and I always ask for habanero salsa! The wait times are lengthy, but the food is always fresh and the customer service is great every time!   My only suggestion is order your food, wait 10 mins,   then leave home. That way you don't blow your gas in the parking lot or waste precious time cramped in the small waiting area!

MUIdNWlGv4D_IY3ESLFN2Q.text: We have been looking for an authentic Mexican restaurant since we moved toLas Vegas. Something was always missing at other establishments.  A friend introduced us to this spot and I so glad she did. The place is clean, the servers are dressed to represent the culture and they had a live musician who sang and played as we ate dinner. All entrees come with soup or salad. The tomato noodle(can't remember exact name) was very tasty. The tortilla chips and salsa are fresh. They make their own tortillas and you can actually watch them being made.  We had combination platters. The chille relleno was perfect-tender, just right. My husband had chicken enchiladas and enjoyed them to the last bite.  Our sides of beans and rice complimented the meal.  Oh I forgot to mentioned our Margaritas....all flavors...enjoy...

1ft8ifrvB9UzqJfh34W0BQ.text: Dined with here with a friend and we both ordered the enchiladas. I got the cheese enchiladas and loved it! The only reason I wouldn't rate it 5 stars was because I wasn't a huge fan of the rice. It had corn/peas/carrots and it tasted like food from a package of frozen vegetables.  This is a 3.5, not a 3. Slightly above average and would be open to coming back again with friends.

i_pkHCpO8mZl8aPWmskSCg.text: The atmosphere and service was pretty good! Our waiter was pretty attentive and came back to check in on us often. The enchiladas with the green sauce was super delicious but the cheese enchiladas with the red sauce was ok, the cheese just tasted Like regular cheese you get at the store. But the salsa you get at the beginning was super delicious, one of the best salsas I've had and the queso fundido was good as well. Overall not a bad place to grab some Mexican food!

DgYqIgLS08Ktu0N_MbxqOg.text: Love the Food here!  The staff is always friendly and Very Attentive. It's hard to get Authentic Mexican food now a days. Their place always Surprises when I try new items on the Menu. It only gets better and Better !

HFaJz9WFbRtGDcyjBXLFOA.text: The food here is so good! You'll pay a little more for it, but it is a nice place with a nice atmosphere and very friendly staff.  We really enjoyed the creamy bean dip they seved along with the chips and salsa. We ordered the large guacamole which was super fresh and prepared tableside by our waiter. The entrees come with a cup of fideo soup which I had never had before, but was so delicious and left me wanting more.  All of our entrees were cooked to perfection and we will definitely be back!

psme7IAPkqKZaMg00wf-lg.text: Been coming here since I was about 8 years of age and now I am 24 & still enjoying their authentic mexican food. Great service and great food as always. I recommend just eat the first batch of tortilla chips and decline the second batch that they offer because you will be too full to eat your meal. The fact the tortillas are hand made makes place better. Check them out if you're in the area.

ncSbMVCb_iqc2o7o9j9iwg.text: I have lived down the street from Viva Zapatas for nearly five years, and every time I have friends from out of town visit, I bring them here. Great food, great service, and not too expensive.   Standouts include: house margarita, steak ranchero, pollo mole, and the chiles rellenos.

v2AFPYnsGHTIhXaiIIl9OA.text: So Yelp is always a great tool to use when searching for nearby local eatery with good reviews but that's not always the case. So, my family wanted to celebrate cinco de mayo and to make it even a better celebration, my mother in law's birthday falls on the same day. We searched on Yelp for a good Mexican restaurant nearby and  Viva Zapatas came up with a 4 star on Yelp. We called in advance to check if they accepted reservations but due to being a holiday they didn't and let us know that it would be 30-40 min wait time for a large party. We drove to their location and waited patiently so they could put tables together for our party of 11 ppl. Long after we got sat at our table, menus were handed out and we got a good amount of time to see what we would order. Server took awhile to come around to see if we were ready to order. Server finally came so our party ordered food and drinks. I ordered a Michelada drink but server gave me a margarita on the rocks? I told server that he gave me the wrong drink, so he then went back to the bar to get me the right order. Worst part of our dining experience was the wait for our food, an hour for our food to come out and our server never checked on us to see how things were or to let us know what was going on with our food. Our food finally came BUT one order never came out. My aunty's Chicken Taquitos never got put in with the rest of our food order, so it took another 10 min for her food while everyone else started to eat. Poor service and server nor the busser came back to refill our glasses of water. 2 Steak Cilantro I ordered, one med-rare the other medium. Medium came out well done and med-rare came out med-well. Manager was nice to take it off the bill, but our experience was ruined and we also brought a cake to celebrate my mother in law's birthday which we ended up taking home. There were a lot of miscues from the server. Maybe it was just too busy, but who knows, maybe we'll come back and give it another try.

Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Cilantro, sauce on the side, supposed to be cooked Medium came out well done.

nEJ96ETT7K9VXdpth-PxFQ.text: One of the MORE authentic mexican food places on this side of town.  I love the birria there.  It never disappoints.

DCNajr5G7HJm5q_WCyD2LA.text: Loved it. We had pork burrito with green sauce and cheese enchiladas.  The food takes a while to come out,  but tastes like made to order.  Worth it!

5oV5m5h030CKTb8biA4GHA.text: We wanted to send off a co-worker friend on her last day with a little lunchtime mexican fiesta...Viva Zapatas baby. This is not a huge place so getting ten people at a table is a real challenge on a friday at  noon. Luckily we waited no longer that 10 minutes(approx 63% of one margarita) and were seated and served good chips and salsa immediately, The service is always friendly here but sometimes is I a bit slow- not today. usually get the roast pork torta and it was great as usual plus is served with very good steak fries. Mexican food w/ fries? Yeah, Im home.  The margaritas were refreshing and delicious and the food seem to be enjoyed by all. Start to finish w/ 6 seperates checks(!) we were out in about 50 mins...plenty of time to drive back to work and nap the rest of the day away.

jCozqxX5amGo3l_MYw-_Qg.text: Excellent food and service. Large portions great value. We tried 2 of the combo meals and the carne asada taco meal.  Very flavorful and fresh.  The reviews are accurate and I would totally recommend and come here again

BbODpPn707j2rcpyblty4w.text: Went in for lunch and ordered a carne asada torta.  For some reason they actually serve it with fries...I'm still trying to figure that one out.  As for the torta, it wasn't bad but the meat tasted more stewed than grilled.  One thing that's not good at all is the parking...forewarned is forearmed.    Overall, serviceable Mexican food but nothing special.

0szkBJup6BMfA7PYyvMrnw.text: Love the food here! And oh the bean dip and guacamole are heaven :) I get the steak salad - yummy! The shrimp in some sort of lemon garlic stuff is really good too! Only downfall is price, I always come out spending Wayyy more than intended (thus the reason for 4 stars wish I could do like 4 1/2)

4x3JRD8nJyHJf7ISKOH5pQ.text: Love the food, the quality and the experience, not to mention the staff are so attentive!

pVcaU_F1hgpCtuES6JLAfw.text: I've had my share of good Mexican food but this place hands down great food great atmosphere great service I will be coming back

sY3pQMIBDoDVpZDHuxfugw.text: I've  been here a few times and the food is consistently good. Great lunch specials. Nice portions. Can't  go wrong eating  here.

jxASlNcWksgEg5P4ncXNhg.text: Was here last night & as always it was awesome. For my last meal on the states for awhile it certainly was the perfect choice. My wife loves it here & we dine here so often they know her order. Lol while the parking leaves a bit to be desired & lord knows it on the edge of the world it well worth venturing out of your comfort zone for easily the best Mexican Food Vegas has to offer.

uu6Yu2O31k7yvQIjQ_qQGg.text: Just from walking in the place looked legit! GREAT service from to front door to the bar. Some of the best salsa I've had in a very very long time. Excellent food. Who says you need to go to Mexico to have some really good Mexican dishes. Their selection of tequila was massive .Great place a must try if ever in Vegas.

PnhV-M6DyJzZ3H7eSrXCfw.text: Finally -- made it to VZ tonight.  Had the guac -- yep, they had tomatoes, so rolled the dice...feelin' fine!  The margs were great, took PA's advice about the sarandeado sauce, too -- but had it on the shrimp...if you've not had it before, it's such a treat, particularly with their homemade flour tortillas - yowza.    We also took the advice of Chris R --ordered two shrimp tacos -- but they were not in a league I'd consider worth reordering.    And we had an a la carte relleno -- which was damn good (I'm a serious green chili fan).   The menu is huge.  The bar is, too.  The dining room isn't that big, but we got there at 6:30 tonight (Friday) and sat right down.    Let's chat a second about where it is -- going north, you'll exit Craig Road -- and that's badly marked...(seriously, just remember, to take the exit after Cheyenne.)  Then you'll turn right at the end of the ramp, but you'll need to turn left at the first light -- then take an immediate right into the parking lot with the Pilot on your left...  trust me, finding the street number is impossible.  The menu is very similiar to the other Michoacans -- which means you'll get bean dip and salsa with your chips when you sit - and the other thing I've found pretty consistent about the Michoacans is that service is really terrific.  They're eager to please, happy to replace anything if it's not to your liking -- and the prices are reasonable.    All in all, for a 110 degree day in Vegas, a trip to Craig Road for a frozen marg and some tasty dishes, that I honestly hadn't ventured to try at the others, made us happy.  There are certainly plenty of interesting dishes on the menu that caught my eye -- so I'd go back - and since we've got a Michoacan pretty much down the street (Viva), that's saying something.     Gracias, Poly.
