Y7IbL0JILigZ8mmsnuKNaw.text: My family and I have been here several times and EVERY time it has been great! The food is delicious and authentic, the service is courteous and fast (a big plus when you have little ones), and the live music is nice. We love this place and always bring family that's visiting from out of town to Viva's.

mYNg1xGUZZTnWf9nICx3Zw.text: This is the best Mexican food in town. The margarites are off the hook. They have a friendly staff who makes great recommendations.

pEXYUPZcLWMxUqBtOmiYHw.text: I went with my family to enjoy good Mexican food. Well we dreamt of having good food. The food was terrible. I order Birria de Chivo and it was gross it tasted sour and the smell was rotten, the rice was hard and cold and it tasted 2 days old i did not eat at all. My hubby order the chile colorado and as soon as they asked how do u want your meat cooked i knew it was not going to be good. It sucked. Comida aqui no Sirve para nada. I do not recomend this place.

dIq9TyY8MkV-6fvfWTxn4w.text: As good as it gets indeed! I've been to this spot before but only for a few drinks at the bar. I knew I wanted to come back and try the food as the place always had a good friendly vibe. I am so glad I finally did! The food was amazing. I'm from San Diego and my girlfriend is from El Paso, so we are very accustomed to the cuisine from both nearby border cities of Tijuana and Juarez. If you are looking for flavorful authentic Mexican dishes then Viva Zapatas is your spot! The service was top notch. Our waiter always made sure that we were well taken care of. When we were finished and asked for a box to go, the bus boy came over and packaged it up for us which was a very polite gesture. We will be back!

XVEfvhR42wImIfPG-1raQQ.text: From now on my favorite Mexican restaurant in town. Not only for its authenticity but its friendly service and of course the rich and savory dishes. Give it a try and your palate will thank you. Just saying. :)

n1--6lmMIwZhVGRlP19h9Q.text: A-OK.  Even though I may occasionally forget my own definition of the terms, I believe there is a difference between food and cuisine.  Respectively, this is the difference from just getting some yummy eats and a dining, gastronomical experience.  Typically, I also have a problem with this, because I find cuisine only marginally more enjoyable, and sometimes, I disagree that it justifies the price-hike.  I'm a foody -- not a cuisine-y.  Yet, if we can turn a $6 burger into a $60 burger by changing the meat, I guess it would be hypocritical to say a difference in use of cheese, tomato, and corn can make cuisine.  Anyway, I came here thinking I was just going to get some Mexican food, but instead I found myself getting some Mexican cuisine.  I'm not saying I was disappointed, but I wasn't pleasantly surprised either.  Usually when dealing with cuisine, it means you have to also wait a little longer to get in and get out.  Here was no different.  I just wouldn't figure the place next to a gas station as classy, but the place really is quite so.  The staff is very professional; the bar is VERY well stocked with tequila; and the decor is above-par.  Though you do have to pay for all this in the end.  Unfortunately, I broke my own rule for trying a Mexican establishment new to me: I usually get carnitas so I have an equal point of comparison.  Instead I got the taco salad off their lunch menu because of a recommendation, and because I wasn't looking to spend as much as I could have here.  While I we waited, we got the obligatory chips and salsa.  As a special note, they also provide frijoles without having to ask for it.  I decided to go one further, and asked to have some salsa verde as well.  The salsa verde here comes out piping hot, but either way, all three were pretty good dips.  The taco salad comes in either beef or chicken, and I opted for the latter.  A risky decision as most of my experiences with shredded white meat chicken have been unappetizingly dry, but the waiter assured me.  He was no liar.  Possibly the best execution of Mexican shredded chicken I've tasted to date.  The size of the whole thing wasn't too bad, but for the price, I probably should try something else next time.  So for not quite being my thing, I still enjoyed myself enough.

sDcrVSb10MOHL8Si1z17fQ.text: I'll tell you what, this place looks like nothing from the outside, but when you get inside, you will discover the best service I have had in three years of living in vegas, that includes restaurants that cost 3x as much.   The food is outstanding, Their chicken mole is out of this world good.  Don't miss out on their mojitos, better than any restaurant in key west!

9oR2vSaiHDNd-OBrSC8Ksw.text: This place is really good... They brought our kids out some "fideo" soup as an appetizer. I love the tortilla lady in the back of the restaurant making fresh tortillas by hand... Yummmm...

gkc2EyEo5CpunUywBxEBHw.text: I just order an enchilada to go and when I get home it doesn't taste good too dry and no flavor I'm only 4mins away thinking of finding a good 1 around the house but this place is not for me thank you and I won't be back

8Y-qS0AZ26Y2kfVcOHXinw.text: My girlfriend and I decided to try this place out and it was delicious. Right from the beginning from the chips n salsa to our main course, everything was great!  We will go back for sure!

OujUqQQEfigaBDbWmtD-xQ.text: The best ribeye in Las Vegas and they have the best tableside guacamole and Sylvia our server was the best. Everything perfect!!!!!!!!

XCdcTspJJgn_WBhBvkaRGg.text: Can't figure out all the four and five star ratings, I'm originally from Texas I know Mexican restaurants. And only being here now for about one year we've been looking for a good Mexican restaurants. This is definitely not one of them. Ordered carry out told him over the phone we wanted beef fajitas. Confirmed over the phone that they had them, when we got there they had chicken fajita made for us. What Mexican restaurant doesn't offer beef fajitas. Took them anyway ridiculous price for chicken fajitas. And everything was horrible ended up throwing 80% of the food away. Only thing I can figure is the ratings other people gave them must've been friends relatives or people that eat for free. You don't have to take my word for it go try it.

jd525CCyeTCkkIrcL1RS9g.text: Great restaurant with often live music. Quite out of the way, but a must experience if in North Las Vegas. Nice bar and traditional well prepared and generous dishes. I often try the Carnitas at a new place and these were top notch. Cannot go wrong eating here!

PWSPd_bb9x811ESpCbZcjw.text: service was mediocre, the food was horrible. seriously do not understand how this place is open aside from the fact that there isn't much choice in this area.

JPTcg6DK9isHuO9li2SBsQ.text: This place is always consistant with good tasty food. Now all my family goes there. Service, atmosphere, food, WOW! SO good, will return.

8jN7PquKlbmNt8T7_S1Mtg.text: We went here last night with friends on recommendations we had seen. It was pretty good and the menu is very extensive but it is on the "pricey" side. The place is nice and clean and tastefully decorated but is also a bit on the dark side. It was hard reading  the menus.   OK back to the food. I mean come on people it's just Mexican food. Most of the specialty dishes ran from $16.99 to $18.99. The normal Mexican combination plates were prices in the $10.99 to $13.99 range.

x0w4a8Wg4PVtCwLIPj8Jwg.text: Called this evening to place an order for pick up  for my family.  When the lady answered she didn't even ask if she could help she proceeded to say, "we aren't taking any orders for 2 hours because our kitchen is so busy. Mind you it's 747pm and they close at 9pm. Unbelievable. Not going again.

-fDhMhNsNxI9533vqnBPuA.text: This is the best Mexican restaurant I've had in a long time. If I could I would come back here to dine again.  I had the "taco de lengua " although it was small it definitely made up in its taste. There was live music by one guy wich was amazing.  I think that the interior design was nice with all of the items on the wall.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

agAcLdh0FxXOHAaxJJv-QQ.text: If you are looking for Mexican food in North Las Vegas, this is the best! There are so many Mexican Restaurants in the area, sit down and fast food, it can be a little overwhelming. My husband and I have tried many of the different options, and used Yelp to guide us, and we have enjoyed our trips here every time! (We are very picky when it comes to our Mexican food.) It has authentic Mexican food, live music on the weekends, a very friendly staff, and a great atmosphere.   Parking can be a little tight when they are busy, so I would try and come a little earlier if you can.

Y2REDaxitc9GcnWs3Hpdkg.text: If you want some great homemade Mexican food like your mother & grandmother made for you when you were a child, this is the place! Great welcoming atmosphere, great drinks and of course that homemade cooking. Especially the handmade tortillas! Flautas are so good, menudo , fajitas delicious, tacos de lengua were to die for and the fried ice cream & flan are a great way to end your dining experience. Shout out to Jesus & Ramon for the great experiences we have had these past 8 years, you all do a fantastic job welcoming & taking care of your customers. We hope to get back there in September!

hwcPYLFNLHmwrgEu_ANM1g.text: This is my most favorite restaurant to go to! The service is always great the only complaint I have is about the hostest she fairly young and boy dose she have an adittude. But other than that the food is delicious.

6Qe_AAKghhjwPH2hMa0t7w.text: My family and I used to frequently visit this place a couple years back. We loved the authentic Mexican food and the nice service. But in the past year, this place has really gone downhill. Everytime we go it takes at least an hour for them to serve us and the food and salsa progressively get more salty and less flavorful. It's such a shame this place keeps getting worse.

-BIk9cpJQVKSsLZpmARUtQ.text: I waited an hour and a half to be served I saw three tables that came in 20 minutes after I did and left way before I even left very unprofessional but the food is still really good

A_s5ehPzPN4ImEkGP1PvYw.text: Large menu selection! There's a veggie section, huevos, chicken, shrimp, other parts of animals I'd rather not eat. Pretty hard not to find something you want.   FOOD Complimentary Chips and salsa (3.5 stars): Come with a bean dip and a salsa dip. I liked the bean dip more.   Soup that comes with meal (3 stars): Pretty good actually. Noodles inside were good. Broth is like a tomato chicken broth.    Guacamole (3.5 stars): Good guac but I've had better.    Shrimp fajitas (3 stars): Shrimp were way overcooked, pretty chewy. Rice and beans were good. They have hand made tortillas, which were okay. I used to live in SD where there are tons of Mexican restaurants that do hand made tortillas and they taste so much better.   Complimentary Birthday Churros (2 stars): Not very soft. Caramel sauce wasn't so great with it either. Nice of them to give something for birthdays though! But these churros are on the regular dessert menu also, wouldn't recommend them. They also sing to you and put a sombrero on you for your birthday.   SERVICE (5 stars):  Our server was awesome. On top of everything we asked for. Waters were always getting filled. And once we told him there were vegetarians in the group he made sure to tell them what they could and couldn't eat.   ATMOSPHERE (3.5 stars): Place isn't that big but it's a good size, make reservations if u can, it was packed when we go there but we had reservations.    PARKING: Parking is tight. The lot is weird so it takes a while to get in some of the spots.   Overall if you need to go to some kind of restaurant around this area it works. But nothing spectacular. If you have a big group they do a good job with service.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp fajitas

jDz3HHOp-dcMoPSTm_VWHQ.text: Came with my family to eat at this restaurant their service is not that great,  their food is ok I paid $123 waited over an hour and a half for my food to come to our table, they try to make it up with singing a happy birthday song and bringing fried ice cream with some Churros that does not make it okay. I just left and not really happy with this place they did not even bother to give a discount, not satisfied with their service and not coming back.

Qtls-HUORIUubM3sN-mXmg.text: we have been coming to this fantastic place for more than 15 years..  they make the best  tamarindo and mescal margarita!! yum yum yum. hats off to lorenzo(manager) food is phenomenal.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. best tamarindo/mezcal margarita!!

F8e2M7s5h3C1tKQtrDQpCw.text: Real Mexican authentic food. (Trust me I know I'm Mexican and cook it all the time) first of all the customer service is wonderful. I can see why they are always busy. (I drive all the way from summerlin just to eat here) I love the atmosphere and feel like I'm at my tias house in Mexico or something. The chips, salsa and beans are always fresh and they are free. Their on tap beers and Margaritas are always top shelf and super fresh. You get free soupa too. The food is hot and very reasonable pricing. Love it here. Like I said I drive all the way from summerlin just to eat here. Oh yea, there is always live music as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh beer and free soupa

kbpcO7xCh1qaDvQSMAPVrw.text: My favorite Mexican Restaurant hands down. I been going to this restaurant for over 25 years. Ramon rock, he always remember me and my family.

-oLRoEjsekjNgBty_5dpUQ.text: This place is simply amazing. Authentic, friendly, and extremely tasty! The only drawback is trying to find a place to park. We try to get there before the lunch rush or after the lunch rush. The Carnitas is sureal.  The chips, the salsa, and the tableside made guacamole are stunning. If you're looking for that Mexican taste that comes directly from south of the border this is your   place. Staff is extraordinarily friendly and your glass is never empty  I highly suggest getting the guacamole and trying the Carnitas.

WziMqESfqkGL20huP9PDcg.text: The food here is very good and I think very authentic as well I eat here often . The only thing is that food most of the time take a long time to be delivered to the table. They are always busy so I assume is because of that.  Two eggs took more than half an hour the other day! Manager apologized and offered to comp our breakfast but we had to leave unfortunately. Just plan your meal with time so you're not disappointed.

t8yveZj_WMZ0sUOHrbgJBg.text: We have always liked Viva Zapatas  and have been coming here off and on for probably over 10 years.  The food is always decent slightly Americanized Mexican food and we have always found the service to be top notch and always on the ball at refilling drinks and chips & salsa. We like the fact that they also serve a bean dip with the chips and each meal you order comes with fiedo (noodle) soup which most of the time has a great flavor. - We like to add a squeeze of lime to the soup. Food portions are decent and flavorful.  We look forward to continued visits. The 3 Amigos

2q57P7Dc5iF8FuAWSLH3BQ.text: I have been coming here for 15 years and I have never had a bad meal here. Steak cilantro is always cooked perfect. Table side  guac is a must. I usually get 2 beef tacos but I went with the fajitas tonight, super delish. #shutthefrontdoor I will always come back:)

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak fajitas
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guac
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak cilantro

nt2tNP8lwnH47wx55GCXhw.text: Yelping for a lunch place while on a work trip brought me here and it was very yummy.   The parking lot is kind of small but I came around 1:45 for lunch and found a spot in front. I was quickly seated and brought water, chips, salsa and a bean dip with a little cheese in it I think. Their chips tasted very fresh with a great crunch and the bean dip was a really nice surprise. The salsa had a touch of heat but not overly spicy and was a nice thick consistency.   Before my meal came out I also got a cup of fidello soup. I've never had it before and it was okay but I didn't finish it.   I ordered the combo with a chile relleno and a green chili pork burrito. It came out very quickly and looked really good. It also tasted as good as it looked. The chili relleno had a thin batter and a tasty sauce. It was also stuffed with oozy gooey cheese. The pork burrito was excellent too. The verde sauce had a little kick and the meat was very well flavored and still tender and juicy.   I was in and out in about 45 minutes and the service was quick and nice. The decor is also very good, done in a much more authentic and traditional style without the tackiness of some chain places.   I rarely crave Mexican food but I'd come back here and if you ever find yourself in the desert business centers of North Las Vegas, it's worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile relleno combo with pork burrito
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary chips, salsa and bean dip
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ex0_VxB7s4Z9oJHjoy9PkA.text: Wife and daughter was craving for some Mexican food after an afternoon of "kicks" shopping.  Since this joint is by the house, it's usually our go to along with Leticia's on NW side.  The food is good, but not enough to bring me to food "O"... despite the wife being Spanish.     I had the Chili Verde with pork, the wife had the Chili Colorado burrito with a shredded beef taco, and our daughter chicken enchiladas.  The freshly made flour tortillas was awesome though!  To me, it was a 3 to 3.5 experience, but like most things in life, I like to round things up.    Recommend you try for yourself and see if the juice is worth the squeeze.  Caio!

Y-_X9QthZ1ptER8j91VPsw.text: Typical greasy Mexican food. Fine whatever but turn on the air conditioning. Its 112 outside and 88 inside. No thanks ill go be bloated and disappointed elsewhere

YkHSpkWXBvBaYJ9fJdSppg.text: No good my first time there. The food is not worth the money too expensive. I was in the bathroom and lights went out . Had too come out of the stall to turn on the lights.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

KS8l6zbzQwNbzlNQQfPxNQ.text: Me gusta mucho su sopa de fideo!!  Love their soup! I am giving 2 stars because their bussers/waiters, need to show some sympathy!

RuFnfDZcIPTIXTMbBWuFJw.text: Lunch specials are really good. I would recommend them. The dinner version of the food are literally so much money and too much food. I know that's not a bad thing but you're better off going with the lunch version. The food is really good and the vibe is always really chill. Great for date night.

oUF2_Isy9jiQLBonsPwUSw.text: If I could rate this restaurant 10+ stars, I would. Viva Zapatas is an amazing choice if you're looking for an authentic Mexican Food experience.  The overall atmosphere is very cozy, homey, warm, welcoming, and fun. There's a full bar and they have live music as well. The waiters were going out of their way to make sure we were getting exactly what we wanted, they were very genuine and nice. In addition to everything we ordered; they gave us complimentary Chips, Salsa, Bean Dip and Soups.  Everything was beyond delicious especially the nachos. We had a very lovely experience here  and would come back any day.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

N-niknNbiDeG2CdTZvalXQ.text: One star is for the service, which is good. The food is terrible, but the peach margarita was excellent. I had a carne asada taco with a side of rice and it was tasteless and I didn't finish either of those. The food is expensive for poorly made food. Left very unsatisfied.

Rd02faOLAY0CBQ-pOfcplA.text: Incredible authentic flavors. They have huge variety of options. They even have vegan options!  My favorite is their mole. Doesn't matter what meat you pair it with, ....the mole is always rich and hearty. The kids menu has great options and many add ons. Their freshly made guacamole is on top of the order list. It pairs great with the house chips, beans and salsa. If you're okay with some extra calories, order a side of their freshly handmade flour tortillas... you won't regret it! And of course, don't forget the margaritas, they serve them frozen or on the rocks! Definitely, a must try spot for great mexican food options.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar has a good television set up.

binnSdM3Ofe4O5XbN7Ixgw.text: Wow! Came here on a recommendation. It's a little small, but that doesn't matter. There was a live performer! Which was nice. And video poker if you're interested.  Anyway we sat at the bar and was quickly greeted. The bartender was awesome, and answered a few questions we had about the menu. We both got margaritas, nothing too crazy.   So to start off, they drop off warm chips, salsa and beans. And man. The salsa is amazing, you can taste that the peppers were roasted. You can see the small flakes of charring in the dip. Had a small kick to it, but not bad. Small kick! And the bean dip was also to die for.   I had the Carne Asada Villa. It came with rice, beans, half a grilled jalapeno, and grilled scallion. The steak was a little tough, but still had great flavor. I wrapped it in my fresh warm tortilla. Ate half and saved the other half for later!  My friend had the floutas (sp?) with beef. I didn't have a taste because he wasn't sharing. I assume that's because he didn't want to give me any! Haha. He raved about the floutas and also saved the rest for later. Maybe we weren't hungry? Or maybe .. these were pretty large portions!   Anyway, come here for authentic food, some live tunes and drinks. (Or video poker). Casual spot to be with friends!

BavBuYV7k6oef3LhdxxvXw.text: Even though the food came later then normal. Our server Jorge did an amazing job by making sure we had are drinks on time, chips-salsa-beans. Thank you Jorge for showing great customer service !!! Great guy.

79i3PaY_3hAcYIFaYKEKEw.text: Great food. Had the soup - chicken noodle. first time i had that and i really enjoyed the flavor and not greasy. my family also enjoyed it. i ordered 1 chicken taco and it sure filled me up. not a big eater so it was good. Free tortilla chips and salsa! That was also good, not to salty. Friendly staff!!! p

hkzDZixv0oWQVNrXRM-8UA.text: We've eaten several times at Zapatas over the last couple of years and the food has always been consistently great.  The decor leans toward the traditional Mexican restaurant with art, artifacts, and posters reflecting Mexican culture. The effect is warm, welcoming, and it just feels right. The service from our waitress, Jessica, was friendly, fast, and attentive.  In the past we've had the shrimp fajitas and they've always been fresh, hot, and tasty.  I've had the biria de chivo (goat braised in beer) several times and enjoyed it immensely, but it's not for the timid, it has a strong taste, but once you add all the condiments it's perfection.  Today we had the toreados con queso, shrimp quesadilla, and the tecala, (chile relleno and green chili pork and bean burrito).  The meal started off with chips, beans, and salsa.  The beans were addictive and the salsa was smoky and very spicy (kind of strange tasting but I couldn't stop eating it). The toreados were just awesome-cheesy, spicy, and rich. The spice level is not for the heat averse. The shrimp quesadilla was huge, cheesy, and delicious.  The chile relleno was rich and satisfying, and the pork was tender and flavorful.  My only quibbles were that I asked for all beans on the dish and it came with all rice, but that was quickly corrected, and the burrito was supposed to have beans and didn't which I didn't notice till much later. These minor issues in no way interfered with the enjoyment of the food.

-cy-UybKuf-FhRcO84pY_w.text: My ten year old celebrated her birthday here. The staff was awesome singing to her. The food was great. Someone was playing live music on an electronic keyboard.  We arrived between 8:00 and 8:30 pm.  The keyboardist stopped around 9:00pm. The lightning was dim at best. There were brighter lights in the restroom. Should have taken my menu in there. Have a seat and read the menu. The parking lot is small. But if you can get past the limited parking and dim lights, the food alone is worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

p4WUjmgFLr77DSiwCeQDWA.text: Had a To-Go order. Azada burrito topped with sauce and an horchata. Simple order. It didn't disappoint. All of the ingredients were fresh and the meat was well seasoned. This is the first time I've ever ordered from this place and I'll tell you what, I'm definitely going back soon. The horchata was very rich in flavor and delicious. Overall 5 stars well earned.

V4pb4J9SzJuti6_-fSDoKQ.text: The food was very average. Not that it was bed but Nothing special. I liked the staff and decor. Friendly and cozy, Respectively.  What drives the score down was the unbearable temperature inside. The ac is not turned off and with the full crowd, the inside was too hot. Couldn't wait to leave. Unlikely will go back.

7gU8035QJ98wwhYlt5Sqpg.text: Food is decent.  Yummy guac made at the table. The meal itself was ok. However I cannot in good conscience give high stars to a restaurant who limits a military discount to "just the active duty member". If you are going to offer a discount it should be extended to their family members at the table also. Not just the military members meal. Seriously?! Who does that? We used to get the discount off the whole ticket. Not sure when that changed. Been going to this restaurant ages. Going to rethink that now. There are plenty of other options in Mexican cuisine. Those who do offer the "whole" table... children and the spouses of military a discount without them being present. It may seem I'm being petty over a few dollars. It's just the way I was treated when I enquired. When I took my children without my husband. Shame on this restaurant being so close to a military installation and being this stingy. Especially when every time I go their is plenty of military handing over their money. Keeping this business open.

VfOQQEdxGC25VS5KBNQamw.text: Ok so the quality of food seems to decrease with every time we go there. I don't know but the last 2 times I went to Viva Zapatas, I left the restaurant a little disappointed. Today we tried the Nachos and they were not that good for close to $10. I have had better ones at Robertos.   Also, last time we were there and asked for military discount, the guy told us they give discount only if we are in uniform. After we asked him to go ask the manager he came back with a split check and wanted to give only my husband the 10%!!! WHAT? Then I said, well I have an ID too and then he had to go and fix the bill again.

BfQeaXlQ72xN3M48segCaA.text: Went to this location with my family last night. Place was clean and comfortable. Food was EXCELLENT and the service and staff were impeccable! Great place we will definitely be back. I would recommend this restaurant to everyone!!

XTkgQdqs6wU9UfZkg2k8lw.text: WOW!!! This place is a amazing. My husband and I have been here several times and it has never disappointed!! As soon as you sit down they bring you yummy chips, salsa and a spicy brean dip! Make sure you order the fresh avocado dip...they literally cut the avocados and make the dip right at your table!! This place is SO clean and the service is so on point it will blow your mind. Make sure you tip The guitar man!!!!

JXwWLXjn44EQVwRmXXV5WQ.text: Absolutely the BEST Mexican food I've ever eaten! Margaritas were awesome too. Happy Hour 2 for 1

zpG2giuU6Mfb3yKda_EVpA.text: We have been coming here for over 8 years. We totally love this place. The decor is part bar part Mexican. My kids love the bean dip (given at the beginning with chips and a very spicy salsa) and the fideo that comes with most meals it very tasty.  We haven't had anything that we didn't like. My kids also love it in the evenings (especially weekends) when there is a guy there who plays the guitar or electric piano. We always have a few extra one dollar bills for the kids to go give the performer. Fun for all!!!

R5c8cygF6be4J_tHXBARbw.text: Mexican food is a love it or hate it outcome.  You have no choice but to LOVE absolutely everything about this place. Staff and service are excellence, very nice, polite, fast, just amazing! Everything we have ordered here has been so delicious! The guacamole is made in front of you and the chips and salsa also come with a bean dip that is great and I don't even like beans! The live music is fun and entertaining and not overwhelming. They have fresh homemade lemonade that is so refreshing. So clean and well taken care of. This place would get 6 stars if it was an option!

Mph84sjM6s09_R70Qa5s2Q.text: This place is amazing! We happened to find it when we were staying just a few blocks away for Electric Daisy Carnival & immediately fell in love!  The food is delicious, large portions, authentic Mexican food, & friendly/attentive staff!  The chili rellenos are incredible, the cilantro steak was the best cilantro dish I've ever had & the drinks are cheap. The prices here are very reasonable (we had drinks, an appetizer, and two entrees for $50). We were in Vegas for 4 days & visited Viva Zapatas twice, we will be back next summer & intend to visit this place again.  Also, the decor is very tasteful and interesting to look at & avoids the cheesiness that many restaurants get into. The thing we liked the most about this place is that it's a bit out of the way but they really focus on a comfortable, friendly atmosphere, which you don't really find on the strip.

zbKc70k0XTLSHYrdDuO5JQ.text: Tried this place the other day and had the green Chili and pork burrito combo (Uno on the lunch specials).  The portion was a good size and it is served with rice and beans.  They also serve chips with bean dip and salsa while you wait for your order.  This is going to be my go to Mexican restaurant in town.

YOhMsnesdknFS7qFcHtErw.text: Visiting from out of town and saw the reviews on yelp. We came by for breakfast and are glad we did. The service was excellent. The food was delicious. Highly recommend this Mexican food paradise.

N7CF4-gQCRMYxO7DVx6aXQ.text: I've heard about this place from my friends an my god this place is amazing from customer service to quality and quantity! This was my first time here with my brother... Most definitely I will be back with my kids they'd love this place.... AMAZING STAFF by the way smiling an happy to work THANK YOU VIVA ZAPATA'S you made my day much better

jpma3gJaNjp6DEpwQ-Ka9Q.text: The soup starter and service was great. However, the margaritas were very disappointing and could stand to have a little more tequila.

lqRgGWATuvp2NnuYNTGPhg.text: After a little over an hour stuffing snacks into plastic bags under Three Square's Backpacks program, my coworkers and I headed down the street to Viva Zapatas. Even though we showed up about 45 minutes early for our reservation, they already had our table ready and were happy to seat us!  The awesome staff never let our drinks get less than half full, which meant a lot of running around for them that did not go unappreciated. They brought out all ten of our orders at once, hot but not so hot that we couldn't dig in immediately. The salsa is fabulous here--it's hotter than most restaurants I've been to, and peppery to boot! LOTS of choices on the menu, plus a whole bunch of lunch specials.  The only downside I can think of is their squishy, uneven parking lot, but my boss managed to navigate it in his pick-up, so I guess it's not an issue.  Service is great, food is great, bathrooms are clean (check out the sinks!) Absolutely will be back next time I volunteer at Three Square. :)

eExblgsk7mVFPlJMqH7FAw.text: This was some of the best Mexican food in Vegas!!! The salsa's were awesome, all 3 of them!!! I went there on a Saturday, busy but was seated fast!!! luckily~ The lowrider car club "LAS VEGAS" cc decided to end there cruise there as well so the whole parking lot filled up with old bombs!!!! and cool cars. The margarita was a fish bowl~ and the plate I had shredded beef tacos Was excellent... over all service was excellent,food and decor was a 4 star night****!!!!

5DID8ZaX3aL8mWG_mFjm9A.text: Been coming here for years. Definitely one of the best Mexican food restaurants in North LV. The fajitas and fresh guacamole are especially good. Customer service is usually great but can drop off during busy times. Highly recommended!

zDZXlUm8-EI9th-n2sNWQw.text: Wonderful food, atmosphere, service!!!  I only came because of yelp reviews.  Thank you!

I4yUEca5Xd03_gO1bXcXkA.text: The Best Mexican Restaurant in Vegas. I am visiting North Las Vegas which is bit of a dump and has no good restaurants, then, I found VZ's a Gem of a place tonight. Great food, excellent service and some live but soft music. Couldn't believe the portions you get and the attention from the Waiters. Full meal at under $20.00.  I don't expect to be around this area much but I would go out my way to come here from downtown when I am. Hard to find due to construction: across from Jack in the Box and next to Pilot. 10/10 for me

Kabkr4juJ3lrf2eWymI7Tg.text: So good! Service was amazing, food was excellent. Hand made tortillas.... Yum. 5 stars all the way.

1euP5y463M64Qugt2mI-zA.text: I have yet to find a superior Mexican joint in Las Vegas.  Service is also great.  Atmosphere is also very nice.  It is not in a great part of town, so watch yourself.  Margarita selection is good.

E3D9rkBumwDhiQRKua18jw.text: Surprise, surprise....weird! Ok so we passed this place everyday on the way home for 11 months and each time I say, ugh I just CAN'T eat next to a gas station or it looks ghetto. LOL OOOOO How wrong I was. So I gave in and we decided to eat there. O.M.G. Yum! I got the green pork plate, taco, enchilada and burrito. YUM! The staff was friendly, food was perfect, I love their bean and salsa sauces with the chips! Only bad thing is the Cadillac Margarita was THE best drink I've had in a while. Should be because the drink alone was $18!!! #$%$%^ yea....no prices on the menu always mean $%^$%^& on the bill....but other than that I'd go back for sure!

pzj8bbsuw2r1_6UBCYHphw.text: Went here during a recent trip to Vegas, but forgot to write the review.  I want to make sure to give this business its due. This is not an area I typically visit while in town. My usual hotel wasn't able to accommodate my third night (a busy Friday) and I wound up choosing a place that had great reviews. That decision was a good one, and I followed it up by trying out Viva Zapatas due to its following on Yelp. First the bad - parking. Located adjacent to a busy service station, the parking is extremely limited. I actually waited several minutes while two people were talking outside their respective cars. I am glad I had the patience. The title should be reversed; it's a cantina & restaurant. The vibe, even on a weekday lunch, is lively, especially with the sporting events on the TVs. I actually sat at the bar -- there was a short wait for tables. But my server was quick, friendly and efficient. It took a while to get through the menu; I love tough choices.  I wound up choosing the Ayoxustla combo (chile relleno & beef taco) and enjoyed everything. It was tasty, filling and the service was excellent.  I'll come back again. It's worth the extra few minutes to enjoy a really good meal.

rLiouxX6MuoES92eScX98A.text: We heard a lot of goods things about this place and have been wanting to try it . Finally did and from the  beginning to the end the experience was awsome. Great quick service . They are on top of it and great food, I got the pork torta. I will definitely be coming back. A must try place.

8kV-sLoLnf1fu8pUto5HTQ.text: This was a recommendation from a person we met at another restaurant and man it was amazing. The food was so good and the staff was so kind. Felt like a family atmosphere. Will for sure be coming back.

tSnTXMVJton7J5foUKbpPw.text: In Love again! I asked around for a good romantic place to take a date. The name Viva Zapata's kept coming up by friends recommending it. The name didn't sound very romantic, it sounded more revolutionary, but maybe that's what I needed some kind of revolution in my life since nothing else was working out, So I decided to give it a try.   We agreed to meet there at eight, but I got there at seven, I didn't want to be late  and I wanted to get a feel of the place and make sure it met my expectations. As i walked in i knew i would like the place, nice decor dim lighting and live music. I proceeded to the bar and ordered a margarita and listened to the guitar man play someone Else's life with his fingers.  it was a really good margarita it actually had tequila in it. The bartender brought some complimentary chips and salsa and some bean dip. I didn't want to start eating since my date hadn't arrived yet, but one chip loaded with bean dip wouldn't hurt. After two bowls of chips and bean dip and three margaritas I decided to order an appetizer, Something light, so I ordered the seviche and let me tell you, it was the best seviche I have tried this far from the ocean, it couldn't be any fresher or tastier. It was soo good I decided to stick with the mariscos (seafood) and ordered the camarones borrachos, (like me)  Shrimp sauteed with garlic, spices and tequila, the perfect combination. You just can't go wrong with that, It was out of this world goodness!  All in all I had a wonderful time.  When you get caught between great food, a nice romantic ambiance and a guitar, you can't help  It but to fall in love. ....My date? Didn't make it.....But I fell in love nonetheless..... with the food at Viva Zapata's.                                                   PS.  Don't text and drive. You don't want to miss dinner!

7nvqdy0GB9u5aedKptrxQw.text: i was recently reminded of this spot and it definitely deserves a review because it was so good. it's hard to find good Mexican food spots and this place is legit. my favorite thing to order is the mole and i take some to go. i've gone a few times but not recently, but considering Mexican food option in Vegas, this place is worth a try.

CrT0GDRdlKIL64DE_YFv_g.text: Great food service and vibes! Love this place! I've been going here for years including my graduation dinner! I love the bean and salsa dips the soup is amazing! I recommend the carne asada tacos (: they have never failed me.

xT_w5-kFp3BiVkTPI9je5Q.text: I go at least once a week, the food is always good and the staff always friendly. Parking can sometimes be a pain but the staff and food make up for that.

srEtfvlnzVyoUmBJbfKlag.text: Appetizer came the same time as our entree (after an hour) ,  all the food was cold,  and the buss boy spilled my food on me. The place is also so family friendly everywhere I looked there was a crying child. Two stars cause the food would have been good if it was hot.

S8YubRGkGrTTzjWeJEfvdg.text: Great food and great service try the shrimp enchiladas. Live music place is clean and nice decorated. I loved it.

VUfwcYgip-74ybivHXP43w.text: Outstanding service, outstanding food,  interesting location.  This is a very good Mexican restaurant that caters to old and young alike.  Their dishes are all made from scratch and, though I've only tried the chimichanga, I would recommend and return.

GGLihk_VTg1ItlCsq5oEFQ.text: Just driving through, and needed a good place to eat, so I turned to yelp. Muchas gracias! We LOVED THIS PLACE! Good drinks, good food, good entertainment!

8X86FFaxHfsvqf5PQ5JMGA.text: Just started using Yelp and this place is excellent. I originally thought the reviews might be over-exaggerated but the food is very authentic and the service is great. The drinks are good too. We enjoyed the lunch specials.

ffTak84Ibpdg4rG_lO4new.text: There are a couple of things that make you realize you are at a LEGIT mexican place.  Menu has lots of things that you have no idea what it means There is a random guy that plays a guitar in the corner And the most important : there is a chubby nice mexican lady making tortillas ..fresh ones   This restaurant was amazing. Service was impecable. Drinks , salsa and chips NEVER went below half before getting refilled.Impressive!  I am not giving 5 stars because of its location. Why so far?? and why behind a truck stop??   What would i recommend? The coca cola steak, carne asada and the refried beans. Epic win plates!  We were a group of 12 and the food came outstanding, service was impressive, ambiance was legit and overall experience was great. Check it out !!

5KDjZNDHm1ku0b8hDgL76w.text: Personally this is one the best places to have great Mexican food, next to Las Islitas off Las Vegas blvd and Carey. Chips and salsa are great, and the food is always good!!! Only problem I have with this place is how small it is. Try coming here for a date night on a Saturday evening....you'll be waiting for a good while sometimes depending on how busy it is. If you've ever had Lindo michoacan then expect the same kind of taste in food...because both business are family related.

G0uvzowEi65uWeg5WdMS7Q.text: I've never reviewed this place despite eating here several times. Prior to today, I could only descibe Viva Zapatas as a 5/5. Today, I'd be hard pressed to to give it a one. The three stars is only for the glorious days of old.  Service was extremely slow whereas normally its lighting fast. It was pretty clear the waiter forgot to put in our order. The chips were burned and we received few drink refills. They were busy (as they always are), but I'm used to tthe service being attentive and speedy. Not today. We were considering leaving when...  FINALLY! Here comes the food! The beans were inedibley salty, and no ones food - even those we have enjoyed many times before - was any good. Cold, bland, oversalted...  The worst of all was the Tacos de camarones (shrimp tacos). I'd never tried them and I was excited to give them a shot.   Supposedly these are "moms recipe", but I really doubt she chopped shrimp into tiny peices and deep fried until it was no longer recognizable as shrimp (it could have been chicken, hell I dont know). What only can be described as fried matter was overflowing from my tortillas and my only hope was a large cup of sauce they brought with the meal. Nope... a room temp thick, heavily mayo based sauce flavored with chipotle seasoning. C'mon guys.   My wife had the carne asada con rajas y crema which is usually out of this world. Today it suffed the same bland, oversalted fate. A light but robust sauce was replaced with an overly rich and salty goo that covered what would otherwise be decent carne asada.   Our two other guests (also long time diners here) were similarly disappointed.  Every place has a bad day now and again, but I really hope its not a sign of things to come.

m-MlXz87ehs2aER4ejMyYA.text: Best queso fondito with chorizo i have had in Las Vegas. Good mojito's and margaritas. Friendly staff. Good atmosphere. Pretty good al pastor but not the best. Would come to this restaurant again.

IEpX3kWkMQLJhVvo0FRBtg.text: Excellent Ambience and Food. Must have is their Guacamole which is prepared right in front of your eyes. Horchata is another speciality. If you feel Salsa is less spicy, ask for Habanero Sauce. There are 3 Vegetarian dishes available too, though you can also customise their other items to be without meat.The freshly prepared warm Taco Shells and Burrito Wraps, just amazing. Must go place for Mexican Food lovers! The con is the waiting time in evening and slightly pricier menu.

yKWdvgedzin7i-ZDtf0SJQ.text: We are new to Las Vegas from Northern California, where we were spoiled with good quality Mexican food. Again we turned to Yelp for local guidance, and found Viva Zapatas with high marks.   The location is a good 12-15 min drive from our Aliante home . Not keen or impressed with the area of this location, we almost had second thoughts...  (We are sure glad we didn't pass up this restaurant.)    Parking is limited (2) stars, as we entered there was a nice feel and layout. The whole restaurant was nicely decorated for Christmas (classy, not tacky). There was a gentleman on a stool playing live music and singing which added a nice touch.    It was Saturday night at 6 pm, we did not have to wait for a table and were seated immediately, the host was friendly and attentive. We were sat in a booth right next to the VERY busy kitchen door (1) Star, I was not pleased, and could tell this was going to be a very loud, busy spot. The table was clean, neatly set as we were handed the menus. The menu is very well put together, many quality selections. I had a very difficult time reading the menu as the interior lighting was very low. It created a very pleasing ambiance, however tough to read the menu. ( This is where the kitchen door constantly opening allowing the bright florescent light to shine onto my menu was actually handy).   We searched for a drink menu, hoping for quality specialty margaritas but did not find such items listed on the menu. Our server arrived table side quickly to take our drink order, and was able to recommend a few margaritas that sounded good. I ordered the house Cadillac Margarita on the rocks w/ salt (large) and the wife ordered a Mango margarita blended.   We had time to review the menu and make our selections, however very tough to do so. The menu is packed with amazingly described selections. I settled in on the steak fajitas (rare) and anyone who loves their meat rare knows that finding a good Mexican restaurant that will honor that request, and deliver is few and very far between, its my little test on the quality of service. My wife ordered the chicken mole, and we ordered a Tamale for the table.   Our drinks arrived, my large margarita did not let me down in size. The taste on the other hand was average, nothing special. I found myself a bit disappointed having expected a place like this to have fresh hand squeezed lime juice sweetened with a simple syrup for there mixture. This obviously was a store bought margarita mix. My wife's was tasty, but again a store bough mango mix and margarita blend used. Drinks right down the middle (2.5).   The chips, salsa, and re-fried beans provided were wonderful. Chips were warm, the salsa was hand made with quality ingredients, and the beans were also well seasoned and hand made.    Our entrees arrived with an average wait, the timing was perfect. The plate presentation and appearance was wonderful, the food looked amazing. The portions were very big, and looked like each plate was prepared with care. A nice added bonus we did not expect or order was a home made soup offered with dinner, small 6 to 8 oz portion of soup. I would describe it as a cross between a home made tomato soup and chicken soup. The flavor was very good, someone who knows what they are doing back there took time making this broth. Very flavorful and light.     Chicken Mole: The Mole sauce was very good, not as heavy and bold as expected, but certainly not a bad Mole by any means. The star of the dish was the two pounded boneless chicken breasts. Again I expected a over cooked dry chicken saved by a rich Mole sauce to cover. Not here, this chicken was amazingly moist and juicy. Rich flavor, and i highly suspect they brine the breast. It was perfectly cooked (5+) stars.    Steak Fajitas: The plate looked amazing, smelled wonderful and was sizzling at the table. The meat looked plump and not over cooked. The flour tortillas were hand made in the restaurant, warm and amazing. I took a piece of meat to test, and it was PERFECTLY cooked rare with great flavor and well seasoned. I have never been a guacamole fan, my wife gives me so much grief. I have never eaten guac in a restaurant with any meal. The way this was going, I had to try theirs. WOW, very tasty, properly seasoned and balanced with cilantro, onion, lime, and tomato. I actually used it on my Fajita roll.    Tamale: A very tasty and well balanced Tamale. The flavor was very good. The masa to meat portion was perfect,     In closing, this by far is some of the best tasting Mexican food I have had, and we have had some great Mexican in Northern California. We have found our spot when the desire for Mexican comes knocking. Great food and restaurant. The service is top notch. Even though we had some things we did not enjoy, I have to give this restaurant (5) stars for service and food. Great job, and we will be back very soon.  Food - (5) Star Location - (3) Star Parking - (2) Star Service - (5) Star Ambiance - (4.5) st

QIVw6gP5HaBaIbolvMwTcg.text: Good food nice place but no place to park at all.just a waste of time waiting for a parking spot.space for 15 cars maybe

V7hDdXS29OVG3VLKjQFZOQ.text: Had dinner there the other night, and the place was packed. After 15 minutes we had a table. The chips and salsa as well as the bean dip were really good, and all made fresh.  We had the fajitas 1 chicken and one beef.  Both were good, and the fresh flour tortillas made right behind us were very good.  They give you complimentary soup which was just meh, but no charge = no complaints.  All in all would go back.

O4O69lsVdexVIc0jFIzjTg.text: Can't believe it!  We have eaten here at least twice a month for a few years. ..  Totally happy with our standard breakfast order... We both get huevos rancheros.  Last 2 trips they can't even get the eggs even close.  Over medium means whites cooked and yolks runny.  Egg whites means no yolk!  Both epic fail! When we returned the RAW eggs the chef returned the eggs over hard.  brown and completely over cooked! The term egg whites suddenly is incomprehensible! So we got scrambled eggs.    He sent an obvious screw you because we complained.  They will never see another dime of business from us!

wC_Z5rOA8OmQ7U8asfEChg.text: Took forever to take our order.   Even longer to get our food. They do not have queso dip. Probably because this place is very authentic.   Not a big deal to me but my boys said this place is off the list.

_-wNoKQzFyO2N6S1oE37SA.text: We tried this place for the first time after reading the reviews on yelp.  Everything was amazing.  The margaritas were tasty.  The soup was flavorful.  The homemade chips were served with bean dip and salsa.  The shrimp dishes were great including the shrimp enchiladas!

_goOny2v8AnqnR-LZsfRpg.text: I love this place. Awesome atmosphere, there was a guy playing guitar in the entrance. The steaks are always good, good quality and they are served with a bunch of sides that are just delicious. Big portions, you are def not gonna get out of there hungry. Fair prices.  Last time i went there i ordered the steak burracho, includes 2-3 sides and included in the price you get tortillas. All this for $18. Service is phenomenal the waiters are always nice and the cips with salsa and bean sauce are just amazing :)  If you end up in North Las Vegas do yourself a favor and stop there!

c50gBEtXO-Xi9gpLRkluPA.text: Once again, Viva Zap's delivers! Love the Grandma Mag's chicken!  Serrandiado sauce is positively incredible.

VrqrkztC1xUbOTdlEhgZJQ.text: I love this place!! I have been going here for years and years and just haven't gotten around to post a review.  The fideo soup, the homemade chips and salsa, the steak, the burritos, tacos... Anything I have ever had is DELISH.  Very nice bar area as well as dine in area for kids.  Sometimes there is a live mariachi man playing as well.  Great place to go for big family dinners, or on a date :-) Love it ask for the chips and salsa at the table and they are free!

Jddm75LpaczUrei6ASeUmw.text: Good food and good service. Hard to find a decent restaurant in North las Vegas. This is my go to spot for Mexican food up here. Prices are fair and definitely cheaper than the chain restaurants. They have an assortment of combo meals if you have a hard time deciding.  The guacamole is made fresh right in front of you and the salsa and beans are served with a smile.

qo3PNS9Pj7AQyBsZeApkog.text: The food here was really good and they have a singer playing soft spanish music which was nice after a long weekend of partying :) The only negative thing I have to say is the wait was ridiculous. We were a party of 12 and we waiting for our food to come out for about an hour and 20 minutes. Besides that it was really good

BHmOqu5ewJ3Ga6FyQ41kZA.text: There is always a waiting list in the evening but it's always worth it! The food, the service and the atmosphere are great. Tortillas are home made right there. Guacamole is super fresh.

b7Zck5sjWSm9Rnev1-Moxg.text: A good portion of my last trip to Vegas was spent looking for a taqueria. Where was all of the Mexican food?! This time around I remembered to use Yelp and found this place.  Why three stars? I found the food to be disappointing and lacking. While the rice and beans exceeded my expectations it was the main entrees that didn't cut it for us.   Parking can be tough if you are coming in the evening during the weekend. Drinks are great and guac is made right in front of you from fresh ingredients like the tradiational Mexican restaurants typically do.  Decor is adorable and service was fine.  My quest for awesome Mexican food in Vegas continues!

OQXmsoxxr31j2xNrJqdmTw.text: Really nice ambiance and decent food. Fun, live singer. Staff is really quick and observant. Delicious flan!

McIn7Ulgu0dxN4Uwuu9iqQ.text: Their 25 minute wait turned out to be an hour and 20 minute wait. We come here often and love the food and especially the margaritas but tonite is just ridiculous.   Sorry Zapatas I'm not sure if we'll be back.  And did I mention that the margarita was very weak?  I think the bartender forgot the tequila.  *sigh*

gzrKe9YjDMeDEXJT3mjmQA.text: Being a truck driver I have tried a lot of different across the country this is one of the best finds I have found being a close walk from the truck stop had the beef fajitas this trip through the beef and peppers were seasoned perfectly very generous on that part could use a little more of the beans and rice that is really the only thing it lacked on with the fresh chips and tortillas service was quick and friendly will definitely be back when I come to las vegas

IAnKziI1KIaEmmjnmGUdGg.text: Really good margaritas although light on the tequila, live music, and good food. The decor and atmosphere are also spot on. We sat at the bar and both bartenders were very nice. The tres de leche cheesecake was delicious.

h1C_W9vHPcgqmGaZulhnrQ.text: Best authentic Mexican food in Vegas! And the horchata is delicious! I have been to a lot of Mexican places that don't even compare. You have to try it to believe it!

x4GQGzqftvQ4RAObkOi_Ug.text: Husband and I came in on a Wednesday at 8 to place a to-go order. We had quite a bit of sticker shock with the prices. Most plates ranged from $17-21. We went ahead and ordered two a la carte burritos hoping it would be worth it/generously portioned/something to justify the prices. Hostess was friendly and the food came out not particularly speedy but not slow enough to complain, and they did get our order correct (no easy feat, I am a picky eater.) The food itself however was average at best. The chile colorado was a little bland and tough, and was the ONLY thing in the burrito. Definitely would not have been worth paying full-plate prices. In fact I think I've had better tasting burritos for much less elsewhere. Overall the place is OK, but we are going to keep looking for our Mexican "spot.:

YlTE0i4uh5YW_zUGHN9aWw.text: Hungry for a grilled chicken salad on a Friday night and stumbled onto this place through Yelp. Phoned in the order and had great customer service. I ordered the Supreme salad with grilled chicken and asked if they had Chipotle Ranch dressing to go with it. She said no, but we can make it. Very accommodating and the food was delicious!  The home made chipotle ranch was the bomb! Overall excellent food and service. I'll be going back before I leave Vegas!

8RabldTpPAcH4d4TZx3kUg.text: The best Mexican food in Las Vegas hands down. In addition to the best food, the staff is very friendly, professional and always have a smile when serving you. My wife and I eat there as often as we can and we always leave there full and very satisfied. Oh ya, love the live music, this restaurant is awesome. You guys keep up the good work and my wife and I and our family and friends will continue to eat there. Thank you, thank you, thank you.

bFSINN75GWYiHA_x9bZB4w.text: Soup was an unexpected surprise, tacos came arranged in holders, and price was very reasonable: The cost of sushi for one fed two of us.  Service was great.  I've only been here once so far, but I'll definitely be back.

JV0yBQU-Ca23vVm2-U6nag.text: Food was great! Guacomole made in front of you was amazing. Tortillas with carne asada very good. The red salsa was ok with chips. But, great customer service!

CvdgznH0iwus8p5J0sG8Yw.text: Since moving from Las Vegas I miss you the most! I left Las Vegas in 2011 and still miss this restaurant terribly! The food is the best! I have not found a restaurant that comes close here in Phoenix.

nbkeAf0Ova9bcVm4a7ggPQ.text: This place is prefect for every possible occasion. Coworkers and I meet here once a week to wind down and enjoy each other outside if work. Lunch time couple get busy. Would recommend ordering ahead of time. Parking lot could be bigger.

-IzR98xA8kfsQ31QvZxR2g.text: My husband took me here for Mother's Day. the wait staff & support was amazing. I had Sangria which was amazing , taco, tostada, & chicken enchlida which were all amazing.I have been looking for a great Mexican Restaurant & this far surpassed my expectations. this place is amazing. also, try the bean dips.....delicious!

RKatJB2VsEbYwrLFRejQqQ.text: Good relax environment. Good mole. Worth the trip. Been here twice on separate occasions. One with happy hour. Good service, good food, and authentic music.

ambJkwhmDN74k8Qp7xCeqA.text: Everytime we go to Viva, food has been excellent. But the wait staff and the manager really make it a great dining experience.  They are really on the ball. The live music is a plus. Tortillas are handmade and the guacamole is made at your table to your tastes. Soup is great and the salsa and bean dip are sssooo good. Everything we have ordered have been great. From the tacos, steaks, and fried fish. Parking is limited so go early.

m6LIXRgX6_WGHHWkFWZy5A.text: I love this place! me and the fam go at least once a month! Very friendly service plus great food!

77ObwylJ3sIV0iv4ysacZQ.text: Second time there.  The first was like 3 years ago.   Unfortunately this time left a bit more to be desired.   The hostess was very nice and welcoming,  our waiter not so much for some reason.. The other members of the wait staff were very attentive but our main waiter just sucked.... I wanted to order appetizers while we looked over the menu.  He disappeared so long that we just went ahead and ordered the main entree.  We didn't see him again until we were pretty much done.   I did mention to him I would've ordered apps if he were around. He simply walked away.   Steak fajitas were kind of chewy. My son had fried shrimp he said it was good.  Chips, salsa, beans, and noodle soup were all good.  My margarita was over priced and not that great....

_mq47oHy-n5N1oNpAopu9w.text: Food was good but took way too long to serve the food. lunch took 2 hours and 15mins. The food was good, but they did mess up one of the four meals and we weren't about to wait another half hour for it to be made correctly. Staff was friendly...just...so...slow... It even took about 10-15 mins to get the credit card back. Great food, but by the time food got served, we were all half way full from the four bags worth of chips we munched on during our wait.

F4Rb0ay7DxGFUfd-EP7cTQ.text: Love this place!! Not too pricey and so much food. Tacos are amazing and they make the guacamole in front of you.

I1n3G5Fsz7RBF4DYZ-RQJw.text: It sucked! Very nice inside that's pretty much it. Long  Wait, over crowded,by the way 100 capacity.burnt shrimp, yup sucks. I really don't like these types of places. I'm Mexican,so I know what a simple enchilada is supposed to taste like look Like even smell like.for example, they American up authentic dishes with American cheese instead of queso cotija or queso fresco, come on! Velveta cheese on enchilada?

P-MrskGLNqTP-uPxShkiWg.text: I really do enjoy this place. As a business traveler if you find yourself returning to the same spot rather than seeking out new locations, you know that there has to be something special about it.   Lets start with the salsas. Obviously homemade you get a red salsa with a bit of a kick and a refried bean salsa. I'm not the biggest refried bean gal, but I do really like this salsa. Last time I was here I finished that bowl...  I had 2 enchiladas with mole sauce and carne which the meat was perfectly seasoned and the cheese was stretching out of the enchiladas like a perfectly melted cheese should. Mole sauce had great flavor and punch and elevated the enchiladas to a new level.  Service was great, the lone guitarist was playing all night long and everyone was super friendly. Great atmosphere and highly recommended.

WE4ytTj1IMRMJslHGU0zIQ.text: The food is VERY good and priced just right. Staff is friendly and attentive. I love the atmosphere and even though its small you don't feel like other parties are sitting on top of you.

WXF0wLUS-ACfrsAnqunOLg.text: I frequent here all the time! I love the atmosphere, the music, the service, the cerveza, and most of all... the Food! Have you heard their "Happy Birthdays"? That's the best Happy Birthday celebration you'll ever hear in a restaurant.

ylHP2NDxvP6ul5Fxm0a9Yg.text: The food here was incredible! The portions were very filling and most everyone takes home leftovers. The flour tortillas are homemade and delicious! This was the best Mexican I've eaten and I would definitely recommend it.

fDbtskqtSYWwsLqAOH-ctQ.text: Worth the drive to this outstanding authentic Mexican food.  Gr8 margaritas, shrimp chile rellanos, cerviche, moles, pork, tongue and menudo.  Fabulous ambience and gracious service.  Entertainment usually and big booths for a relaxing big meal.

puOxv6JUX1-OQDf7DWW3FA.text: This place is amazing ! The food is delicious and the service is phenomenal ! The chile verde is soooo delicious

4llRIwh-y5yEcmbgqbDuzw.text: The service is always great not to mention the quality of food never changes ... Totally worth every penny

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salads to die for ;0)

1t_nQl3Sd9xxOeq0yO8Fww.text: by far the best Mexican food I've eaten in a long time and I'm from the bay. I just moved to vegas and since we already ate here last time, I had the chicken mole which was amazing. The chicken was so tender and the mole sauce was perfectly seasoned. Tonight I tried the Camarones with the mushroom wine sauce which was on point. The prawns are huge from Mexico. Their chips and salsa are also delicious. I also love how attentive they are and how there is a guy singing and playing mexican music. Makes you feel like your in mexico. If you ever come to vegas,  Def try this place! You won't be disappointed!

K-sYHeh8fxYYJZ1X3APoYA.text: Two words... Ensalada Marinera.  Two hollowed Avocado shells filled with Avocado, fresh salsa, Shrimp, Lettuce, Cheese, served a side of crackers lime and hot sauce.  I find this to be filling but not as overwhelming as a Coctel De Camarones.  (Shrimp Cocktail).    Also, they serve you chips and hot sauce AND refried beans... mmmm that's a first.  This is my first visit to this North Las Vegas Gem.  I was highly impressed with the food quality and service.    Please keep in mind that this review comes from a Mexican Native (from the state of Jalisco) so I you can rest assured I know a thing or two about Mexican cuisine. =P

c5VWru1vPPok9rVnf0frPQ.text: EXCELLENT food and AMAZING service. Our waitress was extremely friendly and thoughful throughout the whole meal. And the Margaritas are also extremely good. We managed to get there just in time for their 2 for 1 happy hour deal. Love this place and will come again.

YO_XuG0qPgFSm0nfSaLcTg.text: The ultimate Mexican food.  Saw the reviews and had to try it to beleive it.  The service was very good and waiters/waitress were very attentive and courteous.  Once the food arrived, it was very appealing, served and tasted the bomb.  Im convinced this is the best Mexican food here.

Hm5YfCgvnFX2wP-cX-6aNg.text: Mehhhhhhh....  I never start a review like that but that's how I felt...   Me being Mexican American I don't like eating at Mexican restaurants cause I can make that food my self. But there is those times where you are like screw it and being new to north Vegas it was a good excuse... well it was settled today..   I had a craving for Fideo soup.. I ordered a bowl to share with my girl, obviously not the only thing I wanted to eat.. but when I received it, it was warm and not hot kinda ruined it but I didn't want to complain...  For my main course I ordered a wet Asada burrito.. I'm sorry but that thing was BLAND.. nothing stood out in that hot mess everything kind of just blended and got lost together...salt works wonder when you know how to use it right..   The only thing I will not complain about is the hospitality in the establishment. Our hostess was nice and our server was on point with service.  Sorry guys but I won't be back.   The horchata was good though!

WL5080kTzUINdgmR1YtT9g.text: First time here and love the food and fresh margaritas, also the live music will definitely come back and recommend it to friends and family.

y4OPO7mqZYfxLEV9jX-pKw.text: This place is delicious, always packed so expect a wait if you're going in the evening for dinner.   I love their sopapillos, the chorizo ones, the carne asada sopapillos are not that great. Their chips and bean dip are addicting so prepare to be stared at when you continuously ask for refills lol ( it will happen) . The steak burrito and Steak Entree are also a hit. A huge plus are the home made tortillas made to order. You can even order a pack to go. I've been here several times and have ordered take out as well. On sick days I've been by to pick up their Caldo de Res. Big chunks of res and plenty of veggies.   Oh and of course you must always try a Margarita which they make pretty good ones.

Azv7FAFh_iYJjaBnEMWN7A.text: I love good, authentic Mexican food.  Unfortunately, I don't get to have it very often. Viva Zapatas was everything an authentic Mexican restaurant is supposed to be.  From the live music, to the very diverse menu, they really nailed it.  I had the Carne Tampiquena (sp?), and it was fantastic.  Although cooked a little under, the quality ingredients and seasonings more than compensated...plus it probably tasted better at that temperature.  My only criticism was that the margaritas were too sweet--but that's probably reflective more of what people come in wanting.  I'll definitely be back and would recommend this place to anyone looking for a great meal!  Oh...and come on a Saturday night for the music.

_b7szhCD9k5U6nsXhJMI4g.text: Best mexican food hands down! Every time food is super tasty, great portions, & cozy atmosphere. Waiters are always attentive & love that there is always a musician playing to keep the vibe alive.

hd_Rl2KHvL8yYrEbphijCQ.text: This is my go-to Mexican restaurant in North Las Vegas! On the weekends, you will find a live mariachi band performing around the dining room. Stop in on your birthday for a fun mariachi style tequila shot.  The food is typical Mexican offerings and even offers tongue tacos.   The service sometimes can be a little slow, but usually the wait staff is on top of it.   Parking is always a problem when they are busy. So you might be stuck parking down the street or waiting for a car to pull out.

aFnxrxSwwYpYsTbrgyDFgw.text: Great service and good food! Very clean establishment, courteous staff and the food was very good. The place was clean and the bathroom even cleaner with custom made wash basins. Definitely a good place to come for Mexican cuisine. My only critique, it felt like Mexico as it was hot all hell in the restaurant.   Bon Appetite!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. A whole lot of tequila!

ecYAWu7rP9fWb2MFx-wajw.text: I got the carne Asada plate I believe and it was way too bland for me. But if you add salt and pepper it was a lot better!

DYU3rVwJFIO086p300dFUw.text: Since moving from Texas to Vegas, we have been craving good Mexican restaurant.  Unfortunately, Viva Zapatas didn't meet our expectations.  First, they got our to go order wrong. We ordered beef fajitas and they gave us chicken fajitas.  In addition, the chicken was over cooked and dry.   They also charge you extra for chips and salsa.  Their salsa has an odd smoky vinegar taste.  Lastly, the guacamole that comes with the other meal tasted like it came out of a can. The best part when we called to let them know about the mistake, they told us they do not offer beef fajitas???  Will not be returning.  We always count on Yelp for recommendations but this was a big fail.  Trying to figure out how they got so many good reviews.

J5E3uRBghMSnXh1sN3iu7Q.text: i loved their food!!!!!!! Amazing worth the price!!! I got some chille rellenos!!! And it was the bomb!!!!!!!! The atmosphere is great!!! amazing customer service!!! I definitely recommend coming here! Its amazing!!!!

f8-XOdvk3H-83mgGygwpBg.text: I love this place before you get seated they give you warm beans dip...  chips and salsa ...and warm tomato soup.  I'm nearly feel before I even order anything off the menu. The table side fresh avocado made in front of you is amazing... love that stuff like homemade.

hfA0siBtmRGpP7jns8Bx7Q.text: Not recommended. After eating 3/4 of the bowl of chips and dip we found a cherry stem. When we brought it to their attention the manager came over and accused us of putting it in there. You know how I rebuttable.  I will not eat there again and not recommend it.

mPmW8g3UeylhSc3_5xyRZw.text: It's too dark in there. If I wanted to eat Mexican food in the dark I'd just ask my mom to make me dinner and I'll lock myself in the closet with the lights off.

eEszcOgZHpeqi1neET7u_Q.text: Have been here many times and it's always good.  We drive a (commercial) truck so we aren't there as much as we would like.  Great food!  Service is always excellent and friendly.  A favorite for me and my husband.

A_5fhHj4uomgO7N_FZTNaA.text: Food was fine aside from all the fat & bones and minimal meat I received (I ordered birria). I had to ask for another drink and my husband didn't even get asked if he needed another drink... will probably not be coming back!

fGYKUE9xpBw8lHjbX3QJJw.text: Favorite place ever!! Been coming here since 2002 !  Excellent service & amazing food everytime !  The know my family & our favorite dishes whenever we go. Really wonderful place. The owner has done a wonderful job.

qXZ5Ft8YNSbRlCM38z3a8A.text: I dined here with some colleagues while in town for work.  We chose it due to good Yelp reviews.  Our reviews were a little more mixed.  We arrived on a weeknight, and I inquired about happy hour at the hostess stand.  The hostess didn't know if it was happy hour, and had to go check.  She confirmed that it was happy hour, but then took off again, and the three of us stood awkwardly in the entrance waiting for a while for her to seat us.  It didn't seem so busy to warrant that wait, but we waited a while to order and to be served throughout the night.  Our food was good, except for the ceviche appetizer.  Something about it was not right - it lacked that nice bite of lime, and the fish was not prepared like I'm used to - the consensus at the table was that it was a miss - and most of it was still in the dish when we left.  The pastor tacos were good - they had pineapple which is often left off of pastor tacos, the table side guac was a nice treat, and my friend's chicken dish was enjoyed by everyone at the table.  We also had a great server - very friendly and helpful.  The uneven service definitely affected our experience, but I would still try it again because I think they have a good menu with a nice variety of authentic dishes.

RJXPGgNUrHR1TcHbDxa8SA.text: The worst $19 margarita I ever had. The food isn't any better than Roberto's. I'll never go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

QRGizLDKJjy51liFUlFjrg.text: This is by far the worst Mexican restaurant, avoid this place, we waited for almost 40 minutes for our food and it wasn't worth our time, food was disgusting same as the service, don't waste your time and money. The picture shows the way they serve our food......unbelievable.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

ktqOEfVqRPquhHkkCzRqKg.text: Excellent Mexican food. Incredible service, great ambiance (complete with great love guitar and singing). I will definitely go back.

C_pLI52DvFvZ2NfsMCGFlA.text: Slow service. I thought the food was kind of tasteless. I had to smother it in salsa to taste anything good.

kpVBsPtMYvZKpK761gqoyw.text: Simply the best authentic Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas, speaking as an LV native. Probably not for gringos looking for a Amer/Mex franchise but if you want great food and Margaritas, it's at the top. Try the chicken coreteado or a dozen other pollo specialty dishes. The Javiers margarita is very good as well. Definitely worth the drive!

dGo7Wf6ViDq_1FOI-GMheg.text: Went there for a dinner. Place was very reminicent of the kind of mexican restaurants my folks use to take me to growing up. Interior had very dim lighting, decor was appropriate, not over done. A nice break from the chain eateries. Ordered a combo and the tacos won! The best I have had since the Taco vans down in SoCal. Also, a must is the prepared to order guacamole. The waiter made it table-side, with input from us. It was delicious. Service was excellant, and noticed they had homemade sangria...For next time. A great place and kid friendly too. Also, the salsa and bean dip they put on the table with the warm chips was excellant too. Very nice a la carte menu, so easy to make it a $ instead of a $$.

da484A5tSXyM-msppFtT6g.text: The best Mexican Iv'e had to date. YES, even better than Super Mex. Fundido w/ green chile KILLER! Awesome service. Homemade tortillas. Table side guacamole. Real classy place!

JZdgl4s35H7AG0PuKin6Kg.text: This place has the best, margarita's like fish bowl size!! and have every tequila you can imagine. they start you with fresh chips from cooker and serve you up, a assortment of salsa 3 to be exact!!! Shrimp cocktail is with monster prawns !!! I had a enchilada & shredded taco dinner !!! It was very tasty!!! and filling! I recommend this place even if it's just for shot's of tequila & beer, at the bar !! nice decor & good service!

eY7VzibLQBUtg3EfXG3NTg.text: I ate here with my family and it was a great experience. We were immediately greeted and seated so it wasn't too busy on a Sunday afternoon. Their service was AMAZING. Our waitress was super nice and our chips, salsa, and water kept getting refilled when needed. It took a while for our main entrees but it was worth it. I ordered flautas with beans and rice. The flautas were crispy but soft at the same time. It had a nice balance to it. The rice and beans weren't too bad as well! I was soo full but it was from eating too much of those chips!! lol Overall my fam and I enjoyed the meal, service, and ambiance of this restaurant. I would definitely come back again and hello...there's live music too!! :)

S6q-rXCWpTXDxJ_PFLdGdQ.text: Went for Lunch - The Staff while professional did not seem happy to be there. I and several other non-Spanish speaking groups were left to our own  instinct with the wait staff unwilling to explain the menu without giving the non-welcoming attitude that we were just too much trouble. So I ordered the Cognac Chicken while my wife ordered the Beef Tacos. The "Chips" delivered to the table were either old or cooked/re-fried at too low a temperature since they were Oily. The Bean dip was average and the tomato based dipping sauce was a dark, hot, bitter,  variety that is unique to this place. The Cognac Chicken cooked with canned mushrooms and onions actually had a strange sweet taste and the accompanying Rice and Beans were nothing special. The place was very clean as I observed one cook diligently changing gloves when interrupted at her station (excellent). I can't say anything really Great NOR Bad about this place, however I would not go out of my way to eat here as there are so many better options for the price. $ 45.00 for two counting Tip - No Alcohol, Appetizer nor Dessert.

V-1NiP8-aHUis25VkZz3qw.text: I really enjoyed this place. I had the combo number 3. It came with a burrito, taco, enchilada, rice, beans, and a soup before the meal for $13.50. It was an awesome portion and I took about half of it home. Definitely a good deal. The ambiance of this was also nice. Lights were dim, candle on the table, earthy colors, lots of decorations, live solo guitar player playing music. Huge menu, lots of choices. Overall authentic Mexican restaurant that provided a good deal and pleasant dining experience.

TmnojXFYi6jbcKOTIEqyDw.text: Great food and service. Cadillac margarita obscenely priced at $17.50.

SRWu06d76J3bUiOB1tGaPQ.text: well i used to enjoy the food but every time my wife and i visit this restaurant it gets worse and worse and i dont want to risk how bad the next visit will be....well the main problem i had was a mexican restaurant put canned jalapenos on the nachos and had ballpark cheese......gross

1kVQDWBHVastIKlr-1nB_w.text: Went for dinner for the second time on the one on craig rd , parking is bad bad  and the food was not so hot . Asked for a chile Verdi  burrito and it looked like a enchilada rolled on my plate . Was bad food  I have had better Mexican food at other places . Won't be going back and also pricey they raised their prices on some dishes that are valued at 2 or 3 dollars less .
