UF8bqjpmj65tefMuYHSpXw.text: Great service and great food! Extremely family friendly, and most of the time, there's a live musician setting an authentic mood. I come here often with my daughter (16 mos), because they take very good care of you. They bring out a small plate of rice, veggies and meat for the little one(s) very early, sometimes before I've made up my mind about what I want to eat.  The tortillas are made fresh, you can watch the lady make them, and so is the guacamole, which they'll put together right in front of you. Oh, and if you think decorations stop at the bathroom door, think twice. These bathrooms are NICE! I know that's an odd thing to notice, but it did make an impression on me. :) They're also honest about their mistakes. My friend and I wanted to try a new dessert they were offering. We had already paid for it, when the manager found out they didn't have anymore, so he gave us TWO desserts of our choice, even though we had only paid for one.

3W-j_jYtUmlJMRAJddv0oQ.text: Stopped here on the way to visit my Dad in Utah, and was pleasantly surprised by how good this place was. The chips were fresh, and the salsa was on the spicy side. I got the lunch special chili colorado with fresh-made corn tortillas, and it was really tasty, as well as reasonably priced. Since this is way out in the boonies, I doubt the typical Vegas weekend warrior would ever find their way into this place (although who knows, it is Vegas after all), I'd recommend it if you happen to be passing through on I-15 and want something better than your typical Chevy's/Mexican chain.

CUiiClrtXxdKrwxY24rikA.text: This is one of those places that when you see it for the first time, second time or eighth time that you will not stop and eat.  It is located on Craig road near the I15 and right next to the Pilot truck stop on your way north. I made that mistake for to long and then finally convinced my self to try it. It has a small parking lot and even  walking to the door you are still not sure ... but when you enter - Oh Yes. The decor is rustic with historical items placed around the large dining room and bar. The booths are great and the staff is very friendly. A great atmosphere with live music on most every night. ( keyboards or guitar)  The traditional mexican food is super, the guacamole is out of sight and the sea food dishes are excellent. It is totally inexpensive and you will leave "Stuffed to the Max  - and happy that you are."  It is well out of the way for most people, but if you have that need to visit the Cannery Casino, it is right on the way and should not be missed.  Just don't let the location throw you off from the enjoyment of a supurb mexican dining experience.

wya1srVMON2luDmmq0gwcQ.text: Super disappointed w/civiche de camarones.  Seriously lacked flavor other than lime.  Nice server, loved the tableside guac & all the chips and salsa.  Entrees took forever.  Exc margarita!  I would eat there again, everyone else liked their food.

SVXPN6bwqCbvPWrvb9waqA.text: I have eaten here twice. I had 2 things, the carnitas which were not that great but OK, and a taco that had fried shrimp, cabbage, pico and a mayo/sour cream sauce on top that was amazing, delicious! the pico was so tasty. Their salsa was different it had kind of a black pepper taste to it.

Gj2yjV4YDA5iFuoTSK3DoA.text: Best mexican place to eat. Great staff and fantastic food. Lunch menu is perfect. One of the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

3ks_RbALDNWkd1MLyASuGQ.text: I love new experiences and was able to try some chipolte lengua (tongue). I was surprised at how mellow a texture the tongue was, but I definitely enjoyed it, though I would have liked to have tried a different sauce that it was cooked in. The waiter was very friendly, the hostess was cute, and the accompanying conversation from the table next to mine about some outlandish feat made for a good dining experience.

RePiAuf9v3-JXJWIv5Ls7A.text: This was a great place to stop for lunch on the way to Utah from L.A.  It's just outside of all the traffic and hubbub of the city and it's got a huge selection of traditional Mexican comfort foods.  They make their own tortillas, which is always a plus.  The restaurant and bathrooms are clean and there is plenty of parking (at least, there was when I came for lunch).  A little more expensive than I had expected, but the food was good and the service was quick.

vrrj0FQ0V7KKqw9ULJW1Zg.text: This place is beyond amazing!!! It's authentic Mexican food! The place is so clean and the waiters are very nice and helpful.  Next time were in Vegas, we're here!!!!

2D3wXpFwcHZDvwvNjA09kQ.text: This Mexican food did not disappoint!   From the start with chips,  bean dip and some awesome roasted tomato salsa. ..so good!   Could fill up on that alone!   Then the meal was great.   Had some tacos that hot the spot.   Would go back for this chips and dip in a heart beat!

BF4oPMjnuJl80eB6b2VSvw.text: The food was so bland and we were very disappointed in our food. We ordered the sandwich and it had barely any meet on it and no spice or flavor at all! This is a awful choice if you are vegetarian there are no options, I ordered vegetarian burrito and it was a flour tortilla with bland veggies and that's it! I was so bummed I had to spend my money! Oh! And the prices!!!! $12 for my veggie burrito! Never coming here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bland veggie burrito

yMPcya3TaKCwk3u2vm0jtQ.text: I have ate a many Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas. Viva Zaptas is by far one of the best choices I've made when searching for authentic Mexican dining. Since my first experience I have been a reoccurring customer. Prices are low although quality of food is high. Great atmosphere along with selection of music.

2JI2OtY8jdEVFOcbYbjf1Q.text: Very good food, friendly service and a great atmosphere. Be prepared to wait a bit and service can be a little slow when packed but not too bad. Food is probably the best, freshest Mexican I've had in Las Vegas so far.

m3YlyOgtuitZVp4xhtEwyg.text: Great Mexican food with great service. The lunch specials are a steal but it's crazy packed at lunch time so go early or you won't be able to park let alone get in.

0f_Jw491GbiT6w-wrf91MA.text: We were in Vegas for the week for my daughter's wedding and wanted to try someplace different...not a chain, not on the strip, but great none the less....we found it in Viva Zapatas!  We went on a Monday night, and made reservations since there were going to be about 10 of us. We only had to wait about 10 min. after we got there, no problems at all. It isn't very big, but it's decorated wonderfully and it doesn't feel crowded at all, just right. One thing I loved is that the entire time we were there there was a 1 man mariachi playing a guitar and singing live. I don't know if he is there all the time or not, but I loved it...just added to the ambiance.  We ordered an appetizer of Queso Fundido con Chorizo in addition to the complimentary chips, salsa, and frijoles. Oh my goodness! It was the best, cheesiest, sausage-y goodness ever!  Our table also ordered a pitcher of Cadillac Margs...the "pitcher" was more of a carafe, but the margs were delish!  With 10 of us there were a variety of entrees ordered and everyone loved theirs. Mine was a cheese enchilada and chili relleno, both were delicious.  Flan for dessert topped off the evening perfectly.   When I'm in Vegas again I will definitely go back!

45oLR6hYNSAtwpWjIwzfpQ.text: I had dinner here a couple days ago and it was delicious. The mole sauce was great and the chicken was tender and juicy. The service was excellent, everyone was friendly and wore a smile on their face. I really enjoyed and appreciated the fact that this restaurant gives free chips, salsa and beans for dipping! In addition to that, the server even brought my son a cup of fideo soup for free ( he mentioned kids receive a free cup). I thought this was very nice of the restaurant staff and owner(s). I will definitely come back here and recommend it to others.

5vsUq_iz3tFXQfUU0FCZWg.text: Bad experience with this restaurant!!  I order carnitas and it look like pork chops no taste at all!!!! And the food server did not show up at all to se if everything was alright!!! The only good experience we had was at the bar! The girl or the bartender was nice!!  We won't go back there!!!!!

A0Ro3-IpUU0DyfVGKcwrQA.text: Very good place for a bean and cheese burrito. We got it just passing though town. But it was all too notch. Lots a very local place, but The place is clean and the food is great.

0cdXc8NNCDAa34ush04Ehw.text: Love This Place.. Food Is Excellent n Service Is Great.. i Dont Have a Bad Thing To Say About This Place.. Waiter's Alex and Jose Were The Bomb.. I Highly Recommend This Place..

oIa-j-5Gc83zh8j3szAQwg.text: This place is fantastic for lunch!  The food is very good, but what makes them stand out is their service.  Our glasses never got less than half full and the chips and salsa were refilled several times.  Try the #12 chicken lunch special, it is very tasty.

bIgEgKU3-l0s_JvC7Wu5Ow.text: This is our favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. I have liked everything I gave had here.

XrIV_JAZb0Z08UEyj4-ywQ.text: Looking at all my reviews you're gonna think I have a soft spot for Mexican food and you'll be right! The wait can be a little long because of the limited seating, parking can be scarce by Vegas standards and neighborhood it is in you usually wouldn't want to be caught in after dark but the margaritas and tortillas are really worth the wait and the scarce dark parking lot. Advice to management: maybe try to better utilize the parking space? Add some lights in the parking lot?

1kEM-XblCBtW0sutCW1lHA.text: My family loves this restaurant!  My husband orders enchilada dishes,  i explore the seafood menu.  We have never been disappointed.  The food is consistently great.  The service is great as well. My kids,  who are normally very finicky  with Mexican food,  go crazy for the food here. Atmosphere is amazing, due to the decor,  live music,  and cleanliness. Only issue is that our  family of five is sat in a booth made for four.

oWVp8gXM8iZu9RCUcB-7cw.text: Came here for a date night. The food was alright, the environment was nice, but the service sucked. The server didn't introduce himself and never came back to our table after taking the order. I'm all about good service and we just didn't get it here. Super bummed.

XMO3wL6tpHq1SpRjh-O9Gg.text: I've been trying to locate good Mexican in Las Vegas and this place takes it! This place is real home-made Mexican food! It's not too fancy though, I'm not about to shove out $20-25 for a carne asada plate when $10-15 seems more reasonable.   I had the green enchiladas with chicken and they were delicious. The chips, the refried beans, and the rice were great! I wasn't a fan of the salsa that came with the chips, but that's just me. My friends liked it and I'm a firm believer that you really can't have it ALL.   The service was professional and attentive. The setting was a little loud, but when I go to a Mexican restaurant I expect to have live (or some form of) music and to enjoy the general "ambiente".  This place had just that.   I will definitely be back with adults only to have some adult beverages also. If I could just place this restaurant closer to my house in Henderson!

AVmT9kcNUOyROo3ztuM0kw.text: I think I was the only person in Vegas who has not part-taken from this hidden local gem.  I've heard all great things from everyone over the years but never had the chance to experience it.    We met some friends there on Friday night.  The parking was a nightmare.  They had a huge section chained off where I believe alot of their customers usually park.  We ended up parking at the 7/11 and our friends had to park across the street in a vacant lot.  There was a 20 minute wait and there were people everywhere inside and outside waiting.  We decided to get a drink at the bar.  The bar is big however every seat was taken.  There were some 2 seat high tables on the side so we decided to grab one and just order drinks at the bar.  So taking a look around I felt like I took one step into Mexico.  Colorful flags draped the ceilings. The decor is fabulous.  I was already sold one minute into the place. There were a couple large parties which occupied a lot of their tables and a lot of their attention...which is probably reason for everyone waiting in the front.  We were finally seated and immediately served fresh chips, salsa and bean dip.  All of it was fantastic.  The warm bean dip was my favorite.  The BF and I ordered the chicken fajitas to share and the tortillas were fresh and homemade.  It was just enough food for us with all the chips we ate! ;).    Ambiance - Beautiful authentic Spanish atmosphere!  Service - as quick and attentive as they could be being there was a full house and large parties.  Food - a definite score.  And Parking - a bummer but we lived.  Overall good time had by all!  It wasn't just a meal it was an experience!  Totally whole heartedly recommended!  We will be back soon.

JZCXVlRoVpQkIWIy5yY25w.text: Best Mexican food I've had in two years. I got the steak fajitas and my husband got the flautas with chicken. Chips are great. Tortillas are super fresh.

i55dTLbL5TKxyWKQx9l3vQ.text: I've got to say that this is a top Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas.  I drive by there once in awhile and it is always packed, so I stopped by for some lunch one day.  The place is nice inside.  It has a large bar and different dining separated areas so it  has some private and quaint booths and tables.  The service was excellent.  The waiters were fast but not in a hurry.    The food.  It was eleven in the morning so I felt like breakfast.  I had some eggs with shredded beef and my friend had the flautas.  It was all good.  I don't think it is authentic Mexican food, but it is quality Mexican food as the masses know it.    I do want to go back at dinner time and try some more items on their menu to get a better idea for how good the food is.

oTg1ilJgQpYgslDofqT-hQ.text: The wait staff and management were very courteous but the food was not tasty at all. For it to be Mexican food it was very bland and had no flavor to it. The staff saved it from being rated with one star.

im3-BPBFVqlnyyeoCNI_iQ.text: Love this place, always have great food and amazing service. I never leave disappointed.

S-X54gmrS-V7B6vsmIETBg.text: Viva Zapatas Mexican food is the best Mexican food we've had since moving to west coast from NY

OOhHzIZZeKiqeEuvdsf3cQ.text: Love this Mexican Restaurant. Everything was so good. Gorge helped us and he was nice and professional. We will be going again on our next Vegas trip.

n37iJ_H8NjufMSU_sbAG7g.text: Authentic flavor, great customer service, quick to bring out your food, friendly, attentive and always make Birthday surprises fun. Favorite Mexican restaurant in town!

zb4N_ufQeOzjzfY-3edGOw.text: Unfreakin believable. I give this place a "6" out of 5 stars ! Service was spot on excellent. Food was amazing. Had the " Coca Cola sauce Pasilla Chilies Rib Eye steak, cooked perfectly medium rare. "  It was so tender and flavorful, that I almost ordered another meal to go. Jorge was my waiter and he was one of the best waiters I have ever had, anywhere. Hats off to this family run Mexican gem of a restaurant. Do yourself a treat and visit this establishment. You will not be disappointed!

xXDFufCK5CSmxlyviIAfMQ.text: Worst restaurant ever, use to be real good but over the yrs it went down hill!  Guess their more into the money than the food ...  So where to begin ...  If u actually turn the lights up or use the light on ur phone you'll see that the place is really dirty and not clean.  My kid dropped his toy and I had to use my phone to look for it under the booth and it looks like it hasn't been swept in yrs.  The menus have old crusty food still on it and haven't been updated or replaced since the last time I was here in 2006.    Waiters are either rude or doesn't speak English, told him several times please quit grabbing stuff over my plate.  I will not be coming back to this place!

t4VEfT6zQ7oqXi8FxziAqw.text: What I liked: The food. The tortilla chips were amazing, bean dip rocked (I inhaled it), shrimp ceviche (although since the shrimp was cooked, it's not ceviche) and the tamales. The service was very attentive, especially to make sure my iced tea was filled. Food came out rather quick, too, which was nice.  What I didn't like: Not having a tamale specific option. I had to order them a la carte or with an option I didn't want. I also didn't like the condition of the menus. When a restaurant's (large) pages stick together, I want hand sanitizer provided. There's no reason for them to stick together if you would wipe them down daily.  The food was just too good so it gets 4 stars.

kYwH92RTnRVPWgyslUPi7w.text: The food was delicious! Great atmosphere and good music. Our service was a little slow (reason for the 4 star) but we weren't in a rush.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo #1

Kl6eiK_0ksGWGxL0TfUBCQ.text: I am so in love with this place. It is the best sit down Mexican restaurant I've been to here. Great service!Being your appetite, you will need it.

HHfMTu395CAJcFDjX8hHRg.text: Good solid Mexican food.  a great lunch choice.  the lunch selection is on the back of the menu and its pretty good.  I get the number 6  I just bumped it up a star because another place i went too is so bad.

4dTrMSPbb3A3MUR6-Kictg.text: Ate at the bar for dinner. Gracie made me an awesome skinny margarita and hubby had a yummy house margarita. Totally agree with other reviewers. Salsa and beans with chips were yum! The soup they give us good too.   I had the #1 combo with a chile relleno, beef taco and chicken enchilada. Hubby had shrimp fajitas. Fajitas were good -normal fajitas. Coming from So Cal, I know good Mexican food. My dinner was one of the best I have had!   They also had a great guitar player which made for a really cool atmosphere. Will definitely come here next time through Vegas!

w2K-fnZp1AcizCtaYAc1Qg.text: I was really excited to try this place because my friends had told me how good it was. We got our chips, salsa and beans in a decent time. The salsa was WAY too salty and the beans tasted like shrimp. It took forever for a waiter to take our order. To the point where my friend had to go get someone. Once we finally got our order in we waited about 30 mins for our food. Our food had no tatse. We were there a total of 2 hours. You also have to pay for refills which we didnt know because the menu said nothing about it. My husband and I ended up spending $60. If we knew that we would be spending that kind of money it definitely wouldn't have been here.

pH06qXscxqh9zpGCAYD7-A.text: One of my favorite places for authentic Mexican food in LV! Love coming here with the fam!

Ix5ZjK08_O8ilNWWIzh8YQ.text: We came here not expecting much since it's hard to find good Mexican food in town. Boy was I surprised. I ordered a pitcher of margaritas and was surprised how much we got for the money. Then my food was enchiladas. They tasted just like mom's (don't tell her I said that). The service at this place was excellent. Our server Jorge was all over it and we wanted for nothing. The only negative I would say is its really dark in there and at times hard to see the menu. We just busted out our cell phone lights and looked at the menu that way. Go to this place its good!

BAcE5G8FpRDyF31H99qGCg.text: Holy authentic! I think my search for authentic Mexican food is officially over!   Their chips are super addicting, we ate two whole baskets. Comes with a side of the normal spicy and bean dip (mixture of both is amazing!)   I love the decor in this place with the colorful paper banners everywhere.   Got the usual Chile Verde (= lean pork stewed in green chile sauce) and it was extremely tasty and full of flavor.  Probably the best I've ever tasted, just because it really tasted like it had been marinated and then stewed in the chile verde. They brought it out piping hot with the normal sides of spanish rice and refried beans.  The el burro burrito was massive! Way bigger than an over-stuffed chipotle burrito, so for $9.99 you definitely get your money's worth.  Each of the meals came with Fideo which is like a pasta/tomato soup. I thought it was okay, not really for me. It was more like a watered down version of stringy spaghetti O's to me.   Service was awesome. The minute my glass of water went empty, they topped it off right away. They even pack your left over food at your table, so you're not left alone trying to pack it yourself.   I will def come back when I get a craving for some real good chile verde.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile verde
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

R4Cgweb0RLuXqcYLul0orQ.text: Bomb AF Mexican food!!! Prices are fair, comes with chips, salsa, & super dank bean dip!!! Large portions!!

rjJ5dm8h17Rl6sUxhWYh1A.text: I only ate three bites of my entree. Must have been terrible right?! Nope. It was the most glorious plate of Mexican goodness I've encountered in as long as I can reliably recall. The chili verde pork was perfection. The chile relleno bursting with flavor. The guacamole, out of this world.   It was the chorizo queso that did me in before I ever set eyes on my meal. A dish full of cheesy chorizo served with homemade tortillas made about 4 feet from our table.   Also, the best damn margarita I've ever had in my life. Did I mention the homemade tortillas?! Still fresh and warm.   Ask for Nohemi, she rocks!

FQGJdIIOMSd1b0vUJMpKUA.text: Needed a quick dinner near Nellis, so we took the family to Zapatas.  How amazing!  I've lived and traveled throughout the southwest, and this was fantastic Mexican cuisine.  I had the Carne asada plate at the waiter's recommendation.   It was perfect.  The Pico and guacamole served with it were also spot on.  If only I could have finished it after the fresh chips, salsa, and  bean dip which was served complimentary.    The kids meals were also great and the adults enjoyed yummy frozen margaritas.  We will definitely be returning often.  While totally worth the wait, make sure you allow plenty of time at dinner as it took awhile for all our fresh food to be prepared. Service was excellent and very attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada...yum!

BztKVOTNAf-NaBh0JtURZw.text: I eat here every time Im in Vegas. Their freebie chips salsa and beans are SOO good.  They have fresh homemade tortillas...  I usually get carne asada with extra friend jalapenos.  Sooo good!!!

s0NlxBEw1CovtMkjvGlljQ.text: On the way back to Vegas from the Manheim Car Auction at lunchtime, I searched for Mexican Food on my trusty Yelp App, and found another Comida Paradise in Las Vegas. One would think I would have had my fill of Comida after El Sombrero but as my Uncle Chuck is fond of saying, in my family Mexican Food is just called "Food".  To start with, the exterior looks suspect, parked in the shadow of a gas station and just off the I15 Interstate Freeway, one would expect this place to be yet another Gringo Mexican Chevy's Franchise -- but no, far from it, this place serves up some serious SouthWest Mex. I ordered the platter with chicken enchilada, taco and tostada -- y ay caramba! Sabrosa! Even if you don't gamble, it would be worth moving to Vegas and finding a home midway between this place and El Sombrero.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken combination platter with a taco, a tostada and an enchilada.  Ay Caramba - the food here is sabrosa!

23XZyssTFRxTBxBAVtKSLA.text: Great Mexican food and a place that I always stop at when I am in Las Vegas.  Pricing is great, service is very friendly and the food is outstanding!

yrIxn8O4me7alp92qT4qMA.text: This is my go-to for delicious authentic Mexican food, the best Chile Rellenos I've ever had, and service with a smile.  You can enjoy watching the tortillas being made by hand if you are eating on the west side of the restaurant.  Their hand-made guacamole is delicious and made at your table, to your taste.  The restrooms have always been clean with beautiful tile sink & counter.  Knock on wood...this place has never disappointed me yet!

kcMR4g72BEh62Gp7PJs-lw.text: If you are one of the thousand 5-star reviewers that like the food here, then good for you. We however drove nearly 10 miles out of our way because the reviews were so good, and found all of our 3 dishes absolutely flavorless. The hostess was nice, but the male waiter had a personality of a rock, and never checked on us once. There are far better places for Mexican plates.

JbRkoxplUXOcCpHiI89k7g.text: You can never go wrong with 2 for 1 Margaritas! I think this is a North Town secret!! Best chips and salsa!! I tried something new this time! I had a number 5, which is a pork/guacamole/green chili burrito, chicken taco, and cheese enchilada! This may be my new favorite! As always the service was great! Grace the bartender was very friendly and we never had an empty drink!!

gmZqtaZafh55ly0_qis0-g.text: best of vegas! real authentic mexican food!!! more than satisfied. amazing staff. beautiful musica playing. thank you!

iXPLca67wl1xg7iuGc8MFQ.text: If you are looking for the every day menu items of Chilis or the like,  this isn't the place for you.  But, if you are looking for a small restaurant that serves authentic Mexican dishes ... this place is a "Must"!  Are they sitting you in 5 minutes? No.  Do you get your drink or meal within 2 minutes of ordering? No.  Are you in a rush and looking for something prepared by a line cook? Then don't go here.  This is a medium sized restaurant with great atmosphere (there was a live entertainer when we were there). Sit at the bar or a table... Both are perfect! We started with the fresh guacamole.  My Hubs had the Burria de Chivo and I finally decided on the Pollo de Conac. Everything was delicious! The service was good (yes, a little slow... but we were not putting out any fires....) and the wait staff was friendly.  Would definitely return to this spot! Great job!

kzpf-vP_Mat4w62ASsERag.text: Food is decent but orders are incredibly slow. I placed a Togo order and it took them 40 min when then told me it would be 15-20 on the phone.  Also, they tried to charge me for the free drink that comes with the lunch special. Then they told me if you order to go then drinks aren't included and wouldn't give me the drinks. They don't state this anywhere on their menu! That's called False advertising.

lt7r484vhXejdqKGBDV5sQ.text: Really delicious food but the front staff (specifically the lady with short hair and glasses) Elizabeth I believe her name was, spoke Spanish to our waiter the entire time we were checking out. She did that on purpose so we wouldn't know what she was saying, joke is on her, we are Filipino and understood everything. It's really rude to speak another language to your coworkers  in front of your customers. Unprofessional and such a shame because the food is awesome.   *went back a second time to see if anything has changed, and literally the entire staff spoke Spanish to us. Geeze. I guess it's a must to learn how to speak Spanish if you want to dine here.

UzMW1ds5_XxbrWtusTeOYg.text: Came in for lunch and ordered carnitas. Played it safe. Everything was cold, meat tasted very bloody and unseasoned. Very fatty and the plate came with these huge stewed pieces of pork still on the bone. I haven't eaten cheap cuts of meat like that since I was a kid growing up in la. My torillas never came even when I was complaining and sending the food back. The staff was very apologetic and tried to get me to order another dish but as u can imagine...I had no appetite after that. I wouldn't waste my time trying to come back here.

5v9PtXBU-xAm_7n3OJOzIw.text: This honestly is a little, hidden gem of a restaurant in north Las Vegas. I work right down the street so this is usually my go to place on pay day Friday's.  They have tons of lunch specials but my favorites are the taco salad and camarones con rayas y crema. The taco salad is huge and comes with everything you'd ever desire. I always mix in some of the salsa too in order to spice it up a bit. The camarones are probably my number one favorite, but they're a bit pricier around $11. This plate comes with rice, beans and your choice of tortillas. The shrimp has a creamy sauce along with some peppers. Honestly it's so good, you just have to try it!   The lunch specials here also come with a drink and one refill which is nice. The food has always been great with anything I try and I especially love their bean dip which comes complementary with any meal.   The only reason I'd give them a four star instead of five is how the service can be shoddy sometimes. It's either very good and quick or terribly slow and not very attentive. I guess it just depends what day of the week you come. Either way I'll always be back for more!

I love having their margaritas. Such great tasty food! Thank you from a customer of over 10 years!!!

B8QcX7O2qllvlyCeSsdttw.text: By far the best Mexican food I've eaten in Las Vegas service is great, Staff looks impeccable, atmosphere is always wonderful for locals visitors families or just foodies .

GhDtUEugZC_AHYrDCv_p7w.text: I stumbled across this place 13 yrs ago while on my route for work. And from that day forward this is still one of the best, authentic Mexican restaurants in the valley. From the roasted chipotle salsa and bean dip and chips, to the well balanced sauces for their tender, juicy chicken and steak dishes. This place never fails. The staff is friendly and helpful, and they have a huge selection of tequilas which only add to the awesomeness of this place. I highly recommend coming here for the lunch specials (30 + items to choose from),  then coming back for dinner for the other dish you really wanted. Lol!

0CSValaaL0Qnlytt8BXoJA.text: Location is bad at bad neighborhood but the food and atmosphere is wonderful. I visit as family dinner, their fideo soup is the best in town, their music at the location by real musician is real good. Proper dimmed light with nice Mexican atmosphere. Some dinner time we have to wait 10-15 min, but now we know better time without wait.   We always get combo menus, my option is set with Relleno and Cheese Enchilada. 1 out of 10 comes with super seedy-Relleno, but 9 out of 10 comes proper sized pepper with full of cheese. Whenever we want Cheesy night with beautiful crisp chips and Fideo soup, we drive 30 min and go and eat. The best in town after 7 years of trying most of Mexican Restaurant

JRh-2Coa1I5Fu5oGwxeG9g.text: Update! Repeated visits and it's so quality for food. They have caldo de res. I feel like nobody has that. Also, they finally turned on the lights! You don't a flashlight to read the menu anymore. Best Mexican food to me, wonderful place to eat in NLV.

kOqMdHYyrX0Bidi9IiifjA.text: This use to be one of my fav restaurant s when i first moved here now its gone to crap. I shouldn't of gone back. It took forever to order and once we finally got our food he never came back to refill our glasses bring us limes or tortillas. Just horrible experience . Definitley not worth the money and definitley not fresh food. Also they re use the chips that were not eaten. Gross. Their are so many better places then this dump. Will never return

8meb4qMVW7wJoJRJya2JMg.text: This is the best, most authentic, Mexican Restaurant Mexican in Las Vegas. My partner and I ordered the veggie fajitas which came with the best warm tortilla chips, salsa and bean dip. We also ordered the guacamole made table side.   The place is named after a famous Mexican activist who stood up for the people as the government was trying to steal their homes and land. The service is also excellent. Alejandro was our server and he was amazing. As was assistant, Cesar. Thank you both for an amazing culinary experience.

TisXBdViBlW1KwW-vrPZSw.text: Everything I've had has always been delicious. Parking sometimes sucks since they are always packed but definitely worth it.

Go7X7YCIScDYX77UJpIGiQ.text: It's really great food great sevice Grace was very helpful in helping us chose our selection .Very good mole  .

tjknjLEbOHN1_-nWF9NpVA.text: We were just looking for some good food on the way out of Vegas and luckily we tried this place.  Easy to get to off the freeway. Get the guacamole!!! All our meals were delicious and large portions. We were so full after filling up on chips, salsa and bean dip. FYI-The taco shells are deep fried, I would have  liked them to not be fried, but still good.  Friendly service. We will be back.

VLk9c1UckrGMYOGJq6-_jw.text: The food is okay, but both times we've come here, the service has been extremely slow: More than an hour and a half to order, eat, and wait for our checks.

1gCIwIjc-AbjTfVnWwmslw.text: If I could give a negative star I would. This was the worst excuse for Mexican food I have ever seen,first off the carnitas were boiled and tossed in sauce (oh don't get me started on the sauce everything on the menu was covered in some shitty sauce) The food was way overpriced probably the worst Mexican food I've ever had and the tamales wow seriously I should call the police because those were the worst excuse for a tamale I've ever seen I've had better tamales in prison and I'm not joking.

iNTwtzEQqPVdsWAUQnYMAQ.text: Nice food !! The only thing I don't like is that their glasses are not cold enough for beers!

Y7BoU721iBNaak3pJNUHIA.text: This place came really well recommended by co-workers, and it was a great choice for its proximity to work. Great variety of food, I won't argue the authenticity of the food since I am no authority on it, but it has all been delicious in the numerous times I've been here. They have a great selection of well-priced lunch specials, like my favorite, numero once, the two enchilada meal (and I keep forgetting if I liked the shredded chicken or shredded beef enchilada more, but you get two to mix/match). The service is relatively fast and they are fairly attentive, helping out group make it back to work before the lunch break is up. The atmosphere is pleasant, with great vibes and regalia on the walls. Some of their facilities could use some TLC, however, and I'm unsure if the bench in the front waiting area is some kind of authentic memorabilia, but it's note exactly comfortable, doesn't seat many, and takes up more space than would probably be needed for seating while you wait for your table. Other than that, great food and good service at an excellent price!

tqMZLdmGKdIPyqAem7ozwA.text: We usually enjoy coming here even if it is quite a hike for us. Dined there this evening and arrived early for the happy hour. The hostess tried to seat us in the bar by the kitchen door (and no, it wasn't busy). We requested a different table and were stuck in a corner in the back. Our server was terrible, we waited 25 minutes for our margaritas by which time our chips and salsa were gone. I had to go to the bar for our water. The soup was dropped just as our entrees arrived, and the meal just went downward from there. With SO MANY good choices out there, it really isn't necessary to return. Like so many other establishments, WHAT HAPPENED TO CUSTOMER SERVICE?!?!?!

L3E2EPvFw0ta9ZgnQfRlvQ.text: This is the real deal of Mexican food. Super tasty everything cooked fresh and a tortillas was amazingly soft and flaky.. There was a slight wait in time, but it was well worth it, don't miss out on some great Food. I was super happy and could not finish the portions served.  Find your happiness here.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was an amazing lunch. This is the real deal

S_WNEExz47Pl-M-FnvQVUg.text: This is, hands down, the best Mexican restaurant in the Las Vegas Valley. We've tried many and been sorely disappointed, but not here. Everything, from the chips and salsa to the steaks to the margaritas, is fresh and delicious. The steaks are so tender, I'd rather eat here than the new steakhouse down the street. The different sauces are amazing!   If you crave authentic Mexican food with excellent waitstaff and some good live music thrown in, you need to try Viva Zapatas. I wish I lived closer, I'd eat there every week.

0NJuYJ28wL8iExveaq4EjA.text: All I have to say is Best Authentic Mexican restaurant I've had in a long time!! Food is awesome! Ambiance is great! I will definitely be back.

jEaII3cvlGE83vlkWD-2Kw.text: Terrible customer service.  They were so sllloooowwwww.... and the food was NOT good at all.  In fact I ordered several items off the menu and literally could not stomach eating one of the dishes.  I took one bite and knew i did not like it and they refused to take it off the bill.  I had to pay $18 for something I didn't even eat.  And to top it off, they kept speaking Spanish to me and I'm Asian!!!  Not sure what all the good reviews are about.  I'm not from the area (I'm from CA) so maybe I have a different idea of customer service and authentic Mexican is.  Won't visit here again

O5xI2eflMCbiYpQjE1W-Yw.text: Horrible experience, waited over an hour for our food just for them to forget the first order we put in, ceviche was dry, caldo de res didn't have no taste, THE BEANS and RICE WERE SO WATER DOWN AND BLAND, by far the worst Mexican food I've ever had, we had a group of 10 and NOT ONE got refilled with water once. Kept asking if everything okay when we didn't have our food.

etKK89gK5HC64b6PuQSTcg.text: IMO this place was not that good. The waiters kept bumping into my husband (never once said sorry or excuse me), my food was cold, the carnitas were like ribs and soft with bones (not crispy at all). And my tamal was flavorless and ice cold. Chips and beans were good though and they kept my drink filled. I wouldn't go back. But  my brother n law and sister n law liked their food so don't take my word for it.

JIooWGhdTHYsKVeqVN6MAg.text: I was so glad to stumble on to this place!  This Mexican Eatery has been here for about 16 years, so not sure how we did not know of this place.  As soon as you park your car you can already sniff out some wonderful aromas.    Upon entering you are greeted and your eyes will immediately start admiring some of the Mexican Revolution pieces placed throughout the restaurant.  Totally transports you to that era.  Just awesome! There are also 2 ladies making fresh tortillas.    We were seated and immediately greeted with some chips accompanied by salsa and warm refried beans.   The salsa was not great but the beans were very tasty. I knew I wanted to try their Menudo but I am always hesitant to try Menudo anywhere but home since it can be horribly executed at times. But I took my chances and I was so glad I did.  It was delicious and came with fresh made corn and flour tortillas and all the little condiments that make this dish alone something I would come back for.  The bowl is very big and I definitely took some home. It may seem a little steep at $12 but it really is a meal all on its own.  I also sampled some of my husband's combo which consisted of a beef tamale, enchilada, chile relleno with beans and rice and a side order of an asada taco.   The tamale had good flavor but was a little on the dense side, the enchilada was very tasty as well as the chile relleno but the taco was horrible, beans and rice were nice.   For dessert we were recommended their Fried Ice Cream, I am not usually a fan of if anywhere else but we opted to try especially since they were sold out of their flan. It was actually really good but I would not call it Fried Ice Cream, it was more like a round ball of vanilla ice cream coated with some cinnamon toast crunch and coconut flakes.  Still was very tasty.   Service was excellent and overall very nice place I will definitely try this place again and maybe try some their amazing looking drinks we saw leaving their bar to accompany my Menudo. Salud!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

OdX_kpLdSjdhyOQY4oSODw.text: First time here and let me tell you it's one of the best Mexican food places I ever been. Food was delicious and service and excellent. I will definitely be back soon.

8-kSJ8ywEJ92nPVYYXAclA.text: Horrible! Came here ONLY because of reviews...waited over 2 HOURS just to get our food! Not only that but they brought out the plates individually! By the time our whole parties food came out it was COLD! Mgmt was HORRIBLE, they literally argued with us regarding the cold food! Worst experience ever! Will NEVER, EVERRRR come here again!

aBHPvOt_FjZ44QEGhOFQ2Q.text: This place is amazing! Above and beyond GREAT service, incredible food, and a huge selection of beers and Tequila. There were 3 of us. .we tried the Tilapia (whole) slightly dry but VERY tasty, Carne Asada - OMG good, and the cheese enchiladas exactly what you expect.  We also had the guacamole made table side. ..the waiter was extremely entertaining and full of joy!  Best service we have had at any restaurant in months!  You won't be disappointed! !!!!!

6N99yIKQTL3XpZC9rWU0cw.text: We just happened to stumble across this place and I'm glad we did! We usually go to Leticias for awesome Mexican food but we didn't want to drive that far so when we came across Viva Zapatas, of course we had to try it out! The food is great, atmosphere is beautiful, and the staff is friendly. We will definitely be returning!

SnCMxARogLFb_tRqpqTNxQ.text: Always great service and great food when I visit here. Thankfully some friends invited me out, it's something that I would have missed otherwise.

Bseklj6nRGA5hGJmbRFKaQ.text: While the food here is good, the service is horrible! I'm still here at the restaurant and I've been waiting for over an hour for an order of 3 tacos. Nothing cosmic. Ordered drinks and food at 11:32 and it is now 12:30 with still no food. If you decide to come here, be sure to allow 2 hours for your meal.

h-rhWrLk-Dp2nSMqygrP_w.text: Love this place, food is awesome, restaurant is very clean.  Crunchy shrimp tacos, yummy

stShPcNUSFWz6TR2vAQ9XA.text: Clean, great atmosphere. I love that they bring out refried beans with the salsa! I wasn't a fan of the salsa, or the soup they brought out. My chimichanga was delicious and so was my husband's enchilada, taco, and tostada. We definitely will return!

tAmcEDLuE_EzdGwU3fNtpg.text: Really great Mexican cuisine! The menu has great variety and the pricing is excellent, especially if you're used to heading to Roberto's. My boyfriend and I ate and had a dessert for under $30! The service was excellent; the wait for food was pretty average but there was always a server checking on us and making sure our drinks were full.   My boyfriend had a beef burrito that was so large, he had plenty to take to work to eat! And he loved it, also said it was even better as leftovers. I ordered the carne asada mixed greens salad; there was a bit too much dressing for my liking the meat was cooked beautifully and I really liked the lime dressing. we had sopapillas for dessert and they were delicious! perfectly flaky and the sauce was very yummy. I really wanted to ask for another order!  we can here on a Thursday night (7:30pm) and there was plenty of seating and no wait, so didn't experience the rush. all in all, we really like the place and plan to come back next time we need a Mexican fix!

egCuhKrAUVCheNB63gIAhg.text: This place is by far one of my favorite neighborhood Mexican restaurant. The staff is super friendly and the food is great. You should definitely try their preparada it is delish!!

1w0gtk2EfyZSkQj4nRld_g.text: We've been stationed at Nellis for 3 years now and Viva Zapatas is our go to for Mexican. You can not beat their table side guacamole and margaritas. Our favorite time to go is during lunch as they offer fantastic and satisfying lunches.   The restaurant is clean, the waitstaff is very prompt, and everything runs very smoothly. The manager is always walking around checking on tables, and I always see the hostess wiping menus down when I'm walking in and out. The way I can really tell they're clean is by how spotless their bathroom is!   The only thing I could complain about is their waiting area is almost nonexistent and their parking lot is awful.. And once in awhile the chips we've gotten are stale, but when made known to the waiter he replaced them with fresh ones!

A4uq3X-yFlYcIzpSwsIy1Q.text: To dtsrt, it was eay too dark to read the menu. Great atmosphere, pretty good wait staff, excellent margaritas and guacamole. The food is pretty fair but not so good that I  would return multiple times. Maybe once every two months or so but not every Friday for date night. Give them a try, and see if their food meets your standards. We all have different taste. This place is just not going to be my "go to" location.

cnx3l7pAqj76-RoAlYYdLg.text: Solid!  The Chile Relleno Camaron is a wonderful taste adventure that you must take your mouth on. You'll be a better person after eating it.  The soup. I'd come just for the soup. The house tomato soup was the best thing I ate on our vacation. The Habanero Salsa is just hot enough to have a little kick but just mild enough where I was happily eating as much of it as I could before our meal came. When our meal did arrive it came with  fresh, homemade, tortillas!   The food easily deserves five stars and the service is superlative. Our drinks and chips were always full. Did I mention the soup?  When we arrived around 3:30 on a Monday afternoon every seat was taken and there was at least three parties in front of us. There is tiny place for about four to five people to stand in the door but after that you can wait outside in the shade. This San Francisco kid can't handle 108 in the parking lot. I don't mind waiting for an excellent meal, and it was worth the wait  but I need some place to wait that has A/C. I'd still come back in 100+ degree heat and stand outside in the shade for an hour, it is that great! I'd love more than anything to give this a five star review because I'll never forget how amazing it was but there were tiny little things that need minor improvement.   When I'm within 100 miles of this gem there is a 99.98% chance I will be back.

j7hykiugVM_yvmsG4cJUaQ.text: After reading the reviews in Yelp and a co-worker telling me about this place I have to say it was well worth the busy! The food was so good!!! This is the best Mexican food I've had in a long time! I had carne Asada enchiladas and my friend had the nachos along with Cadillac margaritas! I can't wait to come back and try some other entrees!!! Oh and customer service was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cadillac margarita
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada enchilada
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos with carne Asada (normally comes with beans and guac) but my friend don&#39;t like it.

TP7dhnS-DLm0PGI8Z3nXFA.text: Perfect hidden gem! We grabbed the Botana Papa Pepe and Taquitos Dorados as takeout for the road. The service was very friendly and even on a packed night, they made my order before the time promised and even called me when it was ready as I gassed up the car. 3 appetizer orders total was perfect for our car of hungry travelers and my daughter now magically loves guacamole. Gracias and we'll be back.  PS- Jalapenos were YUM!!

VS3RPlqv3NQ6Kn2RdIbDkg.text: Amazing Authentic Mexican Food. Eat here every time I visit Nellis AFB Quality & Price right on. Great service and ambiance. Gracie is great behind the bar, always friendly and attentive. Greet you with their signature Chips, Salsa & Beans to start. Never disappoints. I highly recommend the #1 Combo. Good Job Team..Viva Zapata's....

legSJCqoDwJruY6mzckopw.text: So delicious  yummy margaritas and soup and bean dip ! Ordered chill Colorado to be continued!

YxR5BTqRDGwpkX-FmEN1nQ.text: I love giving high ratings when it is deserved and this place gets it. I'd give a five but 5 has got to be reserved for the "nothing I say will do this place justice" eatery. This dish filled me up. Company is great. Full tummy. Super pleasant atmosphere. I would come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar from my table

D5R8fvEEBZ8k8gtsREMAxA.text: A laid back and relaxed vibe. With prompt and courteous servers (I was served by Roberto). Delicious food; the organic margaritas taste just like the ones I make at home. Definitely recommend and will be returning.

mJuG8NNFHfripffek4mPGw.text: This place is amazing. Excellent service, delicious food with generous portions. Table side prepared guacamole is worth it. There was even live music when we were there.

xZ6CwA7wTOielvSbBo4IHg.text: This was my first visit here and it might just be my last. I decided to eat at Viva Zapatas over Que Mas mexican restaurant and I totally regretted it.  I ordered the 2 tacos combination plate with rice and beans and it was an epic fail, because this place is stingy with their meat. No joke!   There was about 2oz of meat in both tacos combined and it was disappointing to say the least. No flippin wonder there was an avalanche of lettuce in my tacos.   I paid about $12 for a crap load of rice, beans and taco shell and very very little meat. In all honesty I hate it when restaurants are stingy with their ingredients.  I was still hungry so I ended up ordering 2 additional tacos and 1 tamale and made sure to tell the waiter to ask the cook to put more meat this time around.  When the tacos and tamale came out I would quickly find out that this time around wasn't going to be any better. Even though there was more meat it tasted horrible. The beef in the tacos were super dry and the tamale was probably the worst I've ever had in my life... seriously.  Overall this was probably the worst mexican food I've ever had and I'm just wondering why in the heck it's a 4 star joint.   In a nutshell this was memorable in a very very bad way and I'm definitely crossing this joint off my foodie list for good.  Thanks but no thanks VZ!

dRligvbnHRGSgJmKrkTfAQ.text: Awesome cheap Mexican fare a short drive from the Vegas strip.  Who knew?  We went a bit out of our way during a day trip (between visiting Red Rock Canyon and Hoover Dam) to check out this place on the recommendation of a friend, and we were not disappointed.    The food is nothing fancy, but it's real, and it's good.  The guac is a highlight - made tableside, fresh and flavorful (at about half of NYC prices for the same).  The atmosphere is festive and the service attentive.  A ton of locals/regulars is never a bad sign either.

Pl12RSEvBPlQD7eEhYFxCw.text: The place is great, food came super fast, It has been hard to find a good Mexican restaurant here in Vegas, but I think I found one

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Cadillac margarita

uReWZz9bV_RiAomMBP72DQ.text: Ate dinner here tonight. Sorry that we didn't take any pictures of our meals. The food and drinks were delicious. Especially the Queso Condido con Chorizo. Our server Ramon was excellent, and so was Osmani. Will definitely be returning.  Good service, good food, good drinks = A GOOD TIME !!!

7TRIHa8Vjv2r9Vopqni4yQ.text: The good thing? The food is delicious. The bad thing? Waiter doesn't speak nor understand English very much! It was easier to point out what I wanted then speak to him. Ummm, this is America, people, learn the language! Great atmosphere with someone singing and playing the keyboard. The servers were attentive to our needs but it felt like overkill being watched as I ate. As soon as I put down my bowl, someone was ready to take it away. The tables are a bit small to place all our food and drinks on and it took forever to get our bill. I don't know if we will be back.

zgASu-DOYW1bBkEX_y42ow.text: I am still thinking about my Chile relleno and it has been hours since I ate it. The menu here is giant, with more items than you could ever hope to try in your lifetime. I would love to try all of the family recipes most of all because those are truly unique. The live music, the wait staff, and overall service are top notch. It is a louder restaurant, especially when someone has a birthday, but great for families and groups, while still maintaining enough intimacy for a possible date night environment.  The food itself shows devotion to small finishing touches and detail. Instead of plain rice as a side, veggies are mixed in. My dining companion ordered a burrito and it was nearly the size of a loaf of bread. For real, you will get enough food to take home, so be prepared to have a second and possibly third meal out of what you order!

oGicKvhvFOmnUUDd27L9hQ.text: THIS WAS AN AWESOME FIND! Took a road trip with my Dad, and he guided me to this place, awesome. Very few places can pull off the authentic ambiance and Mexican flavor. I dare say it gets close ( I said close not there) to my Mom's cooking.  Went here for brunch on a Sunday, mellow.  They bring out chips and a good salsa, next when you order they bring you SOPA!/soup as an appetizer, included. Huevos con chorizo, are great. Next time I'm in Vegas, will make the trip over to this place on my break from rolling the dice.  Worth the trek or cab ride if your looking for a hangover cure.

CUskL4j-JD748hcNGaA31Q.text: This was our first visit and am so glad we read about it on yelp!  The service was incredible, the food absolutely delicious,and the ambience was festive. Great food at a great price!  Will be one of our favorite places to go!

rN17hn__wkBh5dTgELOR5w.text: Close to Nellis AFB, one of the closest mexican sport bar around... Overall review was awesome... Our waiter Antonio was excellent at providing excellent service by being aware of all his tables.. Making sure our chips and dips was never empty.. And his sense of humor is great.. He was always polite and always have a smile on... Their live musician has a very strong voice and very good on the guitar.. Atmosphere was dark-- setting the bar mood but really bring you into the Mexican theme..! Food was amazing-- the chips bean dip and salsa was unlimited and very delicious, I had their enchiladas de mole.. Which was rich with mole sauce but a bit too cheesy for me.. But still Sooooo Gooodddd!! You got to try this if you're ever around Nellis AFB! Or just in Vegas itself!!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bottom right is the Enchilada de mole!

72YmdBwReqCfuvWwX_lQkA.text: Service was excellent. Our server Ramon!!! Was the best. Environment was great food Outstanding thanks....

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips n salsa
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco beans n rice
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super burrito

OvYa_f-VazkBxZ-53pBnqQ.text: We  have been here many times before always have had great food how ever tonight was not good the food did not taste as good as it has in the past I had fajitas the plate was hot but my food was only warm by time I got to the second tortilla it was cold and hard. I  have not given up on this restaurant yet I will try again. Maybe an off night?

CXH5mGj_njzZ0yZfLEpCAQ.text: Unreal!    Who would have thought that North of Las Vegas you could find a Mexican paradise. The food here was so good...I blew right through my New Years diet and will likely come back again tomorrow for the same.   The service is impeccable and the staff are on it. Whether the live music is every night, or I just got lucky...it was perfect.   Try the carnitas!  But beware the bean dip and salsa will have you almost full before the meal arrives.   Loved it!!!

gpQVttCAaUqhohrFwn5_SA.text: Oh me oh my that was some delicious Mexican food. By far the best I have had in Las Vegas and the best I have had outside of Austin.   Only negative was my whisky and soda, however I should have known better and just got it on the rocks.   This is a restaurant and a bad drink should not dampen this amazing food, and besides the margarita I got next was spot on!   Fresh made tortillas!!!

ZcgrdStEQ0tNKDagG4ehUA.text: Food is amazing! Huevos rancheros are to die for! Mini sopes are real good also. Carne asada in them is so tasty. They start you with fideo soup. Which like noodle soup the Mexican version. We have been coming in the morning so not sure if they serve the soup all day. Honestly food here in las Vegas is amazing. So many hidden treasures. This is one of them. Moved from San Diego. California they aren't very many good authentic Mexican places. Not pricey either.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelet a la mexicana no regrets here!!
Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks so simple but its so good

S7pUzabQ4qVBhsrr78GJmg.text: Fantastic restaurant. Despite it being packed, the service was prompt and the dining room was very clean. Everyone in my party loved what they got including myself. The two quesadillas I got had just the right amount of ingredients and two of the people I was there with raved about the chicken. The bathrooms were also very clean and the sinks were these cool copper basins. To top it off, the place was reasonably priced.

thrBGZ4ZNhhV6m4aTbdWEg.text: first off the service was okay. didn't feel welcome and the waiter was not too attentive considering it wasn't crowded at all.  the other staff made sure our chips and water was refilled.    salsa was okay and bean dip was pretty good.  they make homemade tortillas so it was interesting watching the lady make them.  the food was okay.  being from california and spoiled it definitely wasn't the best.  i probably won't be going back and will try to find another one here in las vegas to curb my authentic mexican cravings.

U5z8JTIvfvJ0sOHQ45Pqzw.text: Loved this hidden gem! Definitely felt like I was at home. Customer service was amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Zapatas Mexican Restaurant & Cantina - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing Camarones al mojo de ajo.

LBKsJcJFvPL6Ea8_supOfQ.text: this place was awesome! First trip there yesterday will definitely go back. The entire staff, from the hostess at the front, to the servers and bussers, everyone was super friendly and made sure we were enjoying our meal. The tortillas are so fresh, u can see them being made in house at the back of the restaurant.  Also had live music. I order the Enchiladas de Mole (sp?) and hubby got fajitas. At first the prices seemed a little high, but when the food came out we found out why. The portions were large and the food was excellent. My enchiladas were just cheese but the mole sauce was delicious. Came with grilled chicken on top, side of rice & beans and yummy soup. Hubby fajita meat was seasoned well. Only came with 2 tortillas to rap but when he asked for more, they came out hot and fresh.  Only downside to this place is the parking. It's behind a gas station so the parking is very limited.

INUt5ReMRVJ_P1OYVMh1Kg.text: The food here is awesome and authentic. My favorite here is the cilantro ribeye. If you're ever in Las Vegas I would highly recommend trying this restaurant.

VBOxcTYCSCUWh2JaD8CwOg.text: Were do i start? I have been coming here since i have lived in Las Vegas. That will be about 14 years. It has the best carne asada and chips and salsa. Gosh they load u up on the chips salsa and bean dip. My favorite thing to eat here is there shreeded beef crunchy tacos. The fideo soup reminds me of when I was a kid. If you want the best meal on this side of town. This is the place. American or mexican this is the best resteraunt in the North!

d-Lpqo3wn21kigHSD4yTmg.text: Good food. I like to take a friend who knows Mexican food and he orders for me. Service from the drink servers is better than the waiter. One was so excellent I contributed to him directly. When I went alone with the kids, my waiter looked like he had no patience for us. We do not speak Spanish and he treated us like outsiders. I needed help with the menu because it is dark in there and it is hard to read. He was no place around to help. When the waiter finally did come around, he still acted like we were bothering him. So I suggest to take a Spanish speaking person with you when you go. It is too bad for the waiter but the food is good. The prices are on the high side. Minimum $10 for appetizers dinner plates run $15 to $30 a plate.

iYR55NIwmYcllOkzDr9prQ.text: I like the food here, sometimes the service lags a bit.  The parking is rough.  The menu is very extensive and make a choice quite difficult.  The locations is far, but worth it.  I love the avocado shrimp salad, very fresh.  They prepare guacamole at your table and it's good.  There is a lot to explore on this menu.  As mentioned before the chips and tortillas are fresh.  I'm looking forward to trying their cactus appetizer.  When you are leaving don't forget to get a mint, yum.  I pondered over what they were and finally asked.  Key lime after dinner mints.

V5LSjDWiSGuEjfrlCCVZnQ.text: I love this place there pollo sarandeado I think I got that right is the best tasteing plate ever. Usually I get full with there chips bean dip and salsa and only eat half my plate, but this place is very good. ohh and I always take there flan to go I have never tasted a better flan than theres.

mQUmAKt9N5vvojmHKTT-lQ.text: We walked into Zapatas at 2 in the afternoon on a Saturday. We had a party of 5. The restaurant was virtually empty. We ordered one margarita each, and snacked on the chips and salsa; excellent. Soon we began to wonder if the order for margaritas had gone through to the bar. We inquired, and were told " they will be here shortly". After waiting 20 minutes, our margaritas finally arrived. They tasted great, but were not worth the $14 charge. We asked, and there were only 2 shots of liquor in them. We then waited an additional 30 minutes from the time we ordered our food. The food was presented well, but upon the first bite, we noticed something was off. The shredded chicken in my husband's taco salad tasted and smelled like tuna! We were convinced it was tuna, and the waitress said that it indeed wasn't. My husband didn't finish his meal or get anything else because it literally smelled so disgusting. Then, I noticed that my salad was missing 80% of the ingredients that it included on the menu, and that my grilled chicken was dry and chewy. Our service was great, that was the one upside.

1zBDMWtdHUAZUXii2J74wg.text: If you can't find a spot to park, then there is a good chance you are about to eat a good meal! Cute quaint little restaurant. Outstanding made to order table side, guacamole dip! Generous portions, and super speedy service. There's nothing I hate more than to wait around for a long time for food with two small kids. Courteous staff too! This is only my second time eating there, I am certain to go back. And to save money, I will make sure to go at lunch time. The lunch menu will save you a few bucks, and you get the same great food!

ryIk7wfa_QrCLKLtdVRljA.text: wow!    Service ..............5 stars Food ...............   5 stars Atmosphere......5 stars  I was completely overwhelmed by the friendly and excellent service we experienced here.  Everyone was so friendly and the service was so FAST!!!! I mean my hubbys glass was always full, food came out super fast and man was it GOOD!  I love Mexican Food and my hubby and I have been looking for a good sit down place to go.  Viva Zapatas delivered! We went on a Sunday and there was a nice gentleman playing guitar and singing traditional mexican songs. It was a great background and not too loud.  He was really really good! You can actually get fresh homemade tortillas here!!  Yummmm.    If you are in the area or in the mood... this place is a MUST TRY!!

NiGJ51s44GYYRfDX40EL5g.text: If you are in Vegas, and you want really delicious mexican food, you owe it to yourself to eat here.  The first time I had the Cochinita a la naranja, and the second time I had Pollo en Pipian. Both were fantastic, and the horchata (free refills!) was delicious.  Seriously, eat here.

-1ABEoIU3Vtb-ee9o_ytFw.text: Good service. I had the #1 and the chili relleno was awesome and they use shredded beef in the taco versus ground. Tableside guacamole was good. The price is.in the middle but worth it.

zrP7_GugYj45YP3hNcf5cg.text: I have been eating here for many years the food is the best and i have always been overly satisfied when i eat here.

RaV4EFQZ3M-AN9kMglCipw.text: Wow! I have been to several Mexican restaurants in my day, this one stands out from the norm. The staff was very friendly and provided excellent service from beginning to end. The menu selection is one of the most impressive and biggest I have ever seen with regional variations to their entrees. There was no feel of commercial big-chain restaurants and the musician playing guitar and singing older traditional songs by the entrance made the place feel complete. My visiting family enjoyed every thing we ordered and I wish I had ordered the table side guacamole after seeing it made at the next table. I WILL go back there.

yCgvFoSxrYUxYJ9VJnAaQA.text: .I had the best Mexican meal ever here. Since I read that lunchtime can be crowded and dinnertime had limited parking, we opted for a 3:00 lunch/dinner meal. Shrimp fajitas were very tasty, not overly spicy and not "ole bay" ish. I added some bean dip & salsa to my fajita, which made the meal over the top. First time ever to have soup in a Mexican restaurant, but now I will miss not having it to start my meal. Staff met us at the front door and never stopped attending to our needs until we left the same front door. Awesome is all I can say and glad the Yelp reviews lead me to this excellent Mexican restaurant.

nX5TtUJQbkFl_QxOYFdFXQ.text: Best Mexican food I've had in Las Vegas.  Really good service during a busy lunch hour. Chips and tortillas are made fresh, good salsa and guacamole too!

e1gi_Vnc21pMqKiCyTQxYQ.text: In particular for not being in a great area this place is friggin sweet!  Salsa dynamite. Shrimp was excellent. Great Guac. Solid all around.

1qfYtwaaJ6w_2Zut4NeZMg.text: We moved here a month ago and stumbled on this place. Since then it has become our #1 Mexican restaurant in Vegas and we have been there TWICE. The food is delicious and the chips not only come with salsa but also refried bean dip. The customer service is excellent; they will continuously check up on you and ensure all is well (to include drinks being topped off). It's a bit smaller so usually you'll have to wait a few minutes for a table/booth but I have never had to wait as long as they predict. The parking lot is a bit small too but both times we've simply parked next door and walked over. There has been live music both times but it has been acoustic etc so it isn't overwhelming. We went on Cinco de Mayo and it was great too. There were even Corona girls there passing out little Corona shawls for your beer bottles, and there were drink specials too. Love this place.

_EyZUvr8Z4kFFSiW76w18Q.text: Went here with a coworker for lunch. Venue and decor was very nice for a Mexican food place. Chips with salsa and refried beans for dipping as a free appetizer. He ordered a chicken enchilada. I ordered a burrito and enchilada combo platter. Food was amazing. Prices were above "average". Service was top notch. Our drinks were never empty. Plates were cleared promptly. Definitely going to this place again!

ny8m0lRys_vVjoI8c__5Cg.text: Typically, WHAT HAPPENS IN VEGAS, STAYS IN VEGAS, right???  But I need to tell EVERYONE that WHENEVER IN VEGAS, you gotta make the drive out to visit Viva Zapatas!!!  THIS PLACE IS WONDERFUL!!  From the decor, to the food, to the music, its all amazing!!!  The owner greets you personally and can I just say that he is great!  Thanks for tequila shot on my bday!!!  woot woot!!  VIVA VIVA ZAPATAS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Tr1arSKC_rzjkvOXY4rWzg.text: First of all, it's in a horrible location unless you work out that way or drive a truck.  It's very dark inside with traditional decor.  Thbe menu is pretty extensive.  I ordered the chile colorado.  The gave free chips with warm refried beans and salsa.  The chips tasted slightly burnt and te salsa was kinda bland.  The colorado was a litte tangy and lacked the depth of chile flavor.  The service was good.  Not worth the trip out thee but decent if you are nearby.

UnwQ49zIH7CGdn8IHCAYVA.text: Let me preface this with I am from San Antonio, TX and have been DESPERATE to find decent Mexican food in Las Vegas. I saw the great reviews of this place on Yelp and also the parking lot seemed to be pretty busy (a good sign) so we stopped in.  We were given chips and salsa to start off with along with a bowl of beans (very very bland). I am a big fan of homemade chips since it's easy and makes all the difference...these were from a bag.  There were 5 of us so we had a pretty good run of the menu to see if this place was legit. We are also from all different parts of the country so this place was given a fair shot. We ALL thought our food was pretty bad and the service was horrible as well. I had a chicken chimichanga which I didn't eat because it came as beef. When I asked to skip the salsa on top and have them put cheese she said they had to charge me an extra $1...seriously?! Beans and rice had ZERO flavor and even my 4 year old said he didn't like his food. Also I asked for tortillas that NEVER came...we asked three people for the check before finally being able to pay for horrible food...I will not go back which is a shame because I wanted this place to live up to their hype.

x5coTUDI1-xigqPj3Axu-g.text: I really like their food.  But, there is no parking, and spending an hour looking for a place on a busy street is no longer worth it.  There is also usually a waiting line, which moves rather quickly, but there is no place to wait.  People are stacked on top of each other or outside.  There are other Mexican restaurants and I think I'm going to find on.  I wish they would find a better location.

zOc7r-B7A9cDm3imEHkCIQ.text: Viva Zap is the type of restaurant I love to frequent.  It's not part of a chain, most likely a mom and pop (and grandma and grandpa) establishment that doesn't serve fast food, but good food fast.  Growing up, I didn't have the maturity to eat other cuisines. Having lived near the Mexican border years back, I had access to this incredible food made by people who took humble ingredients and made them taste great. Mexican isn't one of my favorite cuisines, but I appreciate it being available when I have that urge.  I originally wanted to get menudo, but it's only available on the weekends. Instead, I picked what I remember from the menu as "goat soup" or something. Braised goat meat in I believe is a tomato-based liquid.  Was a tasty meal, but I left looking like a crime scene happened on my clothing. Good thing I tend to wear darker hued clothes. Was going to order the quacamole, but thought against it, too much food for me to eat.  Will go again.
